Reviews.Title: “Clean, central, friendly, helpful fab staff”
Reviews.Author: 4nniebago
Reviews.Content: Perfect central location for all the main sights, close to trams, restaurants and most main attractions are within walking distance. Clean, well appointed rooms, breakfast with a great view on the rooftop. I simply cannot praise the staff enough, they spoke brilliant english, could answer all our questions and were very knowledgeable about the area. Wouldn't hesitate in staying here again if we make it back to lovely Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Maltesers_FJ
Reviews.Content: The staff were friendly and warm. They were patient with all our questions and the level of service and cleanliness overall was just fantastic. It is located very centrally so most of the main attractions were within an easy 5 - 10 minutes walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, new, walk to main sights, great staff”
Reviews.Author: azogal
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel with excellent service and hospitality and excellent location. Positives: We had a large Family Room for 3 people which was very clean, comfortable, and modern. It was located on a quiet street in Sultanhamet within a 5-minute walk to all the big sights such as the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sofia. The rooms still feel new with updated plumbing, electrical (many outlets for charging), heating/cooling, and sound-proof windows. The rooms have safes, kettle with tea and coffee, mini bar (while inexpensive it is still more expensive than the little store across the street), hair dryer, and many toiletries. The wifi is free, fast, and reliable and they have a laptop you can borrow. We used their private transportation to/from the airport (50TL paid in cash) and we had absolutely no problems. The breakfast was free and we didn't have any problems. Breakfast was served until 10 and we didn't arrive until at least 9:20 every morning and there was plenty of food and items were refilled. There was a different selection of food on different mornings. One morning they were out of cold milk for the cereal and someone ran and got some and brought it to our table. On nice mornings, it was very pleasant to eat on the rooftop terrace. If you eat outside BEWARE the BIRDS! The first morning we put our full plates on an outside table and went back inside to get tea the birds ate from our plates. The staff (front desk, housekeeping, and breakfast room) at this hotel is incredible. They are nice and helpful and extremely hard working. We were there for 4 nights and the same people were always working. Twice when we were waiting in the lobby and the rooftop terrace they brought us Turkish coffee and Turkish Delight. One night they left us a bottle of wine and a basket of fruit. They also gave us a gift when we left. It was nice being so close to the main sights, as we had to try multiple times to get in the Blue Mosque and the Hagia Sofia. They have postcards, maps, and guidebooks for sale in the lobby. Negatives: Noise. You can hear people in the hall and some noise from other rooms. One night we were woken at 3 am by people in the hall saying goodnight to each other and then we were woken again a few hours later by an early morning alarm in another room. No stopper for bathroom sink. The breakfast room is cramped with tables too big for the space. In spite of the negatives, if I were to return to the Sultanhamet area of Istanbul, I would stay here. Nearby restaurants: Bereket DÃ¶ner take a left out of hotel, turn left at intersection and it's the first kebab place. The food was good and cheap and most diners were locals. The owner is really nice and friendly and not pushy. Sultanhamet Fish Market is across the street and down from Bereket DÃ¶ner. Food is good and people are nice. We ate here for dinner twice. Rumeli/Mozaik has outdoor seating and we had a good dinner. Take a right out of hotel and jog left. There are tons of restaurants on this street and Rumeli is closer to the main street with the trams.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff close to sights”
Reviews.Author: traveller50london
Reviews.Content: We arrived very late ( airport seems to have a capacity issue ) but Hotel had taxi waiting. Welcome at a late hour was warm and helpful. Clean hotel with very willing staff- one even stuck my shoe together. Quiet in an area of mosks.

Reviews.Title: “Real Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Surya B
Reviews.Content: The hotel's location is amazing. The staff is super friendly and helpful. The rooms are cozy and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jana A
Reviews.Content: The hotel is an excellent choice if you would like to visit the historic monuments in Istambul. The rooms are extremely clean. The bed is comfortable, that is important after a long day. The staff was helpful and in a hight professional level. I wormly recommand this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable stay”
Reviews.Author: svb28
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely, intimate hotel in a perfect location for touring major sights of Istanbul. Easy walking distance to the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia, Basilica Cistern, Topkapi, Archeological Museum, etc. The tram to other locations is similarly close. The staff was uniformly warm, generous and helpful. The room was clean, attractive, and well appointed and the shower nice although small. We made good use of the free wifi and in-room tea. I really enjoyed the breakfasts with the array of cheeses, yogurts, olives, breads, pastries, fresh fruits, and eggs, as well as coffee, tea, etc. on the roof with nice views of the area including the Blue Mosque. We didn't eat much of the processed type meat slices or sausages. We did not experience any shortages of items. If we were lucky enough to return to Istanbul, we would hope to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “An AMAZING hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sara E
Reviews.Content: Iam truly amazed by how this hotel is managed, there is so much to praise, The owner himself (Mr.Harun) answered my emails & he even called me just to make sure that all my requests are clarified before my arrival. The staff (Meryem, Omar & Ozcan) are pleasant, polite, knowledgeable, extremely helpful with everything & they speak clear English which is very helpful. Our room is spotlessly clean, spacious with free Wi-Fi & the beds are really comfortable. Great breakfast with lots of varieties such as fruits, Turkish cheese, cold meat, Jams, pastries & lots more. The Blue Mosque, Aya Sofya & Topkapi Palace are all within literally walking distance. The TRAM station is only 1 min far from the hotel which is very convenient for sights further away. You can find lots of restaurants with lots of choices around the hotel. This hotel completely lived up to my expectations & I would definitely recommend and stay at the White House again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Hotel in the old town of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: GabriellaMaria19
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is located within 5 minutes to all places of interest. The reception was very friendly and helpful. The rooms were very neat and clean. I give only 4 stars because of the beakfast which was very poor. Guests had to ask for coffecups, for brad, for everything. The tables were not clean. Cleaning service: very good Reception service: very good Breakfast service: very bad

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Jamboys
Reviews.Content: The staff here are so friendly, helpful and informative. Great recommendations on all aspects from travel, restaurants, Turkish baths, etc. The hotel is in a great location. Strolling distance to all major sights in sultanahmet. It's clean and decorated to a high standard. I only have two problems. Not enough cupboard/drawer space within the rooms and the breakfast was poor. Four large bowls of olives, another four of syrup/jam/honey and five plates of cakes or biscuits filled up half of the buffet. These bowls came out everyday too. The more popular plates (scrambled eggs, salad, fresh bread rolls) were not replaced whilst I was seated. Small changes like adding freshly squeezed juices, fresh fruit salad, regular top-ups and a changing menu would be nice. I am only making these comments in a helpful manner to improve what is already a nice place to stay. I do also note other reviewers have left similar comments. These don't seem to have been addressed yet. Having said all that, I was pleased with the hotel for my first stay in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “This is really value for money”
Reviews.Author: age35
Reviews.Content: We visit hotell White House in March 2012 and we are very satisfied. Nice room, kindly staff. The staff get you to feel that this hotel is your "home" in Instanbul. Going to Istanbul ?? Don;t hesitate - book White House hotel !!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Nieuwerkerk aan den Ijssel, The Netherlands
Reviews.Title: “An amazing hotel in an amazing city”
Reviews.Author: Expat1956
Reviews.Content: We stayed a few days at this hotel but honestly we would have been happy to stay forever. The staff are friendly and helpful while remaining highly professional, but they balance this expertly with the kind of care and attention that you rarely find these days. The location is ideal for visiting Topkapi, Blue Mosque and Hagia Sofia (about five minutes on foot) and there is a range of restaurants within a very short walk. I really can't fault the hotel or the staff and will definitely be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in the old part of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Elina P
Reviews.Content: The location is the best. Hotel is very clean.The staff are very friendly and helpful. Thanks to Meriem, Cafer and to everyone

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Skiboatfam
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel last summer and had a wonderful time. The staff was always pleasant and extremely helpful with everything. The rooms are neat and very clean. The hotel is located in Sultahmet Square within walking distance to the Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque, Cisterns, The Bosphorous, many restaurants and many other sights. They include breakfast on the rooftop terrace dining room with amazing views. Great value and they speak English.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in the old part of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Dubaiexpat7
Reviews.Content: Second time I have stayed here. Hotel is spotlessly clean, everything in the room is in good working order (two small things to note re the room- shower drain was blocked and safe worked intermittently). Breakfast is upstairs in their rooftop dining room - great views on a clear day! Very friendly staff who are always happy to help. 10 minute walk to the Grand Bazaar. Hotel transfer service to the airport was unreliable though - after booking and prepaying, the driver never showed up. I waited 25 minutes and then ended up having to take a taxi to the airport in the hope of not missing my flight!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Stanka A
Reviews.Content: White House Hotel Istanbul is an excellent hotel while visiting Istanbul. The location of the hotel is the best, employees are very friendly, speak very good language, the rooms are outstanding and I recommend this hotel to all visitors to Istanbul. To repeat, the location is excellent, all importang places to visit are 5 or 10 minutes walking distance from the hotel. I wish to thank the personnel of the hotel for making our stay excellent and when returning to Istanbul I will always stay at White House Hotel. Stanka Andrakovic Jasminka Vrbanovic Sanja Juris

Reviews.Title: “A gem in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Chris I
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a long week end in Istanbul. We stayed at the White House and found the staff to be very helpful and attentive. They arranged for a pick up from our flight at the airport. We arrived late evening so this was so helpful in getting us to the hotel in approximately 30 minutes. We were offered a choice of rooms one with a balcony and a second slightly larger room without the balcony. As it was early March and the temperatures were very low we felt that it was unlikley that we would make use of the balcony so chose the larger room. It was spotlessly clean and although on the small size had all the amenities that would normally be found in a four star hotel room. Breakfast was included and was self service in the restaurant on the hotel roof with views of the Blue Mosque and the Bosphorous. Apart form breakfast we did not eat in the hotel but followed the advice of the reception staff on resturants in the immediate vicinity. We were not dissapointed there is a very large choice of cusine on offer within a very short walking distance and we enjoyed every meal especially the seafood at the Sultanhamet fish restaurant which is withina 2 minute walk. The hotel is well located within very easy walking distance of the Blue Mosque, Haggia Sophia and the Grand Bazaar. The rooms on the street side can be nosiy in the morning, as the town wakes up, especially with the call to prayers. It is best to keep the windows well shut but the room is equiped with air conditioning and heating so this should not present a problem. Whilst nothing to do with the hotel be warned about the shoe shine men walking the streets. They drop a brush just in front of you and if you pick it up or try to draw their attention to this you have already fallen into their web. Beware of their con tricks! Apart from this we found the people charming but you need to keep a sense of humour towards the numerous shop keepers trying to entice you into their shops and selling their wares. Some of the comments that amused us were: "Come into my shop I have everything except customers!" "It is almost free" We hope that you will enjoy your stay in the White House it is a great base to explore the extraordinary city that is Istanbul and the staff are eager to assist in any way that they can

Reviews.Title: “great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: psuhellcat
Reviews.Content: everyone was so friendly, and the hotel was in a perfect location in sultanahmet to see all the sites very easily! the room was big and the beds were comfortable, and we had no problems at all. i haven't a single complaint!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: ERS123
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the White House Hotel for 3 nights over a long weekend and were very pleased with our stay. The staff were overwhelmingly nice and helpful, whether it was with internet, extra tea bags, directions, or anything else. We always felt like we could ask the front desk for help on what we needed and they were happy to help. Good value, with a substantial breakfast buffet included. Great location. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - Can't fault it!”
Reviews.Author: Paula W
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel - I cant find anything wrong with it! The location is fantastic - 5 minutes walk to the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia, loads of restaurants really close by, safe to walk around. And the hotel itself is clean, attractive and looks freshly painted. We had a triple room which was a great size for 3 friends, 3 separate single beds, a lovely shower, TV, tea and coffee making facilities, and fridge/minibar. It was clean and really comfortable, and we were happy to spend time relaxing there. And the price was also great (esp for the great location) - 109 Euros a night between us. The staff were really friendly, always jumping up to help when we came in. They were happy to call a restaurant for us to check detaills and they organised transfers to and from the airport. The breakfast was also excellent - in a covered roof terrace. Lots of choice - cereals, cold meat and cheeses, bread, Turkish food, fruits. Basically I cant fault the hotel and I will be recommending it to everyone I know!! Thanks for a great visit and making our holiday to Istanbul so memorable.

Reviews.Title: “A home in Instanbul”
Reviews.Author: Comment56
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend the White House Hotel for a stay in Instanbul. The entire staff (especially Meryem) were friendly and helpful throughout our stay. Our stay started off with a welcoming coffee and we were treated to wine and fruit in our room. The staff assisted us in arranging tours, airport transfers and dinner reservations. The hotel is in an excellent location - close to many of the key Istanbul sites. The rooms were in excellent condition and very clean. I will definitely stay at the White House on my next visit to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful experience”
Reviews.Author: Voja P
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very clean. Hotel's staff are friendly, always with smile. Even if you are in Istanbul for the first time, in this hotel you will feel like you are at home. Hotel is in the most beautiful part of the city, walking distance from major attractions.

Reviews.Title: “White House Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sunnydays24
Reviews.Content: Great Location for Old Town Istanbul, Professionally run and staff are extremely helpful..only downside is the size of the rooms unfortunately, I was a lone traveller in a double room which I found to be inadequate re storage for suitcase etc . In my opinion the hotel would have been better to create less rooms but with more space.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for a city trip - outstanding value and service”
Reviews.Author: Bernd232
Reviews.Content: Hello, I just visited the hotel for a three day city trip with my family. I was overwhelmed by the great hospitality and the perfectly clean hotel. The rooms are great, free wifi in the entire hotel, perfect breakfast. Nice rooms, superb furniture, flatscreen TV with all the international and Turkish channels. The location couldn't be any better, 3 min to the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia, 7 Min to the Grand Bazar, and only 10min to EminÃ¶nÃ¼ river bank with all the good boats where you can buy fresh fish. I will certainly go back to Istanbul and for sure I will stay at their hotel again. Last but not least, they offer free airport pickup if you stay three or more days (a perfect thing) and they also bring you back for the fair price of 7,50EUR. You have a private transfer so that means that you can be at the airport in 30min, traffic conditions permitting. Thank you once again for the great days that I spent in Istanbul for my father's birthday.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL, BETTER SERVICE!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: IZATRINI123
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel with my wife and we have a wonderful time. The service was second to none an the location was perfect. We recieved a hand written note thanking us for our stay, in the modern time we live in no one takes the time to write letters anymore. I would recommed this hotel and we are sure to stay there again if we ever visit Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Helix72
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the White House Hotel from November 23 2011 until November 27 2011. The hotel was clean and we could not have picked a better location from which to walk to all the sites in Istanbul (or take the tram when our feet got tired). Breakfast was okay, but no worse than what most European breakfasts consist of. The staff was incredible--they instantly responded to every need you had. I also thought the cost of the hotel was reasonable for what we got (especially given the location). Did I mention the location? The only negative was they were a bit pushy about rating them on TripAdvisor when we checked out. I was planning to give them a highly positive review anyway and it wasn't overbearing enough for me to change my opinion. Our room faced the street and we did not have any issues with noise except when we left the windows open. For some reason, we found that many places in Turkey keep room temperature well into the 70s and that is a bit warm for my taste.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: john0151
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the white house in september 2011 and found the hotel to be in a central location with many of the sights within a few minutes walking distance. the hotel itself was a really nice place to stay and all the staff helpful and attentive. we could not fault anything about the hotel and would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel, Perfect Staff”
Reviews.Author: Ergs
Reviews.Content: Amazing stay over 3 Nights. From the location to the great staff within a spotless Hotel; there is so much to praise, like a great breakfast with beautiful views, spacious rooms and a superb greeting and leaving as well as being picked up from the Airport! Quite Simply; You Must Stay here when you decide on Istanbul!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolute perfection !”
Reviews.Author: Sanfranciscan94118
Reviews.Content: First of all, there aren't enough superlatives to describe how wonderful a stay I had at the White House Hotel. Without a doubt, what make this place so special is the staff; each and every one is delightful, genuine & will go out of their way to make you feel "at home". The location is perfect, and a stone's throw away from all major attractions. Breakfast is delicious and plentiful, in fact, it's enough to keep you going until dinner time. Having previously worked in Hotel industry, and travelled the world over, I can state without qualification, The White House Hotel is simply the BEST of the best! By the way, the entire facility is ALL non-smoking for which I'd award a 6th star, if possible!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, Great location = Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: John B
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic small hotel in Istanbul. We found it through reviews on Trip Advisor and it certainly lived up to the other fantastic reviews that you find here. First the location is exceptional. So close to Aya Sophia and the Blue Mosque and also not far from the Grand Bazaar. All are easily in walking distance. We also found some great restaurants nearby. The tram stop was also very close which made it so easy in our short stay in Istanbul to travel further afield. The staff were so friendly and helpful. Bags were delivered to our room efficiently and the staff on the front desk could not have been more helpful with directions or other enquiries we had. They always smiled and made us feel very welcome. The rooms were clean and well presented. Breakfast was fabulous with one of the best breakfast views in the world-from the terrace overlooking Aya Sophia, the Topkapi Palace and the Bosphorous. Great food selection too. I would so thoroughly recommend staying at this hotel for anyone travelling to Istanbul

Reviews.Title: “TLC & Location”
Reviews.Author: philinkl
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best boutique hotel I have stayed at. The service is excellent with Tender Loving Care staff who are always available to make your visit to Turkey a wonderful experience; the management and staff made us feel like family.Talk about location.....the White House is located 5-7 mins to 4 of the must visit sites in Istanbul - Blue Mosque, Aya Sofya, Topkapi Palace, Grand Bazaar and 10 minutes to the Spice Bazaar and waterfront. Good food is only 75 meters away. I would definitely recommend and stay at the White House again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Staff are excellent location amazing.”
Reviews.Author: Dhireen
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights. Staff very friendly and helpful always there when required, made our stay in Istanbul even better. The loctaion cannot get much better for the sites and the grand bazzar. Only downside is the noise but nothing to stop us from going back!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoy Turkish hispotility then visit history”
Reviews.Author: ABDULMAJEED A
Reviews.Content: Feeling part of family where they care of your comfort and relaxe, answering your quiries, responding to your needs. Location is very much stratigy if you are planning to see the historical city in Istanbul - walking max 5 menuits to the important places as well the Tram station . You can take your breakfast at the roof where you will enjoy fresh air and relaxe to plan you day, or you may have it in the room, i feel welcome for both cases. I was surprised by a lot of things from day one they send me big and comfortable limozain to bring me from the aireport for free. Just walking 2-3 menuits you will find very special shops and restorants etc. Gacozy in the toilette and very clean and whit furnitures in the rooms, i feel they considered house keeping on top of thier wonderfull daily services.

Reviews.Title: “Personal and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Ruki74
Reviews.Content: The best aspect of this hotel was the incredible staff that made it feel like you were in your own home. It was not stuffy and impersonal like the big hotels. It was my birthday and they upgraded us and decorated the room as it was our anniversary too. Nothing was a problem and everything was done with warm and sincerity. The owner of the hotel answered my emails and made sure all my requests were met before my arrival. Great location to the Bazaar, mosque etc and the hotel rooms are gorgeous. I received an engraved plate for my birthday, once again the staff were gorgeous, we would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “A Turkish Delight”
Reviews.Author: Reeny_NZ
Reviews.Content: A truly pleasurable stay in this charming boutique hotel. The positive reviews attracted my husband and I and we felt well rewarded. Location is excellent: a few steps away from the historic square and many of the major attractions (Hagia Sofia, Blue Mosque), and under ten minutes walk to the Grand Bizarre in the other direction, yet still located on a quiet little street. The staff went out of their way to help, offering for us to choose which room we wanted (we were in off-season), to serving complimentary apple tea and Turkish Delight. The room was clean, pleasant and had a hint of Turkish charm. Highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic hotel experience!”
Reviews.Author: daba1961
Reviews.Content: This hotel completely lived up to the reviews we had read previous to booking it! Everything was wonderful. The staff is outstanding and the service and hospitality we received was top notch from the moment the driver picked us from the airport and delivered us to their doorstep. The location is convenient to all of the sights, markets, transportation etc. Our room was spacious and comfortable and we would not hesitate to return, given the opportunity!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service, great location and a a very confortable room.”
Reviews.Author: Claudiacruz
Reviews.Content: We would like to highlight the quality of the hotel service that was perfect due to their personal Meryem and Omar. They were fantastic, kind and very helpful. The hotel is very well located, close to the main atractions and to the tram. We highly recomend it and would be happy to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: JustJeans
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the White House hotel for one night (very unfortunate) after a round trip of Turkey. As we were previously in Istanbul, I decided to leave a few pieces of my luggage at the hotel so I did not have to take them with me leaving them for over a week, and concierge was very helpful. The White house is located in a very central area of Sultanahmet, 3 minute short walk to the tram stop (for the airport) and a stroll to the main sites (Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia, Underground) of Istanbul. Upon our return for our stay, we were welcomed with fresh orange juice and some turkish delight before we were checked in and shown our rooms. All the staff here were so friendly and we were greeted each time we entered or left the hotel. The hotel goes down to really small details when it comes to service, such as selling jetons (tokens for the trams) at our convenience for no extra cost. Although a small hotel, each of the rooms are beautifully decorated and are very spacious. The rooms are clean with personalised white house linen. Lots of little boxes in the bathroom covering a wide range of toiletries. The only draw back I have of the white house is the shower. The water pressure wasnt quite high enough but it wasnt a drip either - managable. Breakfast is served on the top floor with a view of the city. A good variety of food was offered. I have no hesitation to recomend this hotel to travellers and I regretted not staying here for longer. Thankyou for making our stay so warm, welcomed and enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place!!!”
Reviews.Author: Aigul A
Reviews.Content: White house hotel is a very nice and comfortable hotel, even it is small. There is an excellent staff and great service in the hotel. Also a good location, in the middle of Sultanakhmet and it's easy to enjoy the sights. There are plenty of local restraunts around the hotel with really tasty meal!!! I am thankful to all staff of the hotel, I wish them good luck & success !!!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific small hotel in section of old city”
Reviews.Author: Lori706
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed there in October 2011. The location is great, within walking distance of many of the key sites. The staff was first class, very knowledgeable. We were greeted very cordially and anytime we needed help in finding restaurants, streets, etc. they were right there to offer suggestions. It is a small hotel but the room was sufficient for us, the room decor is very elegant. Although we had no view from our window, it looked out onto backs of other buildings, we didn't mind as it was quiet and we were out sightseeing, etc. most of the time. They have a small rooftop restaurant which served a nice choice buffet for breakfast. Overall we would recommend this hotel without any hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel!!! Staff was very accommodating to our needs!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Elisha B
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at The White House Hotel in Istanbul for a few nights!! Our plan was to only stay 2 nights but we liked the staff, the location of the hotel and the breakfast so we decided to stay one more night. The staff was very friendly and very accommodating to our needs... We arrived and the reception and they gave us an evil eye to wear on our shirts.. Very cool.. They also had a welcome drink for us and turkish delights... They also recommended restaurants to go to and a couples turkish bath (Hamam).. The Hamam was a very cool experience.... Please stay here! You won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “A most enjoyable stay in an excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: PJGWenlock
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. The staff were very helpful in all respects, booking a restaurant for us and making sure we got to the concert on time. The room was clean and comfortable and they even organised a breakfast tray for us when we had to leave early for our flight home. Peter & Kate

Reviews.Title: “Great location.”
Reviews.Author: AlfonsoIII
Reviews.Content: Wonderful service, most of all, location. Comfortable and clean rooms. Next to all main attractions in Old Istanbul. Great Price

Reviews.Title: “Superb service”
Reviews.Author: Lazyeye3
Reviews.Content: The strong point about this hotel is definitely the staff. We could sensed that they were sincere, warm and friendly. My family and I stayed 5 nights and felt that it was value for money and the beds were comfortable and clean. The hotel has an interior that is a feast for the eyes as well. Breakfast is served at their rooftop and it has a breathtaking view. There is a proper heater installed, thus, breakfast would still be comfortable at the rooftop despite the cold winds of winter in Istanbul. However, maybe they could have a variety for breakfast and we had the same selection for 5 days. The rooms also had wifi connection which was good. The location is also near to many good restaurants, souvenir shops and tourist attractions such as the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sofia. The hotel is also in a strategic spot where the tram station is easily accessible and really nearby. We wish to thank the staff esp Omar and friends for their excellent service rendered.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular service! Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: daisyfae
Reviews.Content: From our complimentary ride from Ataturk airport, to our personally presented gift on departure, the staff at The White House is extrordinary! I have traveled extensively, and the level of service at this hotel is in the top tier. We were treated like royalty - language barriers were no problem. Even the housekeeper we met every morning patiently helped me with my tourist Turkish. Traveling with my two adult children, we requested the triple room, and it was worth the extra price. Plenty of space for the three of us! The location is perfect for visiting the historic sites of Istanbul - all are within a short walk, or taxi ride. Breakfast is included in the price of the room - and the view from the rooftop lounge where it is served is absolutely lovely. Service staff during breakfast attend to your every need. Good variety of food is offered, and fresh coffee is available. I highly recommend The White House if you're planning a visit to the old city within Istanbul! I hope to return!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in all respects”
Reviews.Author: Raffaele769
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel in all respects: staff very courteous and helpful, excellent location to visit the old town on foot, clean and comfortable rooms, great value for quality and cost!.

Reviews.Title: “Going the extra mile”
Reviews.Author: DavitaJ
Reviews.Content: My family and I (wife and I and three adult children) in three rooms spent Christmas Day, Boxing Day and the day after at the White House. The location is central and means that to visit any of the traditional tourist sites such as the Hagia Sofia, the Yerebatan Cisten or the Grand Bazaar that you can walk there in less than 15 minutes. A self service breakfast is on the rooftop terrace and is satisfactory with boiled eggs, local pastries and cereals. Coffee, tea and fruit juices are on tap. Of particular interest for breakfast viewing are the gulls circling around the domes and minarets of Hagia Sofia and Blue Mosque that can be seen from the rooftop terrace. Were offered complimentary transfers to and from the airport because I booked 3 rooms. The attention detail is excellent because the staff noticed from our passports that it was my twin sons 25th birthday and provided a surprise birthday cake - albeit at breakfast! My wife and I also received a complimentary bottle of wine and fruit. Well done. What would I change? - the beds were a little hard. The rooms themselves were first rate, clean, with good showers, a safe, minibar and small flat screen tv.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional experience !”
Reviews.Author: 4LoveWillTravel
Reviews.Content: Everything - from the reservation through hotel's web site, to the departure - was as perfect as it gets. Staff is this hotel's strongest point - very friendly, but professional, and always kept smiling. All of them are great, but I would not do injustice by mentioning few names: Samet (restaurant, room service) and Cafer (reception), plus two ladies covering reception together (I apologize for not remembering their names). Room (Family type) was spacious enough, very clean and well-kept. It was facing back yard, nothing much to see, so we had curtains on all the time. Beds are comfortable. Standard room equipment: reasonably sized TV set, safe deposit box, complimentary WI-FI Internet access ... Bathroom could be little bigger, but it's fine. Breakfast takes place on the roof level, and offers nice view to Sultanahmet area. Food is average, same selection every day, but it didn't bother us - we were among the last ones having breakfast every morning, and even just a cup of coffee would make us happy :) Location is another very strong point. You can reach most of the key spots and historical sites by walk. Also, tram is in the neighborhood, and you can use it as cheap alternative to taxi to reach other parts of Istanbul. You can get tokens for tram at the reception, plus all the possible advices/directions you are looking for. The area around hotel is full of so-called 'restaurants for tourists', where you are almost pulled in by staffers, but do a little research on your own, and you will find much better places - where locals eat - and your satisfaction is guaranteed. Istanbul is a great city, and our stay with White House Hotel made it a week to remember.

Reviews.Title: “White House Hotel in December”
Reviews.Author: MÂª Dolores F
Reviews.Content: The hotel is the best choice, at least from my experience. It's near from everything, at a walking distance from Grand Bazar and Spicy Bazar, and of course from Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque and Topkapi Palace. It's a very familiar hotel, that is, at it has just 22 rooms, the staff become to know you well, and give all types of facilities. Breakfast is the only thing to improve, but even though, I will definitively choose this hotel for my next trip to Istambul. It has no swimming pool, but in December it's not necessary; and Istambul is to go around as much as possible. It is in Sultanahmet, a wonderful area to quietly buy, eat, and leave everything at the hotel, as it is nearby and in the heart of the most relevant Turkish historical heritage. Also very interesting: one free ride from the nearest airport (or having to pay a supplement, if from the other); they asked for 20 euros (45 Turkish lira) for the ride back. In general, excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bhupendraa
Reviews.Content: White house hotel is virtually situated in the heart of the old city and at a walking distance from almost all 'must see' places in Istanbul. Though there are several same cost budget hotels in the vicinity, the management of the hotel tries its best to distinguish itself from others through its personalized services, nice reception staff and nice floral decoration of room and the bath accessories. Rooms are neat and clean though a bit small, good for night sleep but not for spending much time specially if you have small children with you. I stayed in a single room which gave this feel but the double rooms are small as well for two persons. This is the only drawback in the hotel which otrewise is excellent in all respect. However, you will hardly spend much time in the room in Istanbul because of so much to see outside and so close. There are several very good restaurants lined up within 100 yards serving all kinds of authentic local food and suitable for all pockets and tastes. There are many souvenir shops in the vicinity and you can visit everything walking. So minus the size of the room which can be ignored, the white house is a very good option for sightseeing in Istanbul and when you check out, your have your farewell with a packet of local sweets...something you are bound to remember.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel with very good Staff !”
Reviews.Author: Gullivanter
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night both at the beginning and at the end of our holiday. It is a lovely and very clean hotel in a very convenient location, but what makes it stand out is the really great and helpful staff. We were offered both an early check in when we arrived in Turkey and a late check out on leaving. At all times all the staff we met were very friendly and helped with any requests or queries we had. In all a great experience and we shall go back if we pass through Istanbul again !!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alessandra R
Reviews.Content: Dear Hotel Staff, Let me sincerely congratulate for your excellence in everything you did for us. We have highly appreciated your level of service. The hotel has a very comfortable location, the room was gorgeous and the staff extremely kind. We will certainly recommend your hotel to whoever we know is planning to visit your wonderful city. BR, AR & Family

Reviews.Title: “Don't look any further!”
Reviews.Author: trixiefig
Reviews.Content: My stay here was excellent! Every need was met with sincere smiles. Cannot say enough about this great little boutique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Tripadvisor ranking flatters this hotel”
Reviews.Author: UKScientist
Reviews.Content: I am surprised that this hotel ranks so highly on Tripadvisor (currently 5th out of 722). It's certainly not a bad hotel, but it's not a great one either. The room was okay, but it was rather cluttered. There was an unwanted single bed in our double room which made space tight; the double bed was so close to the wall that it was hard to get out of one side. There were a few basics missing, such as a bedside table on one side and a plug in the bathroom sink, and the bed was hard and uncomfortable. By far the worst thing about the hotel was the noise in the room. Walls and doors were not sufficiently soundproofed and I was woken up early by cleaners and other guests on a couple of occasions. Breakfast was served on a roof terrace with good views, but the food was disappointing. The restaurant didn't appear to be operational and there was no bar. The staff however were excellent and the location was good if you want to be close to the key tourist attractions. I stay in a lot of hotels and I would say this one is about average for its price.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel in Old city”
Reviews.Author: Raheel J
Reviews.Content: A cozy and warm hotel just like home away from home .....the moment we made the booking and from the hospitable email from Harun till us leaving from the hotel we were treated like VIPs ..Special thanks to Cafar, Elif ,Omar Mehmetand rest of the staff. they were very helpful to cater all our needs and guided us well to move around the city and major tourist attraction , Cafar's restaurant recommendations were excellent. We booked a double room and were travelling with 2 kids so Harun upgraded us to family room with no extra charge .nice welcome drinks on arrival and gifts upon check in and check out our entire stay was excellent and any body who wants to stay in old city should stay at this hotel as it is the best one around. Thank you white house will definetly stay with you people if i came again to Istanbul

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel ! Outstanding Service !!”
Reviews.Author: FabioHazin
Reviews.Content: This is a small, but excellent hotel. The staff treats you as you were a true Sultan !! Extremely clean, fantastic location. One of the best hotels we have ever stayed.

Reviews.Title: “a home away from home”
Reviews.Author: raffi m
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently visited Istanbul for the first time and do not know what to expect. We booked at the White House Hotel because of its convenient location to all the attractions. Little did I know that hospitality of the crew is yet another attraction to behold. From the day we arrived to the day we left, we were treated as VIPs. Omar with the orientation, Muhammet with apple tea and Turkish delight, Elif with following up on whatever we needed and of course, there is Chafer who even bought a bandage for my swollen ankle ( and i did not even ask for one). Name it, they will take care of it for you. I am a traveler. Where i stay is my biggest priority. If Istanbul is a place i visit all the time, i will be a regular at this hotel. This is a home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Central location & amazing staff!!”
Reviews.Author: glaquino1
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd trip to Istanbul and wanted to stay somewhere centrally located. It's minutes walk to major sights such as The Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia, Grand Bazaar and the Basilica Cistern, as well as fabulous little shops and restaurants. The staff was so friendly and helpful, from recommending tours, making reservations to restaurants and our Turkish bath and printing our boarding passes for the flight home. Special thanks to Omar, Chafer, Muhammet, and Elis, Breakfast crew was very accommodating as well. No need to check out the other hotels. This is the place to stay. I will definitely be back and will recommend staying here to all my family and friends who will be visiting this magical city!

Reviews.Title: “Some rooms are tiny”
Reviews.Author: P0mps
Reviews.Content: The building is about the size of a NYC brownstone. There are many hotels of this size in this area. We stayed here 3 nights. The first night we had a room on the back side of the building which butts up against an office building so when you open your shade you look into an office about 15' away. The second night we moved into a room facing the front of the building looking onto a street. The rooms on the front give new meaning to the word tiny. I would guess they are 8' x 12' not counting the bathroom which is also tiny. The street is nothing to look at so we went back to the back side of the building, left when you get off the elevator, I think they end in the numbers 3&5. The rooms on the back side are bigger and they didn't cost anymore. The rooftop breakfast restaurant has a nice buffet and a distant sliver of a view of the Bospohorus. There is a nice selection of restaurants around the corner

Reviews.Title: “3 Day Trip to Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Carolann C
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel with wonderful staff and wonderful beds. Gret location for exploring the old part of Istanbul. We found the staff very helpful( they even lent me a laptop to use). The hotel is very clean and has the best bed I have ever slept on in a hotel. So if you want a central location , helpful staff, good clean rooms, and a good bed, try the White House.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful White House, above and beyond”
Reviews.Author: zakshah
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the White House Hotel from 18/11/11 until 21/11/11, to celebrate my birthday. Upon arrival, I was picked from the airport by the hotels driver. The hotel is only about 25-30 minutes away from the airport. At the hotel, I was greeted by Omar and offered a complimentary drink and piece of turkish delight. I was taken up to my room (401) and upon opening the door, found numerous birthday balloons decorating the room, a very pleasant surprise! A few minutes later, there was a knock at the door and upon opening it, I found a waiter with a birthday cake with sparklers!! I had a superior room on the top floor, fairly spacious with a decent bathroom, the shower had both power and rain heads for a great experience. If you want a room for a view, this isn't the one, as it looked out over a number of older buildings but then I wasn't going to be spending my day looking out of the window!! The room has a TV, with a good range of channels, I found at least 6 English speaking channels on checking, but it wasn't used much! The hotel is very close to the main sites of the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia, approximately 5 minutes walking time. You can see them from the roof terrace where breakfast is served. The staff were extremely helpful in where to go for sightseeing, where to eat. cannot be faulted. I had to leave for an early flight and was surprised that they gave me a birthday present of the return trip to the airport (normally 40 Euros). I want to say a great big thanks to Omar, Harun and all the other staff who made me feel so welcome at this hotel. Bad news for them is that I shall definitely be coming back to stay there the next time I'm in Istanbul!!

Reviews.Title: “Short break in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: ML C
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well placed and a short walk to all the main attractions of sultanhamet,close to the tram line and a large selection of restaurants. The room was a reasonable size,clean and comfortable. The staff were extremely helpful and nothing was too much trouble. The view from the roof terrace was spectacular. I would strongly recommend this hotel as a base for exploring Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “The Staff Are Amazing!!!”
Reviews.Author: Diane44444
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent only 2 nights at the White House as we could not get into the original hotel upon your return from Izmir. We were concerned about changing hotels, however need not have worried. The staff were accomodating (they even stored a bag for us as we travelled south to Izmir - this made our life very easy. Upon arrival were were escorted to our room personnally with all amenities explained to us. The roof top breakfast was nice (view was great) and staff again were very responsive. When we asked for any assistance we were immediately hleped. Our transfer back tot he airport was very very early in the morning (3a.m.). we were concerned about the van originally booked. We booked backpackers and the front desk assisted us with this change. The original trip company was not happy (even though we had already paid them). Having someone speak in Turkish was a huge help. When we left at 3 a.m. staff were there to make sure our ride was ready - and a WONDERFUL touch of a white rose. Thank you thank you - what a great end to a wonderful trip!!

Reviews.Title: “A VERY GOOD EXPERIENCE”
Reviews.Author: Kapland
Reviews.Content: Service was excellent, breakfast was good, overall quality and satisfaction very good Position is perfect. Rooms a bit too small, those facing the street a bit loud, however I had an upgrade to a family room and this was more than OK. Only one lift available, a second elevator would be necessary to grant a better comfort. If in Istanbul, I would return to this nice hotel and will certainly give this address to my friends

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: hazelmustoe
Reviews.Content: we have just returned from our first visit to istanbul and the white house hotel was just perfect,clean ,perfect location,friendly staff ,comfortable room and fabulously decorated.the overall service was fantastic.would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DC390
Reviews.Content: What a treat it was to find this hotel -- neighborhood location, close to historical sites and transit, welcoming staff, and truly a taste of Istanbul. Turkish breakfast on the terrace was a perfect way to start the day; the view of the city from the terrace is extraordinary, too. I had an Immaculate and comfortable room with reliable internet access, and enjoyed the itnernational atmosphere. It was a pleasure to be welcomed back at the end of the day by the thoughtful and knowledgeable staff. I will be staying here again on my next trip, and highly recommend this hotel to other travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Anasjordan
Reviews.Content: The location , service , workers , rooms ,managers and Omar the guy in reception are very nice Next visit booking that hotel again , thumps up

Reviews.Title: “What a find!”
Reviews.Author: Jancha
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a cruise which ended in Istanbul, so a friend and I decided we'd like to spend a couple of days in the city. Fortunately, we met a very nice couple on the cruise who strongly recommeneded the White House Hotel, The hotel is the nicest boutique hotel I have ever stayed in - nicer than some 4/5 star ones too!. Staff are the friendliest, most helpful and nicest I have come across in a long time (within any hotels visited). It is central to most of the historical sites, superb restaurants and shopping. I would certainly recommend it to others. Hopefully I will return to Istanbul and if so will be heading straight for the White House Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and location”
Reviews.Author: divvy_l
Reviews.Content: The rooms are pleasant enough, there is free wi-fi, you can watch hundreds of cable TV channels and the breakfast on the roof is quite acceptable. I can't think of any flaws in the hotel. However the true standouts here which make this place excellent are the service and the location and all the reviews on TripAdvisor are justified in lauding both. The hotel is in the heart of Sultanahmet - so if you want easy access to all of the major tourist sights, and a sense of the Old City, then this is a very good base. The Hagi Sofia and the Blue Mosque itself are 2-3 minutes stroll away and the oft-lauded Cagaloglu Hamami is around the corner. There is a tea shop three doors down and a small grocery store across the road. Even the tramvay stop is not more than 100m walk away and from there it's easy going to the Spice Market and Kirakoy. There are plenty of acceptably-good restaurants nearby although for the fashionable places where the locals eat and drink you'll have to go to the other side of the Golden Horn. The service is superlative; it is personalised and thoughtful without being intrusive or patronising. Eve and the team treat every guest with a personal touch - I sat in the lobby at one point (trying to sort flights the evening after I had checked out) and I saw her greet every guest in the door and discuss all matter of things that guests were interested in with some depth of knowledge. Gifts on arrival and departure are also a nice touch. All the staff are incredibly obliging and give this hotel a massive edge. I would definitely return given these two factors. It has the feel of an apartment with a friendly local downstairs and it is hard not to feel at home.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelieveable Service”
Reviews.Author: mrcarlisle
Reviews.Content: I chose The White House Hotel from reviews on Trip Advisor,and but was still amazed at the service. We booked with booking.com for 4 nights pre cruise. Booking.com has a 2 day cancelation policy, due to aircraft problems did not get there the frist day. I emailed the hotel we would be a day late. When we arrived Cafer said he would contac booking,com and have our reservation changed to 3 nights saving us the cost for the missed night. The hotel is very clean, perfect location, and the staff cannot do enough for you,we hope to return to Istambul and if we do we will stay at The White House

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: FaithRec
Reviews.Content: This is a great choice for Sultanahmet. Everything is walkable except the spice bazaar, which is an easy tram ride. There is a great small street with wonderful sidewalk cafes within a block. I can not say enough good things about the staff. Patiently, over and over, they gave us the directions we needed. The breakfast on the rooftop was lovely, with attentive staff hovering over their home madecakes, etc. And the hotel room, although very small, was extremely clean. We had a small balcony where we could watch the city come awake and enjoyed it very much. The rooms on the back side of the hotel are larger but not as sunny and without balconies. We felt at home in this hotel and will return.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TrippinFromTheDrive
Reviews.Content: We spent one night here and were impressed with the helpful and friendly staff. They arranged an inexpensive taxi ride to the airport, opened the breakfast buffet an hour early for us and bid us farewell with a box of Turkish delight. All in all a very pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Clare and Nigel Jonik”
Reviews.Author: clare j
Reviews.Content: We were thoroughly impressed with the Hotel and its staff. The rooms are spotless, the standards very high, breakfast absolutely wonderful and the decor to die for. Situated just a few minutes from some fantastic cultural attractions this is a hotel we'll definitely return to.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: Brissy3
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a pleasant surprise, the staff were very helpful and the room was beautifully decorated with lots of lovely little touches, nice change from a standard hotel. The breakfast on the roof terrace was a great way to start the day. The Blue Mosque and the grand bazaar were both within an easy walk as were lots of restaurants and cafes. The only down side we had was that we sent a bag of laundry out for cleaning the day before we checked out and unfortunately didn't realise until we went to pack the next morning, the whole bag of clothes smelt like cigarette smoke. The staff were extremely apologetic and did offer to have it rewashed however we didn't have time.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Hillcountrytraveler
Reviews.Content: If you value good service and a great location, this is the hotel for you. On the other hand, if 5 star hotel ameneties are your highest priority, then consider the Hyatt, or the Four Seasons, or something similar. This hotel will show you Turkish hospitality, as well as a feeling for what luxury must have been like in days past. The owner/manager clearly understands what most travelers hope to find in a hotel....friendly, helpful staff and clean, comfortable accomodations. We loved our two night stay there, and the roof terrace breakfast was delightful!

Reviews.Title: “Istanbul Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Esquimalt1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the White House for 3 days.We found the staff amazingly helpful and the rooms very well appointed.Breakfast was included and satisfactory to get the day going. The location was perfect for the major sights such as The Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace and the Roman Water Cystern build in 600 AD.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: CathyVictor_NY
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel ideally situated near the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia, Topkapi Palace, and Basilica Cistern. The staff, especially Omar, were extremely helpful, recommending restaurants, helping with directions and much more. They had complimentary laptop computers which was a very nice plus once you figured out how to switch from Turkish to English. Breakfast was served on a rooftop dining room with a nice view. As an added bonus it is right next door to a Fed Ex office, which came in very handy for sending home souvenirs to big to fit in our suitcases.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: mikeinz
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent. Everything is there (historical sites, bazaars, trem station, souvenir shops, cafes). The staffs were very helpful. The room is warm, cozy and very clean. Really a gem!

Reviews.Title: “Recommended Hotel”
Reviews.Author: snarkyfarky
Reviews.Content: Great location, within a few blocks of Aya Sofia and the Blue Mosque. Clean, comfortable with a good breakfast. It was our honeymoon, and they decorated our room with balloons and rose petals, very sweet touch!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, well-located hotel with very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: ontheroad20111102
Reviews.Content: For anyone wanting to visit the main tourist sites of the old city (Sultanhamet) in Istanbul, the White House Hotel is a must. The location is simply terrific -- you can walk to all of the sites. The hotel is on a side street off a main avenue but is very quiet. The rooms are clean with lovely amenities. The rooms are not large, which is to be expected in a small hotel in an older part of the city, but they really are very comfortable and well-appointed. The view from the terrace at breakfast is very good. The staff is very helpful and friendly. The philosophy of the hotel is to treat guests as family, and they do so. I recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Well located hotel with excellent staff!”
Reviews.Author: MaugFillish
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our monthlong trip a few weeks ago and we have to say that the White House Istanbul was one of our absolute favorite hotels that we encountered on our trip. The staff was super helpful, the rooms were excellent, breakfast was charming, and we have absolutely no complaints about our experience there. Just want to express our sincerest thanks to the staff for their wonderful help throughout our stay (with laundry / reservations / directions / etc). The hotel is truly superb and I will express as much to my friends going to Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “Short but perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: leonmasi
Reviews.Content: I stay only one night with my wife and my parents and everything was so perfect. We arrived at night after a long trip from Brazil and in a few minutes i was in my room (free upgraded by the hotel). During the check in, the hotel gave to us a soft drink and a turkish candy. The staff are very atencious and pleased to help (dispate of my bad english). The location is very good and safe, near the main attractions and good restaurants. The breakfest was normal. The essential to start a long day. The hotel arrange shuttle from and to the airport, with very reasonable price. And, even stay only one night, after the check out the hotel gave to us sweet gifts. Amazing! Definitly we recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great location; wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: Thomas C
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in Sultanahmet with all major sites within walking distance. Staff was very helpful with directions, restaurant recommendations, etc. Only complaint was restaurant is now closed and no room service available.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, But Probably Wouldn't Stay There Again”
Reviews.Author: rogers222
Reviews.Content: Plus: the White House is about a year and a half old, so the facility is new and fresh. It's in a terrific location. As other have noted, it's just a few blocks from the Blue Mosque and the Grand Bazaar and other sightseeing sites. Of course, that means it's in the middle of the tourist quarter, so there are literally hundreds of other hotels in the same area. The staff is very attentive with suggestions and solicitous of input and guest needs. The price is reasonable. Minus: there is no restaurant. This is a minor inconvenience since there are a lot of dinner restaurants in the area and the hotel does a small cold breakfast on the roof terrace (with powdered orange juice!) But it's still an inconvenience, and some guests might prefer the option of room service or an in-hotel place to eat. The rooms are quite small. This is understandable, since the hotel is a narrow facade in an expensive area, and yet it might not be a place I would bring children. Overall, a nice experience, but I would probably try one of the other similar hotels if I go back for another visit.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location and very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: HAZ29
Reviews.Content: I really recommend staying in the White House when you visit Istanbul. The hotel is a five minute walk from all the great sights: the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, the Topkapi and the Cistern and lots of restaurants. It was my first visit to Istanbul and Turkey and when I arrived, the staff who all spoke very good English, were very welcoming offering orange juice with Turkish delight, followed by a cup of Turkish coffee, all complementary. The staff clearly enjoy their jobs and I found myself discussing the difference between ancient and modern Greek with our receptionist. The staff also provided very useful advice on Istanbul and ordered tickets for me for the coach to Canakalle to visit Troy. I could not have organised this part of my travel without the staff of the White House! The bus to Canakalle left very early so the hotel opened the breakfast room at 5:45am to accommodate me and my friend. One of the highlights of my visit to Istanbul was standing on the fifth floor terrace at the White House hotel at 5:45am in the darkness looking at the lit up Blue Mosque and hearing the call for prayer. A magic moment! I stayed in a single room which was very clean and pleasant. All in all, a great place to stay in Istanbul and I hope to be back in the not too distant future!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel has it all - exceptional staff, location, value”
Reviews.Author: SATravellerMaryland
Reviews.Content: The superlative experience at the White House Hotel starts the instant you arrive. The front desk staff does not just take your passport and give you a key; they bring you refreshments, sit down to review a map with you, provide you with a few words of Turkish (if you want), and assure that you have some good ideas for sites to visit. The rooms and public areas are bright and spotlessly clean. Breakfast is served on the rooftop terrace with a stunning view over the city, especially the domes of Aya Sofia. Breakfasts were plentiful and each day included different fresh pastries as well as a large array of hot and cold foods. One morning we had to make an early departure and they were kind enough to arrange for breakfast to be ready for us at 6AM. Watching day break over Aya Sofia and hearing the call to prayer ring out from various mosques in the area was enchanting. It is only a few blocks' walk to the best of the ancient monuments and also a few blocks from a tram stop. Though in the heart of the historic district, it is on a quiet street and very restful. Each time we returned from a day's sightseeing, we were offered refreshments. There is free WiFi throughout the hotel and a laptop available for use in the lobby. All of the staff (all of whom speak very good English) are genuinely dedicated to making your stay memorable. The White House Hotel truly deserves the five star TripAdvisor rating.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent all round”
Reviews.Author: LesTalloches
Reviews.Content: We were delighted with the White House. It was clean and comfortable and located within a few minutes walk of all the great sites. Also near a good selection of restaurants. The staff were delightful and extremely helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Alan H
Reviews.Content: Excellent location for visiting many of the main attractions and others are easy to get to. Rooms look great and are clean and comfortable. Staff are welcoming, polite, friendly and attentive (they will also assist in arranging airport transfers and good quality tours, all at very fair & reasonable prices). Myself and my wife were only passing through Istanbul for a short time (on our way home from a holiday in Italy) but we will definitely visit Istanbul again in the future and when we do we will be aiming to stay at the WHITE HOUSE HOTEL. Would recommend this hotel for anyone who is holidaying in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “White House Hotel Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: mollyspitcher
Reviews.Content: Our room was perfect and very clean. The front desk lady could not have been nicer as well as the young man with all our luggage. We were traveling for 2 months and must say this was on our top 3 list. I highly reccomend this hotel, it is not often you receive such a welcome and send off Plus a beautiful room.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel great location”
Reviews.Author: doreen346
Reviews.Content: tThis hotel is in an excellent location near the major attractions of this fabulous city. The girls on reception are just amazing.. friendly ,knowledgeable and always there to help . We were there at the end of Sept. and loved everthing about this little hotel. Breakfast was served on the roof terrace with great views over the city. We fell in love with Istanbul and next time we visit we will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Larissa C
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a perfect to explore Istanbul with the main sights on the doorstep or easy to reach by tram. The rooms are clean and very comfortable, the roof terrace where a generous buffet breakfast is served has great views to the Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque and the Bosphorus, the staff was ever helpful and courteous...

Reviews.Title: “'HOME SWEET HOME'”
Reviews.Author: Tricia M
Reviews.Content: Loved this place, it felt more like home, staff were fantastic, they were friendly and very helpful. They were proactive in assisting us in whatever we needed, no request was denied. The location could not be more perfect, walking distance to most major attractions. Lots of restaurants and stores in the surrounding area including the grocery store "GREENS". I will definitely recommend the WHITE HOUSE hotel to anyone visiting Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in the heart of Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: Lucy W
Reviews.Content: Highly recommend the White House Hotel. Exceptional service from the very friendly and helpful staff, beautifully decorated rooms which were always clean and tidy and amazing views from the roof terrace where the breakfast buffet was served. Within easy walking distance of all of Istanbul's highlights - Aya Sofya, Blue Mosque and Topkapi Palace as well as the tram service for destinations beyond. Hotel close by to lots of good restaurants. The Turkish delight given to us upon arrival and on departure was a really nice touch! The taxi organised by the hotel both to and from the airport was well worth it saving money and time.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location in Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: Sandytravels
Reviews.Content: The White House is beautifully decorated and the staff very accommodating. Breakfast on the rooftop is a special treat, and we ate dinner at both of the restaurants suggested by concierge. We spent 2 nights touring Sultanahmet on foot before joining a cruise. It was an easy walk to Aya Sofya, Topkapi Palace, Underground Cistern, Blue Mosque, Hippodrome. Recommend it to anyone who wants a comfortable home in old town Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great little boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fred N
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff and good location. Close to main attractions and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, perfect location, exceptional service”
Reviews.Author: David56W
Reviews.Content: This lovely boutique hotel is a perfect base to explore Istanbul with the main sights on the doorstep or easy to reach by tram. The rooms are clean and very comfortable, the roof terrace where a generous buffet breakfast is served has great views to the Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque and the Bosphorus, and the free pick up at the airport makes arrival easy. All the staff are exceptional, Omar was so helpful when I telephoned to say our flight was cancelled and we would be arriving at 6am - he rearranged our airport pick up and reassured me that our room would be waiting. They all gave great advice on what to see and how to get there, and the restaurant recommendations were excellent. Everyone was friendly, helpful and thoroughly professional. I will certainly stay at the White House again if I return to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “When we return to Istanbul, this is where we would stay again and again”
Reviews.Author: PhoebeSeattle
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel and even tried to extend our stay. They were full! The front desk staff with Elef, Mish, and Cafer were more gracious, welcoming, and helpful with our stay than we could have imagined. Along with exceptional responsiveness to our needs, they provided local information on public trams, sights, and restaurants. The entire staff was friendly and interested in quality care. Of course many hotels provide good service, but we do believe this hotel is dedicated not only to excel in service, but to hire staff whose performance is of the highest caliber. As a guest one feels genuinely cared about. The Hotel itself is immaculate and beautiful. It is elegant in style, yet one feels very relaxed and comfortable. Breakfast was wonderful with a lovely and healthy selection. We have absolutely no complaints, were more pleased than we thought possible because of all of the personal touches, and, as is the title of this review, would stay here again, and again!

Reviews.Title: “Best of everything at the White House!”
Reviews.Author: Claire1000964
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at the White House and we were touched by the excellent service provided by the staff.Elif works at the reception and is also a tour guide - this is a bonus to the quality of information she is able to give on all sites of interest in Istanbul.She is extremely generous with her time and her warm personnality will make you feel at home.From the moment we walked in the staff make it their goal to surpass customer`s expectations. We arrived early morning and we were welcome to have breakfast on their rooftop terrace.Very good variety.Gorgeous terrace with a beautiful view.Half of the terrace has a wonderful glass enclosure, therefore you can spend time there rain or shine! This hotel has four floors and an elevator - convenient for people with physical disability.Not all boutique hotels have this. My hat goes off to the interior designer - luxury furniture and relaxing decor of gold cream and beige throughout - true Ottoman decor.We were upgraded to the superior room and what a room!Wide range of amnenities,very spacious,comfortable,spotless and modern bathroom with jet shower. This hotel is nestled into a very quiet street but only a very short distance to many restaurants and attractions - best location in old Istanbul. Very generous with gifts and suprises - wine and fruit in the evening,coffee,tea and juices,candy,flowers,souvenirs...enjoy!Let them serve you with their traditional turkish coffee on gold tray ...a little turkish candy with that... We had an early departure and breakfast was arranged and sent to our room - much appreciated. Thankyou to Cafer,Omar and Elif for making us feel at home in Istanbul - your warmth and hospitality were very much appreciated.Will recommand to friends and family as the best boutique hotel in Istanbul.We LOVED our stay at the White House and will definitaly return.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel with a great location”
Reviews.Author: travelhound36
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed the hospitality of this hotel's friendly staff who always greeted everyone with a wonderful smile. They were more than helpful in finding great restaurants, getting us a cab, or giving directions to major sites we wanted to see. This hotel is delightfully cute, comfortable, clean, quiet, and the location couldn't have been better for walking to the various major attractions. Their breakfast menu had enough variety to make our dining an enjoyable and interesting experience (the native dishes were entirely new to me). Their pastry is freshly made every morning and quite delicious. It was a memorable pleasant stay and we would recommend this hotel to our friends or anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Hands down, best hotel we've ever stayed at!”
Reviews.Author: Mel102011
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay at the White House and look forward to returning again next year. The staff is amazing and make you feel welcome from the moment you step out of the taxi. Cafer and Omar are a pleasure to speak with, and the girls at the front desk are as sweet as can be. Night before leaving Omar sent up a fruit/wine basket which was much appreciated. They certainly try to take care of every little detail to make your stay fantastic. Rooms are so comfortable and clean, breakfast was perfect and the location couldn't be better. Will be back next year with our kids and can't wait!

Reviews.Title: “Expectations exceeded by far”
Reviews.Author: DirektorJ
Reviews.Content: The White House Hotel in Istanbul is your home away from home. A really nice, small boutique hotel located in the old town, only a few minutes walk to the major sights of old town Istanbul. That, however, is not the most important thing - there a loads of hotels in the area. The staff of the White House Hotel is extremely helpful and they make you feel at home when you stay there (and beyond) - we went for a trip in Turkey and they helped us organize a few things when we returned to Istanbul even though we didn't stay at the hotel anymore. What more can you ask for in terms of service? The roof terrace restaurant (for breakfast) is another bonus. We arrived as guests and left as friends. 100% recommendable.

Reviews.Title: “Cute little hotel with exceptional service and in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: email_iandsmith
Reviews.Content: I am a year late in reviewing this property as I stayed here back in October 2010. The service levels at this hotel were probably the best I have ever experienced. My wife and I had literally just arrived from a 5 star resort in Bali, Indonesia so was expectig a step down in service but if anything we had a better 5 star level of service at White House Istanbul than we did in Bali. All of the staff were fantastic, the breakfast was excellent and the rooms were clean and tidy. The location is smack in the middle of the old town and only a short walk to the Blue Mosque and other attractions. It is also only a 5 minute walk to the tram which will take you to the "modern" part of the city for shopping and great views of Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Very Friendly, clean, great location”
Reviews.Author: trvelsomemore
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to the hotel and as a welcome back they had upgraded us to a lovely larger room, very comfortable. The roof terrace for breakfast has nice views over the roof tops and out to sea. We were pleased that all the original staff from our last stay were there and made us very welcome. The hotel is in a quiet location but in the heart of the old city great for all the sight seeing and shopping. They offer a free pick up service from the airport. I have no hesitation in recommending this hotel, breakfasts are not exciting, but the staff are very attentive.

Reviews.Title: “super friendly service and centrally located”
Reviews.Author: mstifster11
Reviews.Content: my husband and i are on our honeymoon and stayed at White House Hotel for 3 nights. Our experience has been exceptional. the staff are very friendly and personable. we found a fruit plate along w/ wine when we came back to our hotel room at night, which was very nice. the location of the hotel was excellent, within walking distance to everything (blue mosque, hagia sophia, restaurants). our standard room was not too big in size, but this is the standard everywhere in Europe. room was clean. the buffet breakfast on rooftop w/ a view of hagia sophia. Harun Cadirci and the rest of the staff were very helpful and pleasant each and everytime, even reminded us about our passports before our departure, it was a nice touch. Certainly our home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel value”
Reviews.Author: Texas_Traverler
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a three night stay and the hotel fully met our expectations. Like the other reviews, I can honestly say that to a person, this is the most friendly and helpful staff that I have ever experienced. What is unique is that they are truly interested in you as a visitor to their city and helpful to your every question and need. The rooms are spotlessly clean and quiet, even if you face the front street. While a bit small, I found the size to be average or slightly better than average to most European rooms. The location is absolutely perfect. As close as you would ever care to be, but removed enough to be peaceful and quiet. The few minor things that keep the rating below excellent primarily relate to the beds. Not only are they hard, but the construction makes them squeak when moving around which for a light sleeper, could be a problem. We ended up staying in two rooms. The first had an air conditioner that moderately cooled the room, but our second room worked just fine. We encountered a problem with the airport shuttle broke down on our trip to the hotel. The driver could speak no English, so it was a bit distressing to be standing on the side of the road with our luggage and no idea where we were located, while he flagged down taxis to try and convince them to transport us to the hotel. The hotel staff was very sympathetic and covered the cost of the cab. These things happen, so I certainly don't fault the hotel, but don't arrive in town without a backup plan and directions on how to get to the hotel. In conclusion, I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone.
