Reviews.Title: “Our Home in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: RockyMountainMan
Reviews.Content: This is our second year embarking on a cruise out of Istanbul and our second year staying at the White House Hotel. This is not a 5-star hotel but it has so clean, welcoming and convenient that doesn't matter. The service is friendly and accommodating, the hotel is spotlessly clean, the location is in the heart of the historic area. Another good sign, most of the staff was the same the second year- and they all remembered us. It felt like coming home. Whenever I return to Istanbul, I will stay here.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location, perfect service”
Reviews.Author: sandydennis
Reviews.Content: Hotel service does not get better than this. Front desk especially helpful in everyway. 'Cafer', front desk receptionist could not have been more hepful and polite. Every detail from free hotel arrival transfer to many suggestions for tours was met with better service than any hotel we have ever stayed, and I use to work for the Four Seasons Hotel chain and Mandarin Oriental Hotels as well. Upgraded to very large room on check-in.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Tripper00
Reviews.Content: Service was outstanding. I stayed there last week, September 28, and enjoyed it very much. Small room, but spotless and well equipped with great shower and comfortable bed. The staff could not have been nicer and more helpful and the breakfast was excellent. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in ideal tourist location”
Reviews.Author: Peter J
Reviews.Content: Great room and very friendly and helpful staff. Excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “what a great way to end a holiday!!!”
Reviews.Author: jeroen d
Reviews.Content: My wife Kay and I just ended our 24 day holiday at the White House Hotel and what a great decision that was. The Staff especially Elif, Cafer and Mish ( a big thanks) were not only interested in providing first class service but also appeared genuinely interested in us as travelers and did their utmost to make us feel welcome in Istanbul. The location is ideal and within easy walking distance of everything worth seeing. Restaurants are literally just around the corner as are the Blue mosque and Sofia. The rooms were spotless and we were constantly welcomed by even cleaning staff. Thank you White house, you deserve your XXXXX rating. regards Jeroen dyk

Reviews.Title: “Consistently exceeds my expectations”
Reviews.Author: SusieDBoston
Reviews.Content: For my second stay I came with my husband, we were greeted warmly and with genuine affection. We were given a room that was a pleasure to spend time in, white with gilded ornamentation and beautiful drapery. Every little need (real or imaginary) was addressed instantly in the most helpful way. And when our new laptop did not want to work with their wireless Wi-FI, they just lent us their house laptop. Even when the front desk was busy, we always felt that we were important at this small hotel often catering to a full house. The person who sets the tone is Elif - she is sharp and bright and caring. Elif is an ambassador for her hotel as well as for the warm and hospitable Turkish people.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: mirandavr
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights here in Sept the hotel staff were very helpful nothing is too much trouble. Great position all major sights are a five minute walk and it is a 2 minute walk to the tram. It is a comfortable clean hotel at a very reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: amandajulia22
Reviews.Content: It was a fantastic stay - a very clean and well-furnished hotel with many nice little commodities. It has a newly renovated feel, and is incredibly comfortable and luxurious for a very reasonable price. Breakfast was nice (though could be improved by having more whole wheat bread and more of a variety of local, fresh fruits) and the view from the terrace was very pretty. The staff was very warm and helpful, and the location is really fantastic. I would definitely recommend this to a friend and stay here again myself.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ken f
Reviews.Content: The reviews you read on this hotel are for good reason. This hotel and staff are excellent. First, the staff will do everything you need to make you feel comfortable. Second, the location is perfect for the Sultanahmet district. It is a 1 minute walk to the metro, and 2 minute walk to Hagia Sophia and the Blue Mosque. I highly recommend this hotel for anyone traveling to Istanbul. You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: chert42
Reviews.Content: My wife and I and our daughter and her family recently had the pleasure of staying at the White House Hotel in Istanbul for a full week, latest August and early September, 2011. We went to Istanbul for our sonâ€™s wedding and had a continuing series of wedding-related evening functions and activities for most of our stay. The White House is a boutique hotel and lacks many of the amenities offered by larger and usually more expensive hotels and chains, but we prefer the charm and less crowded character of hotels like the White House. I cannot say enough positive about the White House. I booked our stay at the White House after reviewing dozens of available hotels on TripAdvisor. The choice in Istanbul is essentially among Sultanahmet (the old town), Taxim (the newer district on the eastern side of the Golden Horn), and the Asian side of the Bosphorus. We wanted to be able to see some of the historic mosques and other sights without having to walk or take taxis for long distances, so we chose Sultanahmet. It was a great choice. Topkapi Palace, the Archaeological Museums, Hagia Sophia, the Blue Mosque, the Basilica Cistern, and the Grand Bazaar are all 10-15 minute easy walks from the hotel. We typically did one of the historic sights in the morning and went out to a wedding activity in the afternoon and evening. The White House arranged for our taxis, which did not require advanced booking and always arrived within 5 minutes, and, in most cases, secured drivers who did not stray too far from the most direct route. We were especially grateful to Cafer and Elif, who were on duty at the White House in the evening and daytime, respectively. They were unflaggingly friendly and aimed to help us with issues whenever possible. When my daughter and granddaughter needed some hair work before the wedding, Elif secured an immediate appointment with a hairdresser just down the street. Both were very happy with the result. Because both of our families arrived together and shared a complimentary ride to the hotel, Cafer, without being asked, comped our ride back to the airport at 4:00 am because we had used only one free ride and the hotel provides one free ride for each room. My daughter was a bit under the weather for a day or so after arriving and on the second day, the maid appeared at the door with a tray of breakfast items so that she would not have to go up to the roof-top breakfast area. Everyone at the hotel was great. The hotel is quiet and on a side street with little traffic. The two rooms that we rented were the family rooms, which had two double beds, desk, and table and chairs: plenty of space for us with a modern bathroom and a shower. The rooms were clean and very well appointed: very comfortable. They do not have a restaurant: breakfast is served in a roof-top room with an open air patio. It was fine. There are literally hundreds of restaurants and shops within a few blocks and there is easy access within 5 minutes to a tram that runs over to the eastern side of the Golden Horn. This turned out to be an ideal place for us. We are not big â€œnight-lifeâ€� folks and did not look for any clubs or more trendy places for evening activities, which I am told are more abundant in Taxim. The only drawback to the White House is that the warren of small streets in the Sultanahmet area made it difficult for some taxi drivers to find the hotel. Taking a street map printed out from the internet helped a lot. After a couple of days, we had identified the best route into the area and helped the drivers ourselves. All in all, we had a great time in Istanbul, enjoyed the wedding and all of its activities, and visited many of the historic sights. Much of our enjoyment came from our being able to get places and get things done without a lot of hassle, much due to the White House Hotel, its excellent location, and superb staff. We recommend it without reservation and would definitely go back if we find ourselves bound for Istanbul in the future.

Reviews.Title: “All we hoped for”
Reviews.Author: Dorothy M
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 1st week in August this year. Very much relied on trip advisor for recommendations in Istanbul and this hotel ticked all the boxes. Ideally situated for Sultanahmet, just a stroll from all the main places one would wish to visit. Staff were all so helpful and friendly. Room was excellent, spotlessly clean and with double glazing and blackout curtains we were never bothered with the street noise. Breakfast was served on the roof terrace. Selection was excellent. The view alone was worth it, looking onto Agia Sophia, with a side view to Topaki Palace and the Bosphorous. This hotel is in a working area of Istanbul but do not let this put you off, this just lends to the whole Istanbul experience. If we return to Istanbul would certainly stay at The White House again and have no hesitation in recommending it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Truly fantastic experience”
Reviews.Author: segiocolorfam
Reviews.Content: We would absolutely stay at this hotel again in the future, and have no hesitation to recommend it to others! we had a truly fantastic experience! Hotel white house offers clean and comfortable rooms, a generous breakfast , a convenient location in Sultanahmet.Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “"Like Staying with Family"”
Reviews.Author: BROWNIE32
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived in Istanbul(a little late), a phone call from Elif reassured me that the car was waiting at the airport to take us to the hotel. I then knew it was the right choice for our three night stay before our cruise. What a staff! Cafer was a fountain of local knowledge and directed us to great restaurants nearby. He was also a pleasure to talk to. In the morning,at the breakfast ,we always saw the smiling face of Yagmur. The location is perfect and the rooms are neat and clean(although a little small). But you are in Istanbul to see the sights and experience the culture. If all the people in the world would be as charming and caring as the staff at the White House, cultural friction would be eliminated. If service is more important than glitz, this is your place.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff”
Reviews.Author: Warhead
Reviews.Content: Just repeating the views of other guests really. The location is superb, right in Sultanahmet and close to many great restaurants. The staff are courteous and helpful and there are nice little touches to your stay with them. The rooms are nicely decorated and have everything you might need, though being so central, are, as others have pointed out, pretty small. I'd happily choose the White House again for a stay in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff! Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: LuckyL3155
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights in September. Excellent staff, always attentive in any aspect. The location is very good, close to main tourist attractions. We have been upgraded to a larger room for two nights of our stay: a nice gesture. Room and bathroom are clean with all modern amenities. Wi Fi worked well. We got a bonus of a free van transfer to the airport since we stayed three days and more. Breakfast could be improved.

Reviews.Title: “My seconde visit”
Reviews.Author: RabBirmingham
Reviews.Content: In the taxi on my way to the White House Hotel, 13 months after my first stay in the newly opened hotel, I had two questions in my mind: is this 3* hotel still maintaining its 5* hotel standard? and, which words do I introduce my self to the staff as resident 13 months ago? On arrival and as I approached the reception desk I was taken by surprise by a man saying to me with a wide smile: hello Mr Hafidh welcome back, it was the manager Jaafer (Cafar), seconds later Mr Harun the deputy manager was out of his office with a very warm reception then Elif the ever smiling receptionist. Unfortunately, Omar was not in on that day. The hotel, the bedrooms, bathrooms, restaurant was just as immaculate as they were in the first days and weeks of the Hotel life. My two questions didn't survive long, they were shattered. The young and friendly management of this hotel proved themselves as unique in a very competitive environment, and in a city like Istanbul. Give them a ago, you will not regret it. It's a real value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Peter466
Reviews.Content: A very nice quiet and friendly hotel close to the main Istanbul sights. Lovely rooms, helpful staff. Metro and tram can take you to Sutlanahmed tram stop from the airport for $2. Metro to Zeytinburnu, tram from there. Buy a 2TL token at the airport metro station and another one at Z. Hotel is 2 minutes walk from the tram stop.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional customer service and superbe location”
Reviews.Author: Stefimik
Reviews.Content: White House Hotel has a superior customer service.From the moment you book, the welcome email, the free shuttle organised to collect you at the airport, the excellent welcome with cocktail and extremely well trained and polite staff. The trip was a wedding anniversary and we were exceptionally given a room at the top floor with balcony and flowers.wow.Not to mention the comfort of the rooms,the assistance with booking taxi, trips, restaurants. And on top of that, the hotel is centrally situated,in the heart of the old city. We loved Istanbul and much was due to the fact our staying at the hotel was really really exceptional. Thank you to the staff of the White House Hotel. I strongly recommend the White House Hotel if you want to experience great customer service and a warm welcome to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “stay in this hotel”
Reviews.Author: free78
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in November 2010 for 3 nights..Hotel staff was always friendly..Receptionists always gave information about area and transportation.Breakfast was enough and delicious..Typical Turkish breakfast, I recommend.. The only bad thing about the hotel is room size...It is really small...We were two people, and when we put luggages in the room. no walking area around... Choose a room looking to street, better than backside view.. I recommend this hotel. Enjoy Istanbul..

Reviews.Title: “A most memorable hotel experience !”
Reviews.Author: Brendan L
Reviews.Content: Warm, generous and helpful staff made my 8 night stay, a home away from home. A small hotel (no tour groups) on a quiet block (no noisy bars or clubs) provided a truly relaxing oasis in central Sultanahmet. Breakfast on rooftop allows stunning views of Hagia Sophia and minarets of the Blue Mosque. Outstanding staff made the hotel a truly five star experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: Kathryn498
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough good things about the White House Hotel. From the minute the driver picked me up at the airport until he dropped me back off 5 days later, I enjoyed my time at the hotel. The staff was professional and friendly - they helped with directions, recommendations and the loan of a three-prong adaptor! My room was lovely - clean and airy. The hotel in right in the heart of Sultanahmet, which means you can walk to all the Old City sights and are close to the tramway to go further afield. As a solo female traveller, I felt perfectly safe staying there. I feel in love with Istanbul and will definitely go back. When I do, I'll stay at the White House Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “OUTSTANDING, Hotel, Staff, Location.”
Reviews.Author: James A
Reviews.Content: A very lovely hotel, neat, extremely clean, attentive staff, closely located to Istanbul`s Mousque and museum. I highly recomend this hotel. It was very quiet. One will find no suprises here.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, spotless, amazing location.”
Reviews.Author: travelbugalugs
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in the heart of the old town, with a short 5min walk to all of the old town tourist attractions. Also close to the tram if you want to explore further afield. On arrival we were given a juice and Turkish delights to welcome us. The breakfast is fine with a good selection of fruits, meats, jams, yoghurt, with boiled eggs and scrambled eggs. You eat breakfast on a rooftop terrace which is a lovely start to the day. The room was on the small side but we had a balcony. The rooms on the other side of the hall were much bigger but when you spend all day exploring the town you don't need a massive room. The bed was extremely comfortable. The hotel is in a quiet street with lots of food options just around the corner. If ever we go back to Istanbul I would definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Staff go out of their way to make you feel at home”
Reviews.Author: Brenda Z
Reviews.Content: We stayed 6 nights at the White House Hotel. From the moment we arrived, we felt very welcome. The staff, without exception, are friendly and helpful. The location was superb. The hotel is within easy walking distance of all of the great sites of the old town - The Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, the underground cistern, Grand Bazaar, Spice Market and the river. The restaurants in the neighbourhood are plentiful and good value too. We would highly recommend this hotel and would stay here again if we are back in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: abetterman_11
Reviews.Content: positives: near the blue mousqe mini market next to it nice and helpfull staff negatives: small rooms no views small resturant area

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Shizuka J
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in the old town of Istanbul. We were in Istanbul in the end of August 2011. We also booked it as of the reviews from TripAdvisor. We are very pleased with this hotel. The location is perfect, 1 min away from a very lovely restaurant street, 2 min walk to the blue mosque and hagia sofia, walking distance to the grand bazaar and a number of other mosques. Very close to the tram station, which can take you to all the major places of interest, costs only 2 turkish lira. The room is very cozy and clean. Staff is very helpful and friendly. They helped us to book dinner places, advised sight seeing trips and routs, etc. The night we arrived, we were welcomed with free refreshment and little presie. When we checked out, we also got a box of turkish delight as a gift. They also offer free airport pick-ups, very friendly. Highly recommended if you'd like to visit Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Pinakamagandang welcome, serbisyo at sulit sa bulsa!”
Reviews.Author: melgee530
Reviews.Content: Libreng coach galing airport,pagdating sa hotel pinakabest welcome i've experienced by Elif (a nice receptionist),binigyan kami ng juice at Turkish sweets, tapos all around staff Samet na napakamatulungin, hindi nag eexpect ng tip, libreng agahan simple pero presko at masasarap. Wala akong masabing masama sa hotel na to, malinis at kung may kailangan ka halimbawa tissue, basurahan, plantsa o kahit ano sabihin mo lang sa reception. Pangalawang araw ko pa lang ngayon, isang linggo ang bakasyon namin dito pero gusto ko ng magcoment dahil napakaimpressive ng serbis. Magandang location tahimik ang area pero 2min lakad ay ang famous mosque,park,at tram station, may supermarket sa likod ng block at madaanan mo ang fish house restaurant na nagseserb ng fresh food. Maraming salamat White house hotel, da best ka! Asalamu alaikum

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and would gladly stay there again!!”
Reviews.Author: JulieEKK
Reviews.Content: All of the hotel personnel were very friendly and helpful! The rooms were spotless and the hotel was situated in a perfect location for seeing all the sights!! If I ever return to Istanbul, I would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cali s
Reviews.Content: Wonderful Hotel, excellent location,in the heart of historical center,nicely decoreted very clean rooms and wonderful staff.We could not ask for more.We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “A WONDERFUL HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: mcgrath-thomas
Reviews.Content: It would be difficult to find fault with this hotel. On arrival one of the members of staff greets you and gives you a helpful guide to the city while you enjoy a welcome drink. The hotel is ideally located close to the Topeki Palace, Blue Mosque and Aya Sofia with a number of nice restaurants close by.

Reviews.Title: “What a fantastic hospitality !”
Reviews.Author: AndreiFilipache
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel, with fantastic hospitality of the stuff, great location in the heart of Sultanahmet historical area, where major sites are a couple of minutes walking distance. Very nice decorated rooms, impeccable cleanliness. Average but enough breakfast diversity, amazing view from the rooftop breakfast restaurant. Excellent value for money. We'll definetly come back.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it”
Reviews.Author: JayV-NJ
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hotel from Aug 9 to Aug 13. The hotel is a small botique hotel perfectly situated smack in the middle of all the action in the tourist district of Istrabul. It is mins walk to all the attractions. The rooms are well appointed and have the latest bathroom and bedroom fixtures. What we loved about the hotel is the staff and thw ay they took care of all our anticipated and unanticipated needs. They were very polite and courteous. At the same time they tried to help us with every one of our requests. When we had to laeve for Troy easrly in the morning, they opened the break fast half an hour early just for us. They offered tips about what to see, where to go and how to go. They even arranged the trasnporation to Troy, fom and to the airport for very reasonable prices compared to the other options we explored. I will recommend this hotel any day if you are planning on visiting Istanbul as a tourist. Please note this is a small hotel (not like the Radissions and Hiltons) but if I have to choose between the big name chains and this hotel, I would go with White house.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: Leslie T
Reviews.Content: The hotel was centrally located in the historic part of Istanbul (a couple minutes walk to most of the main attractions like Grand Bazaar, Blue Mosque etc.). The staff especially Elif was attentive and full of information without being pushy. The room was clean and decent, though the shower area was a little small, otherwise there was no complaints. The breakfast was limited but sufficient and the view from the rooftop breakfast area was magnificent. But watch out for the elevator...it can be pretty slow. Overall, the hotel provided a great place to unwind after a tiring day exploring Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: chriskam7
Reviews.Content: We were a group of 10 people( family and friends ) that stayed in 5 rooms at this hotel from 9th Aug 2011 to 13th Aug 2011.It is a small boutique hotel with a lot of personal charm.It is located in the Sultanahmet district and the major attractions like Hagia Sofia,Blue Mosque,Topkapi Palace and Basilica Cistern are a two minutes walk from the hotel.Grand Bazaar is a three minutes walk from the hotel.Plenty of nice restaurants nearby.Upon making the hotel reservation,manager Mr Harun CADIRCI sent us a email stating that their driver would would pick us up at the Airport free of charge.What a nice gesture.Their driver Mr DURMUSH was waiting right there with our name card to pick us up.What a relief.Upon arriving at the hotel,we were welcomed with a big smile and a nice cold drink.The check in process was simple and smooth.Our rate included free breakfast which was served on the top floor and was sufficient.Staff at the hotel are FANTASTIC.Special thanks to Harun Cadirci,Elif,Cafer and Samvet.They truly are an asset to this hotel.Every member of our group felt we were treated more like family members than as hotel guests during the entire stay.Our transfer from Hotel to Airport was done with extraordinary ease.Kudos to Mr Harun Cadirci and his team.Would definitely recommend this hotel to anybody visiting Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel and Nice Location...BUT...”
Reviews.Author: Selasie
Reviews.Content: Travelled here with my other half and though the hotel is nice and in a central area close to everything the standard rooms are very small and only if you pay more for an upgarde you will get a decent size room. The staff is kind and welcoming like most people in Hotels and Restaurants in Istanbul but sometimes a bit over attendive trying to push you to their commisionable restaurants or Hamam which i find a bit unproffesional. Asking for a positive review on Tripadvisor is a bit over the limit also and i think people should stop asking for this. Breakfast was good quality but limited choice with many local sweets whicj i found uneccessary for breakfast. The town itself is superb and the hotel location is ideal. Also be careful on check out if your credit card is declined even though there is money in it might be the man behind the desk cancelling the transaction so you pay cash with their own exchange rate. I would go back for the location of the hotel and the nice decorated room but i would pay for the upgrade if it was a long stay.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: Sy B
Reviews.Content: The White House Hotel in Istanbul should be congratulated for their service, cleanliness, and courteous service. The desk staff, Cafer, Omar and Elif were attentive to every detail from providing us drinks on a hot afternoon (on the house) to arranging a transport to the airport. It was well situated in the historic area and near good shopping, restaurants, the tram and two hamans (Turkish baths) as well as a variety of street life. The a/c worked very well and the rooms were spotless. The roof top breakfast was just great and consistant. A great value and an authentic Turkish experience.

Reviews.Title: “Turkey is an incredible country”
Reviews.Author: Patricia1011_11
Reviews.Content: We used trip advisor to find the White House Hotel and the reviews were spot on. From the location, to the amenities to the incredible staff, it couldn't have been more perfect. The staff treated us like family and made sure that we had everything that we needed. I would highly recommend this location and hotel to anyone traveling to Istanbul!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great & friendly service”
Reviews.Author: Jay8989
Reviews.Content: Couldn't have asked for more. Great location, great service, and clean & functional rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable service, can't wait to come back”
Reviews.Author: Abinan
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 days from June 23rd to 27th. We were received at the airport by the friendly driver hotel car and we knew that we had made the right choice. At the hotel we were received with welcome drinks and check-in took just a few minutes. the room was clean, albeit a little small but that did not matter much to us. The staff was fantastic and provided top notch service, specially those at the reception desk , Elif, Jafar and Omar. They helped us with directions, tours as well as advice on eating places. All in all, a great experience. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: nyalami
Reviews.Content: We spent 3days in the White House Hotel , it was excellent Starting from the arrival till we checked out. The room was beautiful and clean, maybe a little small but comfortable , staff very friendly and helpful. thanks to white house hotel people for making our stay in Istanbul as pleasant as it turned out to be. Alsawan family

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, a real Turkish delight!”
Reviews.Author: DaanvandeMeeberg
Reviews.Content: perfectly situated - less than five minutes from haghia sophia, blue mosque, and a number of great restaurants in Sultanahmet - this hotel is a real treat: very helpful and friendly staff, nice and clean rooms (+ good and quiet AC!!), with breakfast on roof terrace with an incredible view. A highly appreciated extra:: the pick-up service from/to the airport. We would love to come back!

Reviews.Title: “An Istanbul Treat”
Reviews.Author: Mr_KR
Reviews.Content: We used the White House Hotel as a base for our first but hopefully not last visit to Istanbul, and could not have been happier with this choice of accommodation. It is exceptionally well located, permitting a pleasant walk to key attractions in the old quarter of the city or a mere 3 minute walk to a very efficient tram service for more distant places. Without doubt, however, the service levels at this hotel are its signature strength. Helpful advice, prompt attention to matters, and a constant effort to go above and beyond made our Istanbul experience so much better. Our room was a little small but nonetheless was very tidy, modern and comfortable. It was appointed with mini bar, in-room coffee/tea, cable TV, free wi-fi, and arguably the best room air conditioner I have experienced in any hotel (very quiet but effective). There was no price gouging on top-up services such as laundry, mini-bar prices, and airport transfers, which simply added to a pleasurable stay. Across the road is a neat little convenience store where simple provisions such as water, snacks, bread, ice cream and so forth can be bought in preparation for the next tour or outing. Then in any direction taken there are a multitude of restaurants to chose from, all within 3 minutes walk. Although breakfast was included in the tariff, it was probably not the Hotel's strongest point in respect of presentation and variety. Nonetheless, it was a minor detraction from an otherwise wonderful hotel that represented excellent value in a prime location. To sum it up, it is a great boutique hotel offering 4 star features with 5 star service. We will again stay at the White House Hotel should we be fortunate enough to return to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous boutique hotel, the most polite, helpful staff in a perfect old city location”
Reviews.Author: MitzSydney
Reviews.Content: This beautiful boutique hotel, was a dream hotel. Met at the airport with a free shuttle, given juice and the most addictive Turkish delight ever on arrival; prompt check-in; complimentary breakfast (since we'd arrived early) on the rooftop overlooking old Istanbul ... given maps and ideas for the day ahead. Elif at reception, so competent and always smiling seemed to be able to solve any problem from broken glasses, fail proof directions and more. We actually asked if she'd stand for PM in our country ! On reluctantly leaving we were given a box of that addictive Turkish delight as a gift. There will definitely be a 'next time' for us at the White House Hotel !

Reviews.Title: “What a trip it was thanks to staff of White house hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hasan1978
Reviews.Content: The staff is amazing very helpful.Each day we would take their advice on where to visit and the trip turned out to be amazing. I would like to give a special thanks to Elif,Omar and Samet amazing service and very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: trvlgirl73
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the hotel, the staff was extremely friendly and were very accomodating in answering all of our questions on sightseeing and restaurants in the area. The hotel is in a very good location, being a 10 - 15 min. walk to most of the major sites including the Grand Bazaar. The room was very spacious, appeared to be very clean and was perfect for our 2 night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Spoilt on our honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: MLE_travel
Reviews.Content: We had an amazing stay at the White House Hotel on our honeymoon to Turkey, and we couldn't have wished for a better place from which to explore Istanbul. Yes, the location is in the heart of the sights, and yes the room was beautiful, comfortable and quiet, and yes the breakfast was lovely, but the most memorable part for us will always be the amazing staff. Not only did they welcome us with flowers, wine and fruit at the start of our honeymoon, but they were genuinely interested in what we were doing each day, and helped with every aspect of the trip. Cafer in particular went out of his way to assist us with everything from restaurant reservations (which got us the best table, since we were guests from the White House!) down to train tickets, and made sure everything was in order during our whole stay. We can't thank him enough for making us feel truly welcome both at the hotel, and in Istanbul. When we left - a sad day - when they had finished helping us take our bags down, many of the staff appeared to come to say goodbye to us and sent us on our way with another gift as a reminder of our fantastic stay in istanbul. We certainly hope to visit again one day. We've never experienced such a personal service - these guys have got it right.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, helpful staff and lovely rooms”
Reviews.Author: AnnaNChavez
Reviews.Content: My friends and I had a lovely 3 night stay here. I cannot recommend highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in strategic position. The staff is super!”
Reviews.Author: MauroGenoa
Reviews.Content: We are 3 people from Italy and we have been in the hotel during July for 3 nights. The White House hotel is in a strategic position (5 -10 minutes by walking from the most important places!). The building is completly restructured and the room is very clean and very comfortable. The roof where we had breakfast is nice and it has a lovely panoramic view of Istanbul. But the strongest point of this hotel is the staff! They are young people very kind and nice! They gave us good suggestions and tips on what to do and what to see. They took care of us making our stay very pleasant!

Reviews.Title: “"Good hotel and excellent staff!"”
Reviews.Author: Antonio_Rosario
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a 4 night stay in Istanbul, at White House Hotel. The hotel choice was based on tripadvisor reviews and you were right - this hotel is excellent. A free shutle from Ataturk airport and a welcome drink with turkish delight on arrival, were provided!!! Is well located - about 5 minutes walking to Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace and 10 minutes walking to the Grand Bazaar. Just around the corner there is a lot of good turkish restaurants... Even the Spice Bazaar is at walking distance... Thanks to the wonderful staff, in special to Omar and Cafer that were a great help in our stay in the city. Would recomend this hotel to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Quick trip”
Reviews.Author: TeamARMZ
Reviews.Content: We zoomed in and out of istanbul in 2 days and found this hotel through good reviews on trip advisor. All reviews were accurate and we found the staff very helpful and keen to assist us. On arrival we were offered a free upgrade to a gorgeous suite whcih was lovely. It was decorated beautifully and was extremely comfortable. The breakfast is served on the terrace which has nice views. Would recommend to all.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, clean, great location”
Reviews.Author: TimJ69
Reviews.Content: Everyone was very helpful and welcoming. Just 5 minutes walk to Hagia Sofia, walkable to catch a ferry even. Rooms are nicely furnished, not massive, but a good enough size. The multi function shower took a little working out! No problems with noise. Breakfast (until 10am) on the room terrace was a great start to the day, with views of Hagia Sofia. Airport transfer was included for us and was there waiting. Great service, throughly recommended, I would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely loved it! Can't recommend it highly enough!”
Reviews.Author: BostonMigs
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the White House the last night we were in Istanbul before flying back home to the states and I must say that I've literally never felt more like royalty than I did staying at that hotel. I truly felt like the President of the US and pretty much had Hail to the Chief looping in my head the entire time I stayed there. They first greeting us with complimentary juice and turkish delights, which after an overnight bus from Izmir was heavenly. Then, without even telling us till much later, they upgraded our room from a standard to a suite FOR FREE. It was like being Jon Hamm in 30 rock and living in a beautiful person bubble. We checked in at 11 or so and hadn't eaten anything all day so we inquired about breakfast/lunch places in the area to which they simply replied: why don't you just have breakfast here today and tomorrow!? Uhm Ok! So we went up to the rooftop terrace after putting out stuff away where they had an amazing spread of eggs, cheeses, meats, bread, jams, fruit, olives, etc, all of which overlooked the beautiful Istanbul skyline and Blue Mosque. We asked them about several touristy things that we wanted to do our last day in Istanbul and they were extremely helpful. The staff was both friendly, kind, and knowledgeable. When we checked out they gave my girlfriend a complimentary scarf and necklace and me a turkish delight gift sampler. I don't know if our experience was unique (I doubt it but maybe our natural charisma and charm won them over) but if your experience will be anything like ours you should stop reading reviews, click on the hotels.com link and book this place. End scene.

Reviews.Title: “I reccomend to people that want travel without problems of hotel”
Reviews.Author: PAT82Genova
Reviews.Content: The hotel, with a small number of rooms, is situated in the very center of Istanbul; in a few minutes walking you can reach a lot of the most attracting sites in Istanbul. Just to mention some: TOPKAPI palace, Hagia Sofia cathedral, the Blue Mosque, the Grand Bazaar and others famous Istanbul places to see. The hotel is placed in a very quiet surround and you can rest without any noise also because the rooms are well isolated. Rooms are clean and well equipped: air conditioning, TVset, refrigerator,etc. But what we appreciated most is the quality of personnel that is very very kind and able to satisfy promptly any need you can have, from information about any type of restaurant, to arrange for you a nice cruise on the Bosphorus. A great help I had for a small accident that brought me to the hospital: the language obstacle was overcome only with the help of hotel receptionist acting as interpreter through the telephone. They were able to help me even after my return at home, to obtain some documents that I needed for my insurance policy, from Turkish authorities.

Reviews.Title: “They try harder”
Reviews.Author: arcbridge2
Reviews.Content: As everyone has noted, the hotel is in an excellent location and the staff (all of them) are friendly and helpful. The airport pick-up on arrival is a boon and the welcome at the hotel is first class. It is difficult to find fault so there seems no point in trying - in other words this hotel is excellent value for the rates they charge. Just a last point - the patience of the reception staff is admirable so please help them by a) doing some research before you get there or b) remembering that once they give you all the information its up to you to make a decision. (My patience isn't nearly as good as the staff's)

Reviews.Title: “Incredible customer care and attention”
Reviews.Author: Danroz
Reviews.Content: I chosed this hotel mainly because its central position and the very positive review of the previous customers. I've been in Istanbul to celebrate the birthday of my girlfriend and I received from the staff an incredible support in satisfying every whish to make this event unforgettable. The whole staff really surprise me and went beyond any positive expectation. But above all I have to mention Omar. Thank you very much for all guys.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, great location, brilliant staff”
Reviews.Author: Ally0081
Reviews.Content: I have travelled a lot around Europe and have never got service and friendliness like what i did here. All the staff were so lovely, helpful and welcoming. The hotel itself was lovely and clean and in a great location. Would 100% recommend this place to all family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel / excellent location / excellent service”
Reviews.Author: mariokouls
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews from trip advisor, me and my wife decided to book for the White House hotel in Istanbul. Being warned that this is a boutique hotel, we didn't expect a 4star or 5star status hotel, but a cozy place with good service. And our expectations were fulfilled. The White House is indeed a very cozy hotel with very friendly personnel who is willing to answer any questions and give (at most times) good quidance. It's location is excellent, next to most historic monuments as well as a convenient tram station. However to be on the fair site I would like to state the following minor drawbacks: - The location is situated in a quite neighborhood, but it is still close to a couple of buzzing tourist streets. In fact 2 out of our 5 nights there we were awaken by drunken / fighting tourists. Maybe a good idea is to choose a room not overlooking the street. - The rooms are in fact a bit small especially if shared by two. - The breakfast could have been a bit more inspiring. - Finally although this is not a drawback of this specific hotel I would strongly advice future guests to avoid taking the organized tours offered by the tour operators who co-operate with the hotels. Although we asked for the cheapest possible way of taking the Bosporus cruise, one of the staff still recommended the tour operators who co-operate with their hotel. As a result we ended up paying 70 euro (35 euro each) for a 1 hour boat trip at the Bosporus, and spent the rest hour picking up (and then returnig) the other guest from the surrounding hotels. Exactly the same trip would have cost us 10 Lira each (i.e. about 4.3 euro) if the ticket was bought from the harbor. Tram fare from our hotel to the harbor was less than 1 euro per person for each way..... No need to mention that the next day for our princess islands cruise we bought the tickets from the harbor.... :)

Reviews.Title: “BEYOUND EXPECTATIONS !”
Reviews.Author: AZW070
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 double rooms for 4 nights . We found the hotel to be an excellent place to re visit when in Istanbul. Especially of Mr. Cafer Tasdemir (Jaffer) personal attention to details while briefing the guest on Arrival. Very useful tips to make your stay enjoyable and cost savings. We found other staff's attitude also very helpful and prompt service. We were provided free Airport pick up as we booked for three nights +.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely small Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: uweurban
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the White House Hotel for 3 days and were made to feel welcome the moment we walked in. It is a lovely small hotel in a very convenient location, with lots of restaurants nearby as well as the major sights. The room was clean and well appointed. Breakfast was served on the roof terrace with great views and I was assured by Cafer the Front Desk Manager that the quality of it will get better and better.

Reviews.Title: “A real gem of a hotel which I would thoroughly recommend”
Reviews.Author: UkYorkshirelass99
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights, so were entitled to a free transfer from the Airport. We were met by the hotel driver and taken by air-conditioned mini-bus to the hotel. A warm welcome with cool orange juice and turkish delight awaited us at the efficient check-in. Our room was very clean and air-conditioned. The only down-side was the noise from the other guests on the landing outside the bedroom as the door provided little soundproofing. The location of the hotel was excellent - very close to the Blue Mosque and all the sights of Istanbul as well as innumerable good value restaurants for dinners and the metro. Breakfast at the hotel was taken on the roof-top terrace, either in the glass-sided air-conditioned restaurant or on the open terrace, both of which had a superb view of the Blue Mosque. There was an excellent breakfast selection with fresh fruit, meats, cheeses, breads and cakes. The staff were all extremely helpful and very focussed on making our stay as enjoyable as possible. All in all, a real gem of a hotel which I would thoroughly recommend!!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: kwmcnally
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a fantastic find on Trip advisor. The location is fantastic with only a 5-10 minute walk to most of the major attractions in the old city or the tram which takes you everywhere else. From the moment I arrived at 7:00 AM in the morning, the staff were great. While a room wasn't available, the staff took me up to the roof top terrace, and gave me a great breakfast. I went for a walk and by the time I got back, a room was available. There is two rooms right off the lobby and I took one of those after some hesitation. Don't worry, it is a small boutique hotel and there was no "lobby" noise to worry about. Actually the rooms off the lobby were good as typical of most european hotels, the elevator is small and a bit slow. Being right off the lobby made it really easy to come and go. The hotel is within a block of some great restaruants. Try them all. For a light snack, grab a donner on the corner... 5 lire (about $3.00) gets you a good sized sandwich. Back to the hotel.... the staff and service are great. The front desk staff helped me with contacting the airline as one of my bags did not show up and when it did, they placed it in my room when I was out and made sure I knew it had arrived as soon as I walked into the hotel. The front desk staff were very helpful with directions, recommendations and anything else you needed. They even have a laptop you can borrow to catch up if needed. Overall, would definitely stay there again if ever going to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: lakier
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the White House Hotel for seven nights during our recent trip to Istanbul. From the moment we were picked up from the airport by a courtesy shuttle till we checked out, we were treated like special guests. They did everything to make our stay enjoyable and have wonderful memories of Istanbul. The staff were very helpful, courteous, and knowledgeable, especially Cafer. Every time we asked questions about sightseeing, shopping or transportation they took time to offer their advice. Our room was spotless and comfortable. In the morning we enjoyed delicious breakfast on the rooftop terrace and good view of Sultanahmet. The hotel is located close to all main tourist attractions and good restaurants. I would highly recommend the White House Hotel to anyone traveling to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “What a brilliant hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Rudi888
Reviews.Content: As soon as we booked from Australia, we had an email from Harun Ã‡adirci, welcoming us and offering the free pick up from the Ataturk Airport. A really great experience from the moment we were checked in by Cafer and invited to be part of the family. We were on 4th floor in a lovely superior room which is bigger than the balcony rooms. Windows open out to let in the sounds and fresh air. Air con if you're too warm. 2 large comfortable chairs, large dressing table, lovely bathroom, all new in antique style and so clean. Other great people at reception were Elif and Oman. Elif even had tram tokens ready for us to save the task of buying at the stations. Oman always pleasant and helpful. At breakfast the lovely Yagmur always engaged in conversation and even baked us banana cakes for breakfast. Delicious. And Zulbiye the gorgeous and cheerful lady who prepared our room so beautifully and with lovely surprises every day. The free transfers from and to the airport were great. Having someone there to greet you, Durmus and then driver Ramazan most pleasant on our drive in. Other staff who we came across and always helpful were another Oman, Muhammet, Gihan and Samat. So If you want to stay somewhere in Istanbul where you are really treated specially, and somewhere so central in old Istanbul, stay at the White House Hotel. The price is so reasonable for the standard you receive. Minutes walking to dozens of great restaurants, (there is no restaurant hotel as such ) shopping and transport. We will stay again for absolutely for sure. GÃ¼zel. I will attach photos later. Thank you to a great team. Rudi and Annette

Reviews.Title: “Super Location ..... Excellent Staff....”
Reviews.Author: boyinjun
Reviews.Content: Absolutely loved the location of the hotel....cannot put a foot wrong...located absolutely in the heart of the Old City, Sultan Ahmet.... The staff of the Hotel extremely helpful & full of initiative.... prepared to help & guide in any which way... Couple of drawbacks, is the size of the Double Rooms... barely enough room to move around... the breakfast could be bettered !!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in the Heart of the Old City”
Reviews.Author: DallasRover
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a few days in Istanbul and stayed at the White House. The stay was excellent. From the moment you arrive your treated as though every guest is the most important person in the hotel. Rooms were spacious and new. Great air conditioning. Wonderful bath and shower. Breakfast on the roof top. When was the last time you had a great hotel stay AND they hotel gives you a small gift on departure? Shows you the level of service you will receive. If I had to make one note, it would be that the street that the hotel is located on is in transition. A bit run down, but that will change very fast as a new hotel is being built a block a way. This is the old part of the city after all.

Reviews.Title: “Super service and great hotel”
Reviews.Author: chujy006
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised by the great service this hotel has provided! The front desk guy Omar was super helpful and we were given an upgraded room for our stay. The room itself was clean and very lavishly decorated (bit like the sultans palace!) and comfortable. Location was great, walking distance to the Blue Mosque and Aya Sofia area. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Remarkable experience-great!”
Reviews.Author: jmarkert19
Reviews.Content: Remarkable experience. This is a boutique hotel (~22 rooms total) right within walking distance of all the major historical sites of the older portion of Istanbul. The staff was friendly, helpful, and made us feel almost like family. They obtained a car and chauffeur for us on rather short notice at a rate 25% below what I was able to find on the web. The rooms were clean, plenty of room and exquisite. Wonderful rooftop view --breakfast (included) was serve here, and was a delicious buffet. In the evenings, tea or coffee was also available free of charge on the rooftop, which was a wonderful end to the day. We brought our entire family, and I would give this hotel my highest recommendation for those seeking a boutique hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: Alwatban
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in this beautiful hotel for 3 days . The hotel located at the center of the old city in waking distance to all major attractions. However, the street is very peaceful and quite .the room service is very professional .

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, perfect location, perfect staff and perfect accommodation”
Reviews.Author: bahaj_abou
Reviews.Content: I use to travel a lot in all over the country, and this is the first time I get what I am looking for: It is the best hotel I never been to. It has 4 levels with 4 or 5 rooms per level. I is very quiet, clean. The breakfast is served on the terrasse of the hotel with a wonderful view of the Sophia Mosque. It is not the first time I have been in Istanbul, but this is the first time I am taking a small hotel, I was afraid of getting in something not respecting the international standard of quality....and then we arrived in Istanbul...and it was amazing : - very nice reception - very polite and respectful staff - exceptional location (5 minutes may be less from major sites) - do not hesitate to go there with a baby - they will upgrade you if they have a bigger room available for free - internet works very well and fast....for free - A/C works perfectly...no noise, no dust smell.... - for lovers, family, single...it is a excellent quality/price ration It is far away better from our french hotel for the same price...

Reviews.Title: “Close to attractions, an almost new hotel”
Reviews.Author: croftonMelbourne
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights and were impressed by this two year old hotel which is very close to the Sultanahmet tourist area, close to numerous restaurants. As prearranged, a driver met us at the airport on arrival at 11 pm. Check in was a breeze, complete with a welcome cup of Turkish rose tea. Breakfast is served on the rooftop with a mix of European and Middle Eastern choices. Service by the staff is outstanding, everyone is helpful and understands English. Nothing is too much trouble, with tourist suggestions and directions, arranging restaurants and transfers etc. I needed to print off an attachment to an email which was promptly dealt with, as was an urgent fax. All staff are excellent but we should specially mention Elif for her friendly and competent assistance. We were fortunate to be given an upgrade to our room. The hotel is spotless, with modern fit-out in the Ottoman style and we will ensure that we stay at the White House next time we are in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Traveler'sTreat”
Reviews.Author: Qinc
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a gem, tucked away in a seemingly remote spot, and yet right in the middle of the places you must see in the old city. Service was outstanding, the room was elegant and comfortable, staff friendly and helpful. Rooftop terrace was an unexpected delight. What a charming little place. I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, location, and ambience”
Reviews.Author: rfreeze
Reviews.Content: The White House is a gem. Elif on the front desk is the most cheerful, knowledgeable, and professional hotelier we have ever met. The rest of the staff were equally helpful and attentive throughout our stay. All our request for information, assistance (from room service, to inexpensive laundry, to public transit, to opening times at major historical and cultural sites, to luggage storage while we were elsewhere in Turkey, etc.), and advice were met fully and quickly. Better service than many 5 star hotels. The rooms are a little small, but this is common in many historical quarter hotels in major European cities. However, they make up for their size in elegance, cleanliness, good air conditioning, and excellent maid service, and is a very small price to pay to be within walking distance (or convenient tram) of most of the major sites in Istanbul. Harun was very attentive to our needs (free pick-up at airport, balcony room, etc.) prior to and during our stay. Omar and Muhomed were very helpful on the front desk. Elif is multi-lingual, extremely knowledgeable about what is available in Istanbul and throughout Turkey, and a very nice person. A great little hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: AlfonsoIII
Reviews.Content: Wonderful service from check in to check out. All employees went out of their way to please us. Absolutely recommended, and when we visit Old Istanbul again, the White house will be our first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: SanFranciscoDaisy
Reviews.Content: The White Hitel is in a great location for seeing the sight. Almost all of them are within walking distance. Also, there are three or four nice restaurants just a block away on a delightful narrow cobble-stone street. The hotel personnel are outstanding, very efficient, polite and unfailingly helpful. The receptionist, Elif, even walked next door to a non-English-speaking shipping company with me to interpret my request. Breakfast on their roof-top outdoor terrace was plentiful and delightful. We also appreciated the ability to adjust the room's air conditioning to our liking. Altogether, this hotel offers great value for your money and we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, quality rooms and great location.”
Reviews.Author: Gazza0844
Reviews.Content: Thebservicebwasnexcellent. Thebroom we were allocated was clean, spacious and quiet. The location was excellent being within a few minutes of most major attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Best of turkish hospitality”
Reviews.Author: abbyIstanbul
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very vell situated in the Sultanahmed area, close to the old sites. Clean and lovely decorated. Beeing an earlier residence in this lovely city, the best of this hotel is the natural and respectful turkish service not always easily discovered in the turist area. Recommended!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service AND location!”
Reviews.Author: megmeyer411
Reviews.Content: The White House Hotel was a treat. The lovely staff treated us well from the moment we walked in the door. Elif, who works the front desk, was amazing! I needed to check in for my flight and was unable to do so from my iPad. She literally went online and did it from her own computer at the front desk...it was NOT a simple process, but she was happy to do it. That is just one example of her valuable assistance during our stay. Also, the young woman who works is the rooftop restaurant was a sweetie, as was the bellman. Just a nice, nice experience. Also, I should mention that the location to Istanbul tourist spots is excellent. Topkapi Palace, Blue Mosque and the Hagia Sofia (incredible!) are all within a very short walk. One thing I should mention is that the bathroom is kind of small...the shower is for short people. That would be our only complaint. Overall, the experience we had at the hotel was great! If we return to Istanbul, we would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Dario6211
Reviews.Content: Great atmophere Kind and skilled staff Perfect location (1 min walk from Sofia, Blue Mosch, 5 from Gran Bazar)

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel has it all!”
Reviews.Author: Maggie1270
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three days and from the time we arrived and were greeted with orange juice and Turkish Delight candy to the time we left everything was first class. In the center of the old Sultanahmet and within walking distance to all the most seen attractions, this boutique hotel offers great accommodations, friendly, helpful staff who are eager to help and clean comfortable rooms. We were very pleased and would be happy to recommend it to anyone traveling to Istanbul

Reviews.Title: “we felt very good”
Reviews.Author: mariaa04
Reviews.Content: an excellent location ; price - quality very good ; and a very important thing also , the hotel is near many touristic objectives .

Reviews.Title: “Incredible service”
Reviews.Author: Kreans
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for almost a week when visiting Istanbul with family. Was greeted coming from the airport at six in the morning with a welcome glass of orange juice, smiles, a good luck charm, and the staff bringing up my luggage. Location wise it is very close to the many attractions in Sultanamet, not more than a ten minute walk to any of them (though the grand bazaar may be about 15-20) and is located very close to the tram if you prefer public transit. The rooms were a bit on the small side compared with most Western hotels I have seen, though from the Turkish ones it seems standard. From arrival up to departure the staff were very kind and helpful, from offering drinks when relaxing on the rooftop terrace at three in the morning, to seeing you off with a small souvenir. One of the days I stayed I was terribly sick (probably due to some stuffed mussels off the street), and was stuck in bed all day. Even then the staff seemed concerned for my well being, checking to make sure I was okay, and sending up a complimentary cup of lovely lemon tea. All in all an amazing hotel, the only issue I had was the breakfast, consisting of bread, jams, cheeses and coldcuts with a few eggs and sausage available. The eggs and sausage were a bit off, though there a plenty of places nearby if you need a large hardy breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service - great location”
Reviews.Author: Chaudry-J
Reviews.Content: I stayed 4 nights with my wife and 2 kids (4 yrs and 5 yrs old) from 30th May - 3rd June. From the start the welcome was fantastic with free drinks and Turkish Delight. Elif was really welcoming. The room was clean, fresh and we were given an extra folding bed at no extra cost for my 4 yr old son. Omer and Cafer's hospitality was excellent. Omer became friends with my 4 year and it felt like staying with friends. Although it's not a 4 or 5 star hotel (i.e. no swimming pool etc..) but the location for the sights of Blue Mosque and Haya Sofia can't be beaten.Bathroom has a brillianty shower but the kids could have done with a bath as well. Overall a great experience and we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time hotel is well situated”
Reviews.Author: harveyIstanbul
Reviews.Content: Very clean, tidy, well appointed and friendly staff who were extremely helpful on directios around the city

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, personal service, lovely hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: MisterPelican
Reviews.Content: I stayed at White House Hotel for four nights in May, and itâ€™s the kind of gem you hope to find wherever youâ€™re vacationing. The hotel is an easy 5 minute walk to Hagia Sophia, Sultanahmet Park, and the Blue Mosque, a 10 minute walk to the Grand Bazaar, and a 20 minute walk to the Galata Bridge â€“ all very interesting, stimulating walks. The hotel is on an active (and interesting) street, but it quiets down at night, and the windows seal out any outside noise. There seems to be no early commotion outside as you find at so many European hotels. Iâ€™m not sure how you could ask for a better location. The hotel staff is young and cheerful, knows Istanbul extremely well, and everyone understands and delivers true hospitality unlike anywhere Iâ€™ve ever stayed. These folks clearly want you to have a memorable experience in Istanbul and at their hotel, and will do whatever you ask them to in order to meet those ends and bring you back to stay again. Their advice about logistics, restaurants, and places to visit are spot on. Harun answered emails before the trip promptly and specifically, and he graciously arranged free transport from the airport with a driver waiting outside passport control with my name on a sign â€“ a nice thing to have waiting on arrival. (They will also instruct about options to return to the airport when departing, including arranging a reasonably priced private car.) Youâ€™re greeted upon arrival with a cold fruit drink and Turkish Delight, and encouraged to relax and rest as long as youâ€™d like after your long trip. Elif at the front desk is certainly the most charming, endearing person you can hope for. She greeted us cheerfully upon arrival, and, among other things, she calmly gave us excellent advice on getting about the city, showed us on a map how to get to everywhere we wanted to visit, and offered to guide us home by phone if ever we got lost in or around Istanbul (which, thanks to her, we did not). Elif is really a treasure you will not forget. Omer also is unfailingly kind and helpful, and he patiently and pleasantly answered all our questions and asked about our day each time we met. Mohammed, the quiet assistant, is there to assist with luggage, and any other logistic challenge you might have. In just a few days, you feel as if you are leaving a wonderful family when you leave. The rooms and bathrooms are utterly spotless and tastefully decorated in local style, and a single is comfortable and compares well with regard to size with European hotels. The shower is small â€“ so it goes â€“ and itâ€™s fine for a few days. Free coffee and tea service is included in the room, and if you must indulge in a drink from the minibar, the prices are unoffensive. Better to grab from the mini-supermarket on the nearby corner, though, where you can also snag late night munchies. Breakfast on the roof, with the views of the Hagia Sophia, the Bosphorus bridge, and Istanbul, is a great way to start a day. We were up there just after 7 a.m. and surprisingly had the rooftop to ourselves each day. Turkish style breakfast could be a wee bit better, though we managed to load up enough calories for the mornings ahead. It does include scrambled and hard boiled eggs, breads and cakes, many cereals and puddings, cheeses, fruits, coffee, tea, and juices. I donâ€™t eat this hearty a breakfast at home most days. Istanbul is a nonstop sensory and cultural bombarsion that everyone should experience. Recommendations include the public ferry Bosphorus cruise; grilled fish on the quay near the Galata Bridge; shopping in and around the streets of the Spice Market (remember to ship or check in your purchases of anything fluid); shopping and haggling for carpets, pashmina, and olive oil; 24x7 people watching; learning about the Islamic faith; of course the Hagia Sophia and Blue Mosque; learning about the rich, colorful history of Turkey; and savoring the White House Hotel experience. I definitely plan to come to Istanbul again, and thereâ€™s no need to shop around for a hotel. The White House Hotel is where Iâ€™ll stay.

Reviews.Title: “The best little hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: jimwasson
Reviews.Content: We actually stayed at the White House twice, when we started our Turkey tour and at the end. It is beautiful, clean and comfortable. The location in Sultanahmet is an easy walk to major sites like Aya Sofia and Topkapi Palace. When checked in Cafer said we should consider it our home while in Istanbul and he meant it. The staff is the best anywhere. Omar and Robert were extremely helpful and friendly. When our transfer to the airport was late they even offered to pay for a cab to the airport and it's not a cheap fare either! Being a small boutique hotel it doesn't have a pool or gym but it's perfect for tourists. Great breakfast on the roof! We'd stay there again anytime.

Reviews.Title: “The most helpful staff you will find”
Reviews.Author: DougF45
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent boutique hotel wonderfully situated for the Blue Mosque, Haghia Sophia and the Topkapi. The harbour front at Galata is only 15-20 minutes walk away or you can take the tram. The staff are very polite and helpful and are obviously very proud of their relatively newly-opened hotel. My one criticism is that rooms at the front do get quite a bit of noise at present due to nearby building work but nothing that decent earplugs cannot solve. The decnt buffet breakfast on the top floor terrace makes for a great start to the day.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: promomomo
Reviews.Content: The staff at the White House were exceptional. The location was good, as it was near the sites, but the rooms were very quiet. Excellent breakfast and treats.

Reviews.Title: “pefect stay”
Reviews.Author: Berkogabi
Reviews.Content: very good location, super friendly and efficiant stuff, nice hotel

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 9514dm
Reviews.Content: The Staff was excellent and very friendly, always going out of their way to be helpfull. The loction in Istanbul was within walking distance to many of the world known sites which Istanbul is famous for. The breakfast meal was also of excellent quality. Our stay at the White House Hotel was an excellent experience. We cannot think of aything which we disliked about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “convenient location, great service, friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: FengShuiConsultant
Reviews.Content: The driver was there to meet me when I arrived to take me to the hotel. Everything went very smoothly. This hotel is within walking distance to all the major attractions such as Topkapi Palace, Blue mosque, the museum, Grand Bazaar, and the Hamam. The staff will go out of their way to help you. I stayed only one night and managed to see all the major attractions due to the close proximity of the hotel. It was a little noisy during the day but quiets down during the evening. Overall it was a positive and wonderful stay. The transfer took me to me the airport on time. I would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Fred255370
Reviews.Content: Like all the other reviews, this hotel is in a quiet back street but within minutes walk of everything to see in old Istanbul, but really close to the tram line so you can easily get further afield. The staff are young, polite, and helpful, the rooms are clean light and quiet, the windows are double glazed, and my room in the front on the first floor was amazingly quiet. The breakfast on the roof terrace was fine too.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay with helpful and engaging staff”
Reviews.Author: wva97
Reviews.Content: Pros: - Hotel location is wonderful. It's a quick walk to Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque, and one of the best Turkish baths in the City, Topkapi Palace, the Grand Bazaar, the Spice Market, and the basilica cistern in the Sultanahmet. - The roof bar is great and provides a great breakfast area with nice views; it's also great for lounging in the afternoon. - The staff is engaging, helpful and polite. They are eager to please and provide great service. - Close to a many wonderful restaurants - feels very Paris chic - Staff does a great job of getting you a taxi and giving the driver detailed directions on where you're headed. Cons: - Our shower drained too slowly - Rooms can be smaller than most U.S. travelers are accustomed to Advice: - Not for travelers looking for Four Seasons type properties or an all-inclusive vacation resort - Not in nightlife area (for nightlife, stay in Taksim Square) - Generally, late afternoon and evening traffic in Istanbul can be very slow-moving. If you're getting in a cab, make sure to give yourself ample time

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: euronautix
Reviews.Content: Very clean, beautiful and nice Hotel in a comfortable part of the town. Very close to the Hagia Sofia located it is the perfect starting point for a amazing day in Istanbul. The fantastic roof garden (Breakfast in the morning, drink in the evening...) with a incredible view the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sofia. Stuff is veeeeeeeery friendly :-)

Reviews.Title: “Most friendly service and best location in historic Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: gentsch
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff provided an outstanding service - thank you folks, it was a pleasure to stay at your house. The hotels location is perfect for visiting the historic places of Istanbul. Otoman style rooms are generous and clean. If one comes with rental car, be prepared parking is a bit tricky. But hotel staff gives you every kind of support you need.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: daB13299
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Whitehouse for 3 nights earlier this month. Th rooms are chean and quite. Staffs were very polite and hard working. Specially receptionist Elif and Omar, they were both very knowledgeable about their country; they gave us good advice on touring tips. Hotel location was unbeatable. Very easy reach to touring spots. We like to extend our sincerely thanks to all staffs, especially Elif and Omar for being so warm to us. Keep up the good work ! You've been so helpful ! Al C (Canada)

Reviews.Title: “Superb service”
Reviews.Author: Academictraveller_11
Reviews.Content: This relatively new and small hotel offered us an excellent location: an easy 5-10 minute walk to the sites we most wanted to explore (Aya Sofia, Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, Cistern, Hippodrome, Bazaars). The room was extremely comfortable, pristine, and quiet; the generous breakfast is served on a roof-top terrace (half covered in case of inclement weather) with a great view of Aya Sofia. The free internet worked perfectly for us in the room. I was impressed that we could be in one of the busiest neighborhoods and still be able to retreat to a comfortable quiet room when we needed to. Most of all, the staff--especially Cafer--consistently made us feel welcome, and freely offered their help and experience when we needed to organize trips further afield out of the neighborhood (as to the Chora Church for example) and made dinner reservations for us at restaurants that had been recommended to us by friends. The free airport transfer into town they offered (since we stayed 3 nights) was also a welcome addition. We could not have asked for more; I thought this was 5-star service.

Reviews.Title: “This is THE place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Explorer281
Reviews.Content: Prior to leaving, I had shortlisted 5 Sultanahmet properties, based on TA reviews. We chose the White House for no particular reason, except that we liked what we saw on their website. WOW - we struck gold! And that's not a statement I make lightly. Great location - one block away from the main avenue through the old district, with the Blue and AyaSofia mosques less than 10 mins walk away. The T Palace was less than 15 mins walk away. There's a tram line literally one block away, which can take you to the river and the Egyptian/Spice markets. The other direction, the Grand Bazaar is 10 mins away. And that's all great - but its the hotel itself which was amazing. Clean, very comfortable, safe, and lots of amenities. I haven't come across such friendly, and accommodating staff, in a long, long, time. Each one truly took the time to help with any room/transportation needs, assistance at the wide variety of offerings at the breakfast buffet on the roof level, directions/suggestions on where/when/how to go, and event/restaurant reservations. Its the kind of service you hope you're going to get at the start of each trip. An exaggerated review? For me - no. There are a lot of hotels in this area, many on the main strip (I believe its called Divan Yolu sp), all of which experience big city noise, and the call to prayer five times a day. The White House gets less, due to its location. Very highly recommended - and we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Neehill
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay at the White House Hotel due to the excellent reviews and the location. We were pretty happy with out stay overall - it is definitely located in the perfect spot to see the main sites, and is also on a quiet street. Our (standard) room was clean and nice, but definitely on the small side and certainly not luxury. Perhaps the more expensive rooms are better. Breakfast was ok, nothing amazing, but the terrace view in the morning was lovely. Excellent attentive and helpful service from the hotel staff, so that really brought the rating up to 4 stars for us.

Reviews.Title: “my home in Instanbul”
Reviews.Author: Aprilia60
Reviews.Content: You can't beat the location! Friendly staff makes you fill like home. Thanks Cafer for saving us from a local tourist scam artist. Thanks Elif and Omar for your extra care. It was the best experience in Istanbul. We will go there again! nice views from the roof garden!

Reviews.Title: “Turkish hospitality in the heart of the Old City”
Reviews.Author: southernerinlondon
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the White House was wonderful. The hotel is located in the heart of the Old City, so guests are less than a five minutes walk to the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia, Byzantium ruins, Topkapi palace, cafes, meyhanes, sweets shops and shopping. Maybe a 10 minute walk to the Mesir/Spice Market and Grand Bazaar. The hotel itself is very clean and furnished in a modern baroque style throughout. The lobby has comfortable sitting areas, and you'll never sit long before hotel staff offer you tea and coffee (with turkish delight) at no additional charge. We were upgraded upon arrival, having booked a double, they gave a family room, which was large by European standards and came equipt with a tv, wifi, tea center, wardrobe, and slippers. The bathroom was also a good size compared to most European botique hotels we've visited. We had excellent water pressure and temperatures, and the quality of the hardware used in the bathroom was very nice--granite and stainless steel. They provide you with loads of shampoo/conditioner/soap/lotion--our favorite being the thyme scented hand soaps. Breakfast was provided on the roof terrace and was a nice mix of Turkish continential breakfast standards--we opted to rotate breakfasts between the hotel and local cafes for a bit more variety. All of the White House staff are friendly, welcoming and helpful. With the overwhelming amount of choices for hotels in Istanbul, do yourself a favor and book your stay here.

Reviews.Title: “An enjoyable stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: jackNashville_Tn
Reviews.Content: My wifw and I have just returned from an enjoyable two week stay at the White House Hotel. We have stayed at many hotels during our travels and always enjoyed them. However,we have never experienced the warmth and attention we received at this hotel. Manager Harun Cadirci answered E-Mails promptly, had a driver waiting at the airport to provide transportation to the hotel, and had reserved the room we had requested facing the street. Elif, who worked the front desk during the daytime, helped us with E-mails, answered various questions, and was enjoyable to converse with each afternoon when returning from sightseeing. The rooftop breakfast room and terrace were delightful and we would linger over breakfast each morning talking with yagmur, a lovely young lady who we felt very close to. Muhomed seemed to be everywhere, handling luggage,opening doors,showing how to operate the TV,etc. Omar came by each morning at breakfast to wish us a good day. Cafer worked the front desk in the evening and provided excellent advice and assistance. The hotel itself is a botique hotel with 22 rooms on 4 floors. The rooftop breakfast room and terrace have excellent views of Hagia Sophia and Topkapi Palace. They serve a very good breakfast consisting of egggs, meats, cereals, breads, fruits etc. Our room was small but felt comfortable by the 12 foot ceiling and plenty of light from the windows. The location is excellent being only minutes to restaurants and many o f the top sights.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff..Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: FinolaCorkIreland
Reviews.Content: I am a seasoned traveller having travelled near and far for over 26 years and I read a lot of hotel reviews also...I do not always agree with "excellent" reviews as sometimes I think a particular hotel can be overrated...however that was until my husband and I stayed in the wonderful White House Hotel!
