This hotel deserves it's excellent reviews and more..I have never received such kind hospitality in all my travels and the most excellent staff I have ever met...from the moment we stepped inside the door after our journey, as other reviewers have commented, we knew we were somewhere special.. we were greeted with a warm welcome from a friendly and smiling Muhammet who took our heavy baggage and was very friendly and helpful throughout our stay..it didn't stop there..Cafer at reception greeted us warmly and professionally going over our booking details thoroughly and we were presented with orange drinks and Turkish delight which was a lovely touch.. by the way, the free shuttle from the airport was such a help and major convenience also...Cafer was very helpful in organising our trips and making the most of our time in Istanbul and beyond..he gave great information and he recommended some wonderful restaurants too...nothing was too much trouble for the staff and Elif and Omar were also warm and friendly at all times at reception and eager to help in any way...I have never hugged and kissed any hotel receptionist goodbye in my life but we did Elif on our departure!! I felt we left a family behind in Istanbul in the White House Hotel...thank you to all of you for your kind and unforgettable hospitality and to Harun for the excellent management... Now for the hotel itself...it is very conveniently situated in Sultanhamet and within walking distance of all the important historical sites..also great shopping and great restaurants and cool cafes nearby...hotel is comfortable and peaceful with lovely furnishings...breakfast is good too with quite a good choice, just a very minor point and I am being very fussy, we would have loved fresh fruit juices..but this should not now in no way detract from the hotel's excellence.. I thought that the hotel was excellent in every respect and deserves it's excellent ratings

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel,great staff”
Reviews.Author: vcenttim
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at White house hotel for the long weekend,what a amazing stay,located very well in the old city on a very quite street,hotel staff and the service was great,they were on their best for making our stay fantstic.We would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hospitality we have experienced in our travels”
Reviews.Author: IndiaEagle
Reviews.Content: My wife and i stayed at this hotel for 5 nights. Good Hotel. Rather small rooms but such is the case with most European hotels. Very clean. Quiet location on a back street. Great staff. Made you feel like home. Warm welcome after a long flight. All of the staff, (and its a collective effort) are eager to please and guide you about the city. Breakfast is good and keeps you gong for most of the day. Tourist locations, restaurants, tramway, supermarket, within walking distance of the hotel. Our best wishes to the management and staff. You have taken hospitality to a higher level. Keep it up.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: RobertLeicestershire
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the White House Hotel for three nights on our first visit to Istanbul. We cannot praise too highly the service provided by Harun and his team, including Elif, Omar and Cafer. Nothing was too much trouble for them and we were made to feel very welcome indeed from the moment we arrived. The hotel is very well situated only a few minutes away from the blue mosque, hagia sofia and other main sites of the city. The rooms are beatifully furnished and the breakfast room on the roof has an excellent view of the city. We ate at restaurants recommended by the hotel and we were delighted with the quality of these and the excellent service we received. All in all a brilliant stay and we have no reservation in recommending the White House as a top quality, friendly hotel in a superb position.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel. turkish hospitality at it's best.”
Reviews.Author: goingplacesToronto
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 2 weeks in Turkey and stayed at the White House Hotel for 5 nights. We are mother, father and adult son. We had a triple room which was vspcaious compared to other hotels on our trip. The hotel itself is very well located, spacious, clean, extremely comfortable and very well decorated. Compared to other hotels in our travels, this stands out as the best hotel. Elif and Caver were so helpful to us. Elif went out of her way to get us a hotel in Istanbul for the last part of our trip as I had not anticipated that ANZAC day and Easter would make it so hard to get a room then. We were able to get a hotel that was fine, in fact very good, but I wish we could have stayed at the White House Hotel again. I would definitely recommend to anyone. The only possible hint I have for the hotel to make it even better is to improve it's Turkish breakfast. There was no shortage of food but it was the same thing every day and not very imaginative. This is a minor problem. Overall, I thought the hotel was great.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful friendly service”
Reviews.Author: Hils5
Reviews.Content: This new hotel is typical of the lovely small boutique type hotels in Sultanahmet - well located, with very friendly, helpful but respectful service.

Reviews.Title: “Our second visit - really top quality and most friendly service plus great location.”
Reviews.Author: MikeAraxa
Reviews.Content: Harun is doing a great job here: his team of Elif, Chian and Omar couldn't have been more helpful in welcoming us on our arrival and helping us with any enquiry during our stay. By way of example they recommended a local fish restaurant to us and made a phone call to book us a top table. We got free coffee and dessert and great food and service in what we later found on tripadvisor was one of the top five restaurants in Istanbul. Harun provided us with umbrellas for us to walk the five minutes to the restaurant and one of his team even walked with us to make sure we didn't miss our way in the rain - beat that! This year the roof top breakfast terrace at the White House with a great view of Hagia Sophia makes the great stay we had even better. We have recommended this hotel to our close friends with total confidence - this hotel is a real gem only a few minutes walk frpm the topkapi palace, hagia sophia and blue mosque plus top quality and good value restaurants and cafes. This is my first review written on my new galaxy tab with free wifi from the White House Hotel on our final night of a three night stay. Trust me - I wouldn't be making the effort if our experience here wasn't something special!

Reviews.Title: “very good service and kind employees”
Reviews.Author: changbongsong
Reviews.Content: very cleaned rooms and very good service. Breakfast can be improved

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: ziggy40
Reviews.Content: Hotel location for the hotel is the best, near all the major sights. The rooms are clean, the staff is helpful and friendly, Cafer and Elfi could not have been more helpful, they were always on call and with a warm friendly smile. The breakfast was plentyful and so nice to sit on the rooftop and look at beautiful Istanbul. The bed are so comfortable and all the amenities in the bathroom made are stay so enjoyable. I highly recommend this hotel and will stay at the White House again when I return to Turkey.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: gv35
Reviews.Content: I have recently returned from a short trip to Istanbul and have to say that the White House hotel lived up to, and exceeded, all expectations. Their customer service ( with a special thank you to Cafer) really is first class. The rooms are beautifully decorated, spotlessly clean and with all the extra touches that made my stay an absolute pleasure! Great location, very close to Hagia Sofia and the Blue Mosque with lovely restauarnts and cafes very close by. I would recomment this hotel to anyone and I'll definitely be going back!

Reviews.Title: “Familiar, clasical but very good renovated”
Reviews.Author: Juuuuanjo
Reviews.Content: Very good service, very nice all workers (especially Omar). Very comfortable guest rooms with all new furniture. All very new hotel, very well reformatted. Very well located, near the Blue Mosque ( 2 minutes walking) and the Aga Sofia (4 minutes walking). Taxi drivers very tricky. The hotel is two blocks from the Aga Sofia.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is in a perfect location and the staff are fantastic”
Reviews.Author: PeterB74
Reviews.Content: We have just arrived back from a long weekend staying at this gem of a hotel. The staff really go out of their way to help you and are are the friendliest I have ever met especially Cafer who really went out of his way to make our stay special. The location could not have been better and it is a short walk to all the major attractions in the area. The hotel decor is beautiful, the rooms are clean, the breakfast is perfect and I would highly recommend it to any traveler to Istanbul. We will definitely go back to this lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “White House Hotel: Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: antarik58
Reviews.Content: We arrived late and we had teh most welcome reception from Jaafar with fresh juices and delights. Checking in was done while we were sitting on the reception sofa. Then we were given quick review of the area and surroundings. For the next five days, we would have the wmorining welcome from Efil and the breakfast staff and hepled us to plan our day trips including booking tours. Location of the hotel is very near to all sites and it is sorrounded by excellent choices of resturants. Upon checking out, we were offered turkish delights as gifts and personal goodbye. We enjoyed our first visit to Turkey and would definitly visit again and book at the White House Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and even better staff”
Reviews.Author: Youri_ly
Reviews.Content: The location of this small boutique hotel is excellent, the rooms are clean and comfortable (just a little bit small to get toghether if you have a big company). What makes a stay in the hotel very comfortable is the friedly and helpfull staff. Our special thanks to Cafer who has been there around for us almost 24 hours a day. Great stay, great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “We got really lucky with this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: eileen068
Reviews.Content: Rooms are comfortable, clean, and the breakfast food is good and plentiful. The best thing about this hotel though, is the staff. They go out of their way to ensure your visit is as comfortable as possible. Tea and lokum is offered upon arrival, and your luggage is taken care of while you rest. I wanted to bring Elfi home with me. A real treasure. I hope to return another day.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, clean hotel, fantastic location and extremely helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: ls359
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the White House Hotel Istanbul with my mother from April 3rd - 6th 2011 and I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough. The staff are a delight - particularly the smiley and charming Elif on reception - we found them to be incredibly helpful and eager to please: recommending us restaurants, booking us tables, organising our return airport transfer etc. On arrival we were warmly greeted with a drink, some Turkish delight and the Turkish eye badge as a little gift, and then told we had been upgraded to a family room (room 302 on the 3rd floor) which was extremely spacious, comfortable and very clean, complete with lovely free toiletries, slippers, tea & coffee making facilities etc. The hotel is in central Sultanahmet within easy walking distance of the main sights including Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, Grand Bazaar etc). We had a lovely stay and were very touched to be given a box of Turkish Delight on leaving. Would thoroughly recommend this lovely boutique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Everything about this hotel is just perfect-location, rooms and staff are second to none.”
Reviews.Author: Loretta359
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from what was my first trip to Istanbul with my daughter and we both cannot believe how lucky we were in finding White House Hotel. From the moment we arrived at the airport where we were personally greeted by the hotel driver to the welcoming cocktail from Elif at reception after our long journey, we knew that we had found somewhere special to stay in Istanbul. Our family room which had been upgraded was spotlessly clean and decorated in oppulent stylewith very comfortable beds and plenty of hot water in the shower. Location- wise White House Hotel is hard to beat! Situated in the old part of town, it is perfectly placed to visit all the main tourist sights of Istanbul . The Grand Bazaar, the Tokapi Palace and the Archaelogical Museum are merely a 10 minute walk away and the Blue Mosque and Agia Sofia less than 5 minutes away. Restaurants and boutiques selling local crafts are all close by but the hotel itself is in a quiet street so we had no trouble in getting to sleep at night. The staff are delightful, really helpful and special mention goes to Elif on reception, Yagmur in the breakfast room and Cihan who looked after us very well. Thank you very much and hope to visit again one day soon.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful boutique hotel with outstanding employees”
Reviews.Author: Leigh9181
Reviews.Content: This is such a great little treasure. Hotel is beautifully furnished and extremely clean. The staff are outstanding; they cannot do enough to help you. A special thanks to two of them, Omer and Elfi. I have travelled to many places but can truly say I have never experienced the kind of service as at The White House Hotel. The hotel is also close by to all the main attractions, most within walking distance. I will definitely be staying again on my next trip back to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location, helpful staff - recommended”
Reviews.Author: Korenast
Reviews.Content: We were delighted first of all with the location of the hotel - it's just few minutes away from the main tourist attractions and several good restaurants. those interested in shopping without exhausting bargaining will also find a nice shop around. The staff does its best to help you, I can especially recommend a guy called Cefar. However, the rooms lack style and look kitschy. If you don't care about this - White House is made for you.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent small hotel, convenient location, superb stuff”
Reviews.Author: GrigorisF
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in a triple room with my wife and young daugther (4 years old). The location of the hotel is very convenient, only a few minutes walk away from Agia Sofia, Blue Mosque and Top Kapi, since it's located in the middle of Sultanahmet. The hotel is small but very cute, all areas are clean and well maintained. The rooms are small, but pretty, in excellet condition and all the basic amenities are provided. Both rooms and the hotel are very clean, the beds are comfortable and the interior of the rooms is decorated in an old Othoman manner, with taste that does not offend even if you prefer contemporary designs due to the context of the city. The hotel offers you a free transport from the airport which is recommended and upon your arrival you are welcomed with a drink and turkish delights, plus a small blue evil eye gift. Breakfast (included in the room price) was adequate, better than in many mid-range hotels. Best of all in this hotel is the stuff. They are professional, they are friendly and they do their best to accomodate you. They helped us book taxis for our evening out, they gave advice and most of all they welcomed us with a warmth that made our stay a pleasure experience. my daughter felt like a princess, since everybody in the hotel from the receptionist to the room cleaning ladies, spent time with her constantly, talking, hugging her and offering her little gifts. We'd like to thank them publicly for this and absolutely recommend this hotel for those wishing to stay in Sultanahmet.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in all respects”
Reviews.Author: grazer
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 5 nights in Istanbul, staying at The White House Hotel, and cannot recommend it highly enough. From the pick up at the airport until departure, the customer service was first class. Elif, on reception, and the rest of the staff, ensure that the guests are always greeted with a smile, and made to feel completely at home. The hotel is small, but maintained immaculately, and location cannot be faulted, with numerous bars and restaurants within a 3 minute walk, and the main sites, such as the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia and Topkapi Palace all within a 5 minute walk. Thanks again to Elif and all the staff for making our trip to Istanbul so memorable, despite the weather not being very kind.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic, what a great boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sharimck
Reviews.Content: I have never experienced service as friendly and helpful as what we had at this hotel. From helping with our missing luggage, assisting with the insurance claims when our camera was stolen by United Airlines employees, and helping us book tours and navigate the city, the staff were simply amazing. Clean rooms, the only negative was the view of dirty buildings out the window. Breakfast was good and there is a hotel safe that we could keep our valuables in. You cannot beat the location, within walking distance to all the sights. Highly recommend this wonderful hotel!

Reviews.Title: “JUST PERFECT”
Reviews.Author: Guillermo_Sasson
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 rooms at the hotel in mid February mainly based on the previously posted opinnions , just to find them totally comfirmed by our own experience : -We were given a warm welcome and room upgrade for both our rooms, together with a brief about hotel's situation , nearby attractions and restaurants . During the whole staying Harun (manager ) and his staff, specialy Omar and lovely Elif , cleared out whathever doubt we presented and helped us in planning our day with directions , and local tips that helped us avoiding any inconvenience . The staff and their attitude is what makes the difference regarding this place!! As i told , the hotel was spotless clean , within walking distance of major historic attractions , in a picturesque and safe neighborhood. Being a boutique hotel, with a limited number of rooms , allows you to receive a more personal service and at this is what they aim at and fully achieve. I would absolutely recommend the White House hotel to anynone seeking lodge in Istambul, a city we loved and are looking forward to return to.

Reviews.Title: “The location is perfect and the service excellent”
Reviews.Author: BarryB37
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a base in the old quarter then this is perfect. Smallish hotel about 20 rooms I guess but don't let that put you off. The service from the staff could not be faulted, always extremely helpful, very clean. We were lucky enough to be upgraded to one of the superior rooms which are quite spaceous with a very comfortable double bed, desk and two armchairs. Batheroom is small but has a corner shower, difficult to work out how to operate it to start with and not all the various jets worked properly but it was more than sufficient for our purposes. Absolutely ideal for seeing all the sites. In easy walking distance (max 15-20 mins, and most less) to Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, Spice market, Grand Bazaar, Museum of Archaelogy and Basilica Cistern all of which I have reviewed. Also about 8-9 good restaurants within 2-3 mins walk and more within about 5 mins. 3 of which I also reviewed. Would I change anything at all? No.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Lovely Staff”
Reviews.Author: saltymalty
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a lovely long weekend here sightseeing in Istanbul. Located within 2 minute's walk of the stunning Blue Mosque and the other fabulous historic sites in the old city centre, the White House Hotel is very convenient for sight seeing. The rooms are clean, the beds are comfy and the staff are lovely (Elif is especially helpful). They organised a private car to take us to the airport free of charge on our last day. Would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “It's an outstanding place, nice, warm and very cosy”
Reviews.Author: oelpop
Reviews.Content: I had the opportunity to spend four days at this place and both myself and my wife really had a great time. The staff is proffesional, extremely polite and ager to taking care of all requirements in detail. The location of this hotel, at a walking distance from several important cultural and historical spots stands for another big advantage when thinking how big and crowded is Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Value and Service”
Reviews.Author: LuisBoston3
Reviews.Content: As a single person I stayed 3 days in a single room which was small but spotless and maintained that way each day. The room had large French doors to a small balcony so it felt larger than it was. The reception staff were all very helpful but Elif was especially considerate. The breakfast was well presented and certainly adequate. Everything including the tram was close by. This is a wonderful hotel and I hope to return, soon.

Reviews.Title: “excelent”
Reviews.Author: mfotis
Reviews.Content: everything about this hotel is excelent. the personel, the facilities, the location, the tariffs. it is a new hotel, with all the necessary facilities, absolutely clean with a nice decoration exactly in the heart of the most historic area of Istanbul. i recomend this hotel hundred per cent.

Reviews.Title: “BRILLIANT, 10 OUT OF 10”
Reviews.Author: TATPHIL
Reviews.Content: This Hotel surpases any hotel we have ever stayed at (mostly 4*), the furnishings, atmosphere and courtesy we encountered were beyond our expectations, the staff were friendly and helpful and everything was always spotless. The location of the hotel was ideal - only a short walk to most of Istanbul's delights. We would highly recommend this hotel to anyone

Reviews.Title: “EXTRMELY OVERRATED”
Reviews.Author: Laz79
Reviews.Content: This hotel is unbelievebly overrated. Yes, the staff is polite and yes it is clean and the rooms, although small, are quite tasteful and yes, the hotel is close to major historical sites. This is where the good part ends. The negative part is that it is virtually imposible to rest during certain times. During night time there is no traffic on the street and all the businesses are closed, so it is O.K. but from very early in the morning the noise starts. Since there is no any sound insulation it was impossible to rest even I was on the third floor. I could hear all the noice of the street, even normal conversations, very clearly. Furthermore the breakfast has great room for improvement with regards to diversity and quality which is of poor standard. I travel to Istanbul quite often and usually I stay in a 5 star hotel that charges me about the same that this hotel and has all the anemities and comfort and generally I was very pleased. When, however, I checked the great reviews and ratings that this hotel gets in tripadvisor and booking.com, it seemed like a good idea to try it. I was greatly disapoInted. I cannot say it is a bad hotel, but it definitely it is nothing more than average. For the same price you can get much better accomodation in Istanbul. To see that is one of the 3 most highly recommended hotels in Istanbul is definitely very misleading. I do not understand why it gets such high ratings and great reviews. Maybe it is because the kind e-mailed request of the hotel manager to give them "the best guests score (Excellent score or the best top score(10) point)" does affect people and gets results.

Reviews.Title: “Good place for leisure among historic sights of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Serezha
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel for walking through hystoric center of Istanbul. It is located in few minutes from main sights of city. Staff is very friendly, responsive and interested in your good impression about hotel and city

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Host”
Reviews.Author: Familyosloxlondon
Reviews.Content: All features we were looking for where excellent,perfect location,very central in the heart of old town,genuine and friendly staff were most helpful,clean and modern very comfortable place.Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location with unexpected amenities”
Reviews.Author: intheleftlane
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay at the White House Hotel, because the location was excellent (just a few short blocks to the Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque, and Cistern), and the rate was a bargain compared to similar hotels. We were pleased to find that our room was immaculately clean, and we were surprised at the level of attention to decor and detail. Some options in the breakfast spread seemed a little odd (the olives, in particular), but there was also plenty of toast, cheese, cold cuts, pastries, and hard boiled eggs for those who prefer a more predictable breakfast. Most impressive of all were the staff members, all of whom were welcoming and very helpful when we had questions.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and clean, extraordinary service”
Reviews.Author: WilMiRe
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in four different hotels in Istanbul, all of which have been very nice, but the White House Hotel is really the best. The hotel is very clean, the location is perfect, but most importantly, the staff is some of the absolute nicest that I have ever met. Special thanks to Elif, Yagmur and Abdurrahman, who were all so helpful and friendly. I have found a new home in Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended on all accounts”
Reviews.Author: Mr_GP
Reviews.Content: The White House Hotel offered us all that we hoped for: it was clean, comfortable (a good sized room) , extremely friendly staff, good breakfast and close proximity to all the major places to visit and near good restaurants. Finally, all this came at a very reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Most friendly and service minded staff ever met!”
Reviews.Author: OlleSandefjord
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a weekend in Istanbul, staying 2 nights at White House Hotel. Mails with questions prior to the visit was promptly answered, and the staff was exeptional friendly, helpful and service minded, especially the two receptionists, but also the rest of the staff. The location is excellent, in walking distance from several of the main attractions as the Blue Mosc, Hagia Sophia, Grand Bazar, Spice Bazar, Topkapi and the Galata Bridge.

Reviews.Title: “Search no further”
Reviews.Author: Schlapsi
Reviews.Content: This was the third hotel we tried in Istanbul, and the best one so far. An unspoilt experience, starting from the personal welcome reception with a drink and lokum to the offered fruit basked and the considerate, friendly staff at breakfast and behind the desk. Also check-out was very amicable and personal, we felt valued and are happy to have had such a nice hotel within a stone-throw from the major sites and just a few steps from the tram. The room was spacey, elegant and clean with a squeeky-clean bathroom. Excellent bed linen, well-working heating system and quiet surroundings. We also appreciated the free slippers and the many complimentary tea/coffee choices in the room. One very nice detail: the soap, sewing kit, shower cap and cotton pads all came in elegant cardboard wrapping, not plastic! Breakfast was very good, including fresh veggies and fruits. We've stayed at many hotels in many different cities- this was one of the best experiences so far. Clear recommendation!

Reviews.Title: “White House Hotel: The other gem of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: reeldoc
Reviews.Content: This is a small boutique hotel within walking distance to major monuments (Hagia Sofia, Blue Mosque, Topkapi, etc).. We were three couples traveling to Greece via Istanbul. The Soon after I booked I received an e-mail from the manager of the hotel, Mr. Ã‡adirci, welcoming us and making himself available for anything we might need. I asked him to help us with airport transport ,which he did for a very reasonable price. He even gave us one out of the four airport trips free. We stayed one night (two days) on the way to Greece and another night on our return. As we arrived to the hotel from the airport we were greeted by Elif, the concierge. She very graciously assigned the rooms to us. As the check in was finished we were offered by her assistant, Yagmur, a welcoming drink and a Turkish delight sweet. both of which were not only delicious but a very nice welcome after several hours of trip. The rooms were very clean and elegantly decorated in 18th century French style. The ancillary staff was also very helpful handling our luggage. The breakfast was very good. The night concierges Cafer and Omer were very helpful giving us a few names of good restaurants nearby for dinner or lunch. Elif was also there the day of our return to the US. She and the rest of the hotel staff gave us a warm welcome and made us feel very special. All the details of our stay at this pretty hotel had been well taken care by a very intelligent and warm hotel staff. As we were given well wishes for a safe return home, they handed each couple a box of Turkish candies, a really delicious treat and a lovely gesture. The stay at White House Hotel made our visit to Istanbul very pleasant and it will remain in our memory for years to come. We certainly will recommend this hotel very highly to family and friends. We'll consider seriously going back again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, spotless, friendly. This hotel works hard for its reviews”
Reviews.Author: Kateling64
Reviews.Content: We chose the White House based on location and were highly impressed by all the service touches provided, especially at the price. On arrival delightful receptionist upgraded us to room 402, no view but lovely spacious room, with room to sit and decent sized desk area. Short walking distance to blue Mosque, Bazaar, Hagia Sophia, Palace, stroll down hill to Spice market and 2 minute walk to tram to Beyoglu side. Also 2 minute walk to chemist/supermarket/lots of small cafes: including "paper" district with loads of bookshops (some in english but all lovely to see) From offer of turkish delight and orange juice on arrival to coffee as we waited for free taxi back to airport (even free wine and fruit platter after long day in Gallipoli). Great advice on local restaurants. and other options from Cafer and all other staff. Also, fastest internet in all of Turkey (we just spent 2 months and stayed at more than a dozen hotels) which is great - even works in basement room. And decent pillows(and offer of more if needed) ! Yay. Only tiny quibble (which is true for all hotels in Turkey) is the lack of english channels on satellite tv (2 or 3 news stations form a choice 400 or 700 options, which usually include at least a dozen arab phone sex channels) when there are so many english-speakers visiting the country.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay at The White House - Stay Here!!!”
Reviews.Author: Tapnmel23
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the White House hotel for 4 nights over New Years Eve. We had an unbelievable stay and strongly recommend this hotel. After we made our reservation at the hotel through a third party website, the hotel contacted us to arrange free transportation from the airport to the hotel which was great because the hotel is about 45 minutes from the airport. Upon our arrival at the airport, a nice gentleman was waiting in the arrivals area with our name on a sign and then we were off! Upon our arrival at the hotel, we were greeted with a welcome cocktail and chatted for a few minutes with the hotel's friendly staff about our stay. We were then escorted to our double room on the third floor. The room was spotless and very nice. It came with a refrigerator and free wi fi - both nice touches. The hotel, which is a small boutique hotel, is in a fantastic location for visiting the Old Town. The hotel is a short walk to the Grand Bazaar, Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia, many shops and restaurants and the metro (which you can take to the Spice Bazaar, New Mosque, Taksim Square, etc). The location could not have been better. Also, our room included a daily complimentary breakfast. The breakfast was a great way to start the day and included eggs, coffee, fresh fruits, cereal, olives, sausage and various breakfast breads. I believe it is served from 7-10 a.m. everyday. Because we were celebrating our anniversary, the hotel brought us a small cake and two cocktails on New Year's Eve to celebrate. This was a really nice gesture and is just one example of the hotel's great hospitality. The staff greeted us every morning and night like royalty and were always available to answer our questions and help us with planning our days in the city. In fact, the lobby is staffed 24-hours a day so there is always someone around to assist you. And the one day it rained, they had umbrellas waiting for us in the lobby to take with us. This was a great home base for us and will be for you too.

Reviews.Title: “very pleasant”
Reviews.Author: knopaAustralia
Reviews.Content: All features I was looking for where excellent: quiet street,close to the heart of the old city,warm,friendly,well trained stuff and nice,clean romm.In my liking I do recommed this small charming little place to stay in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel and City”
Reviews.Author: mtv
Reviews.Content: Perfect location and even better hosts. We were taken care of like the "Sultans" of past from setting up a last minute trip down to Ephesus to opening up the terrace on the roof on New Years Eve because we we were to tired to get out with the crowds. So we watched the fireworks from there and even enjoyed a bottle of wine that they gave to us to enjoy. It is very nice to come back to a spotless hotel where you are greeted with a smile and a genuine question on what you saw that day. If your looking to be in the old city this is the place, an absolutely wonderfull time in a wonderfull place.

Reviews.Title: “White House Hotel is very clean and comfortable with great service”
Reviews.Author: rafearcher
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the White House Hotel in late December 2010. The service is great. We stayed three days and so we got the free airport transport. Note that they will not do the free trip for the return, only for the pickup. No matter. Mr. Cafer was at the front desk nearly the entire time we were there. He answered every question quickly and expertly. We had a nice three bed room. Nice toiletries, ample warm water. The extras were what made it special. Free Wi-Fi, umbrellas downstairs. Free breakfast. This is not a fancy hotel like a big stateside hotel, but it is charming and in a very convenient location. The staff have definite ideas about where you should go for dinner or for a bath, but were willing to answer any question we had. Two final notes. We wanted to divide our check when we checked out. Mr. Cafer said, anyway you want to do it, and split in on credit cards. I'm not sure this would have happened in the States, but to have it done overseas was remarkable. Finally, my wife left her iphone charger in the room. She emailed Mr. Cafer and he mailed it to us. Just great service. (Final note, some of the reviews say that there is a building renovation going on next door. That is completed. There is a grocery store three minutes away, a street car stop five minutes away and the Blue Mosque/Hagia Sophia area is less than a ten minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “Fabuolous Hotel with excellent service and Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Malika88
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the White House Hotel for 4 nights in late December. The location is fantastic - it really is walking distance to the main sites, restaurants/shops, yet tucked away in quiet street. The triple room was excellent - v.clean, roomy. The staff were very helpful and Mr. Harun went out of his way to provide a car and driver to take me to a meeting. Breakast is ample and the welcome drinks, parting gifts all add that extra little touch. I would definetly recommend this hotel. It made our stay in Istanbul very pleasant. Krishna.

Reviews.Title: “It was wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Nika000
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very cosy and has a great location â€“ right in a heart of historical center. The staff is extremely helpful and attentive. The quality of service is one of the best Iâ€™ve ever met after visiting about 20 countries.

Reviews.Title: “Perfekt”
Reviews.Author: jkw187346
Reviews.Content: NIce hotel, excellent service, very clean, You can follow the advice of Cafer at the reception desk to find nice restaurants. We will come back for a longer stay.

Reviews.Title: “This little hotel really made Istanbul a memorable vacation for us”
Reviews.Author: WanderersNotLost
Reviews.Content: We lucked upon The White House through Tripadvisor. It provided: a) The best location - walking proximity to all major attractions, restaurants and shopping of all kinds, and opportunities to mill with the locals b) Very friendly, hospitable staff that made us feel genuinely welcome with ever-smiling faces and a ready helping hand c) Knowledge of and directions to everything we wanted to see. Also, all their recommendations turned out to be splendid, and descriptions accurate d) Amenities and breakfast were more than adequate and allowed us to power through the day or lounge around, as our mood dictated Overall a wonderful little place - a strong recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Just in the heart of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: RatitaPresumida
Reviews.Content: Great new hotel in the centre of historical part, just in 5 minutes from the Mosques and 2 min from metro station "Sultanahmet". Good value for money, really friendly staff creating the perfect atmosphere for leisure. Rooms are spacious and cosy, good breakfast. Definitely we would stay here again and recommend it to everyone who comes to Istanbul for leisure. Many thanks to the guys working in the reception!!! Welcome drinks and good-buy presents is also a great idea :)

Reviews.Title: “The best place I've stayed for this price”
Reviews.Author: allisoncfoster
Reviews.Content: The staff were really freindly, the location great, and the price was excellent - would certainly reccomend to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, beautiful hotel and very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: 1019worldtraveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this boutique hotel Dec 18 - 23, 2010. We were very impressed by the convenient location, cleanliness and helpful staff making this one of our best vacation experiences ever. The rooms are very clean and neat, housekeeping is excellent and breakfast every morning is hearty and wholesome with fresh juices, fruits and breads. The staff is very helpful and the atmosphere is warm and friendly. All the major monuments are within walking distance from this hotel as are the restaurants and shopping. We would highly recommend this hotel and look forward to returning some day.

Reviews.Title: “We will return!”
Reviews.Author: CanadaMapleSyrup
Reviews.Content: Perfect Location! Great staff! Great rooms! Great breakfast! We extended our stay in Istanbul after an amazing 3000km tour of Turkey with Trafalgar and Neon Tours. Our bar was already set very high. We found The White House on Tripadvisor and want to thank the previous reviewers for helping us find this gem. The reception staff are knowledgable, and very helpful. We arrrived after a crazy, and very stressful taxi ride from our tour hotel in the new city (north) into this oasis of calm, and were offered a welcome drink then immediately shown to our rooms. This boutique hotel is in the center of the Golden Horn, 2 streets away from the Hagia Sophia, the Blue Mosque, the Basilica Cisterns, Old Turkish Baths and great restaurants, and a short walk to the Grand Bazaar! It is also 2 blocks from the tram that will get you to all other amazing sites such as Topkapi and Dolmabahce Palaces, the Spice Bazaar, and the fish restaurants beneath the Galata Bridge. For location, it doesn't get better than this. The staff were very helpful in directing us to the sites and gave us a great recommendation to Amedros Restaurant nearby (also rated high on Tripadvisor). It was so good, we went back again the next night. The rooms and amenities at the White house were just what we needed; beds very comfortable, rooms beautifully decorated and breakfast was wonderful. Our view from the window was the back of the other building, but what tourists must understand is that this is old Istanbul with buildings crowded together. If you want a veiw, go to the roof terrace and enjoy a drink ovelooking the Hagia Sophia and Blue Mosque. Do not come expecting the big resort with concierge and business centre. If you want a pool, go north to the New City. This small boutique hotel is for the serious traveller who appreciates comfort, reliable information, and wishes to maximize their access to the great sights and magic of old Istanbul. If we come back to Istanbul, it will be to the White House.

Reviews.Title: “very good people work there”
Reviews.Author: monicadavydov
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the White house from december 25 to december 29. Room was very small., but very clean. But what makes this hotel so special, it is a people who works there. We are planning another trip to istambul this summer, and we"ll considering to stay there again.(maybe they will give me a bigger room then..). Thank you so much .

Reviews.Title: “Relax after visiting the crowded town”
Reviews.Author: cellebelle
Reviews.Content: Travelled for Christmas with husband and adult daughter. Very pleasant to be picked up at the airport, even as we arrived a bit delayed! I choosed for this hotel because of they have a great triple bedroom. The room was nice decorated, and big enough. Location so good, very close to the highlights.The staff is very helpfull. The daily cleaning was excellent! We could use the internet free.Very good price-quality relation. If we might visit another time Istanbul we should not hesitate to return to the White House.

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant surprise; excellent service, comfortable, good value and great location”
Reviews.Author: terencemoo
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 7 nights and we felt very at home at this very surprisingly gem of a hotel. The staff always made you feel welcomed no matter which shift they are on, from the bellhop (cihan), front desks day (eg Elif) and night, cook, waitress (yagmur) and chambermaid. The rooms may not be big but for the excellent location in the center of the historic district, great service, value for money and comfort, we are very happy to have chosen this place. We hope that the hotel keeps its charm and staff.

Reviews.Title: “Better than previous reviews”
Reviews.Author: totaraAuckland
Reviews.Content: Everything was great, especially the staff. It's so close to all the sights, even the homeless man had gone. The breakfasts catered for all nationalities, the chef even described how he made the pastries with a little translation help.We spent 5 nights and even the November weather came to the party.

Reviews.Title: “If there was a choice higher then excellant I would put this hotel in that category.”
Reviews.Author: BobRiverside_CA
Reviews.Content: Can not say enough about how great this hotel is. From the ride in from the airport, to check in, to the rooms and check out, this place has it all together. Staff was very friendly and very knowledgeable about things to see in the area and the best way to get there. Breakfast was very good and the room was just outstanding. Fantastic location so that everything high on the list to see in Istanbul was within easy walking distance. Short walk to the river as well.

Reviews.Title: “a beautifull hotel in a beautifull city”
Reviews.Author: elenaopoulou
Reviews.Content: I am a hotel owner & I know from the inside how dificult is to pleasure everyone who wants to spend a few days in a place for business or for pleasure. This hotel manages the top. Very good job in services, facilities, very helpfull staff. The wellcome & goodbye present are a sweet move. The location is also convenient. I recommended definitly.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel, close to main attractions in Sultanhamet”
Reviews.Author: Superstereo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the White House Hotel for 2 nights. Check in was quick but we felt a bit of an attitude from the receptionist. He insited in wanting to know immediately whether we would have paid by cash or credit card at the end of our stay. We got two complimentary drinks + turkish delight swhich softened up a little bit the atmosphere. Check in could have been much better. The room was nicely prepared and the overal quality was really good. The real problem is breakfast: the room is very small and it is underground, with almost no windows. However, the main problem is that there is not much to eat. Checkout was very smooth and this time staff was very friendly and warm.

Reviews.Title: “Location couldn't be better”
Reviews.Author: satchelpig
Reviews.Content: We spent several days in Istanbul sightseeing and taking in the city and were thrilled with the White House Hotel. The rooms are nice and well-appointed, if a bit on the small side, but quite comfortable. But reasons 1, 2, 3, 4 and 5 to stay here are that it is in the heart of downtown Istanbul and within walking distance of almost anything you'd want to see in the center of the city. During a 5-day stay, we never got in a cab or took public transportation. We just went wherever we wanted to go. Tons of good restaurants within walking distance, as well as most of Istanbul's major historical attractions (Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque, Spice Market, etc.). We had one minor issue with the White House, which was a shower that simply would not drain properly. We mentioned it to the front desk, and efforts were made to fix it, but it was not corrected by the time we left.

Reviews.Title: “Charming quiet gem close to main historic attractions”
Reviews.Author: FAFJDI
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated off the beaten track, away from the noise of bars and tourists yet just 5-10 minutes walk from Aya Sophia/Blue Mosque/Topkapi etc and the tram service. The hotel is well decorated spotlessessly clean and comfortable. The staff are very friendly and helpful - pre and during stay, breakfast is a buffet of cold meats cheeses fruits breads croissants and sweetmeats [mostly cooked on the premises] and a couple of hot dishes wih omlettes and pancakes available on request [no extra charge]. Downsides - one guest I heard complain had no view [?] - not sure what you expect in the middle of a city but no the hotel doesn't overlook any monument or the sea; another I heard complain about the ruin of a buiding attached to the hotel - yes it is there but it is the same type of historic building/ruin from which the White House was renovated and the same is occuring to that shell [but no - no noise fron any such activity and no - it doesn't impair the experience of staying at the White House] and lastly - a valid point that our experiece attests - the rooms are small - a few are a bit larger - but if you have a small room you need to be organised. If you have a lot of luggage you may struggle with frustration of moving something to get to something else. It was a little annoying but as everything else was good and a restful comfortable night assured we simply organised ourselves. I'd still go back.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel,”
Reviews.Author: JMayCo
Reviews.Content: helpful staff, great location, lovely rooms, good price and excellent breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Same again”
Reviews.Author: pnmdotcom
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights at the end of November. Took advantage of the free transfers for booking three nights and just as well. Missed connecting flight so arrived 11 hours late. Rang hotel from Amsterdam to advise and hotel said no problem they would arrange pick up at 0030 instead of 1345. Sure enough the transfer was waiting at the arrivals exit displaying our name.Great when arriving in a strange city at this time of night. Hotel ideally located in a nondescript, quiet street in the centre of all the attractions in the Sultanahmet area all within a few minutes easy walk. Easy access to the airport by getting a tram from Sultanahmet (less than 5 mins walk) to the end of the line then the adjacent metro to the airport. Allow one hour. Room beautifully decorated and immaculately clean. Had a room at the back - no view but superbly quiet. Good selection at breakfast; not your fry ups of the big Turkish resorts but healthy and nourishing. Finally the staff. I won't pick any individual out, that would be unfair, as they were all superb. Always willing to help and ready to chat with a Turkish tea not far away. They would be a credit to any organisation. A nice touch on checking out, a box of Turkish delight for my partner.So if you want a boutique hotel with superb service in the centre of it all this may be for you. If we go back to Istanbul we will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Will exceed your expectations”
Reviews.Author: Joe-Concierge
Reviews.Content: Full disclosure, I am a practicing travel agent however I paid full tariff for the room at The White House and did not receive any commission or compensation. When we decided we wanted to visit Istanbul during the American Thanksgiving Holiday I had contacted a few of my usual vendors. None of their hotels jumped out at me. The options offered were either in the Taksim Square area which is lively yet a distance from the main historic sites or peripheral to the Sultanahmet neighborhood which is walking distance to the most important sites. We came across The White House via reviews and postings from many European reviews. Arrival: Communication with the hotel was excellent from day 1. We booked the hotel about 2 months prior to arrival. Since we were staying 3+ nights the hotel offered a one-way transfer from/to the airport. We chose to accept their offer upon arrival. After a 9+ hour flight (excellent tail-winds from New York), we arrived in Istanbul early (9AM), after clearing visa/immigration and with no checked luggage, we proceeded to the main entry hall and a driver had our name on a sign. We proceeded to the car and within 25 minutes (even with Istanbul traffic) we arrived at the hotel. When you first arrive, you may be slightly taken aback. You are driving on narrow streets, a true historic quarter with a mix of low-rise buildings that have seen better days. When you pull up to the hotel, it cannot be missed, a gleaming white building, literally a beacon on a nondescript street. In all fairness, Noahâ€™s Ark next door is also well presented. Upon check-in we met Harun who I had been corresponding with. The lobby is small with a seating area. Unlike the typical check-in, Harun had us sit-down and relax. While he pulled up the reservation a fellow employee brought us orange juice and pear flavored Turkish Delight (which I am now addicted to). We were also presented with a gift, a small â€œEvil Eyeâ€� bead, which is to ward off bad spirits. It is a great souvenir of the hotel. Harun also provided a few brochures including restaurant suggestions and options for a Turkish Bath. Room: Once checked in an employee showed us to our room on the 4th floor (the top floor as the roof is open-air). Since it was just two of us we opted for a small double. By American standards the room was small, however by Japanese standards, it is probably a suite. While small it was well laid-out including an expansive bathroom with shower stall, sleeping area, built-in desk, armoire, mini-bar, tea pot (with assorted teas and coffee) and what made the room physically smaller yet was most welcoming a set-back terrace. Yes, a terrace open to the sky. Note, we did see the room across the hall, massive! Seems to be about 4 rooms per floor. Bedding: The bed was truly one of the most comfortable beds I have slept in and I have a Sleep Number bed. It was so comfortable and unfortunately I spend 24+ hours in it due to a later acquired stomach ailment. Location: As mentioned the location is prime. The street is active during the day yet at night it is very quiet (and the doors/windows are soundproof). In the immediate area are many restaurants so you will not starve. About Â½ block away is a small convenience store with soft-drinks and snacks which came in handy when touring. The main strip of the area is about 2 blocks away where there are many restaurants including global chains such as McDonalds and Starbucks and local mainstays including The Pudding Shop and many confectionary stores. This is also where there the tram stops. Within 5 minutes you can walk to the Grand Bazaar. Within 10 minutes an easy walk to The Blue Mosque, the Haghia Sophia and the Topkapi Palace. Be prepared for the hills i.e. bring comfortable shoes. We were literally able to visit most of the sites on our first day. Of note, if heading to Taksim Square, best to take the tram. Breakfast: The White House offers a nice breakfast service, a self-serve in the lower-level which is an expansive dining area. There are juices, coffee/tea, eggs, meats, vegetables, cereals, bread, jam and so forth. The hearty breakfasts allowed us to skip lunch. Dinner: As mentioned there are many restaurants in the area all looking for business. Take note; use the suggestions of the hotel. The restaurants they suggest are excellent both for food and value, you will not be disappointed. Service: This is where the hotel truly shines. As mentioned on the 2nd evening of our trip I got ill with a stomach issue. It was not food poisoning; it was due to the heavy dairy products I had ingested throughout the day. If you are lactose intolerant, be forewarned, Turkish dairy products are addictive yet very, very rich and thus I paid the price. Their ice cream makes gelato taste generic. All the hotel staff was truly caring. The following morning after a somewhat unpleasant night the staff advised where a pharmacy was (I was bedridden) so my wife went and bought the medication. When the maid came in to clean the room, I was laying in bed. She did not speak English and me, no Turkish. However when I pointed to my stomach she filled the tea pot with water and selected a combination of teas from the basket and made me tea. It was a real treat and I did feel much better. Of note, the following morning when I was finally able to make it to breakfast as I poured myself orange juice, the maid came over, said â€œnoâ€� and made me tea instead knowing the acidity of the OJ would probably not be the best option. This is true service! The rest of the hotel staff was truly concerned as well. They would ask my wife if I was OK and when I was able to venture out, they asked how I was doing. This is one of the luxuries of a smaller boutique hotel. Client Mix: The hotel attracts a varied client mix. We met families from the Middle East, a couple from Norway and a few Americans. The hotel offers rooms for many different configurations of guests. Concerning physically challenged accessibility, while there is an elevator, it is small. There are rooms on the first level, however access from the street to the hotel is via three steps and the street itself is cobblestone. When we did check-out, again a smooth transition and the hotel arranged for a car service (a bargain at 35 LTR (approx $26 USD) versus a taxi at 50 LTR). You can also take the tram to the subway however I was still not 100%. The hotel provided us with Turkish Delight as a parting gift as well. If visiting Istanbul and you desire a well-run, clean, perfectly located hotel in the historic neighborhood, The White House cannot be beat. There are many similar hotels in the area and if I had more time I would have â€œpopped-inâ€� and checked them out. I would assume most are excellent, however from past reviews and now personal experience I believe The White House is a notch above the rest. If you are looking for more modern, larger hotel options, may be best to look in the Taksim Square area which is a hub for transit and shopping. However for the short-time we were in Istanbul the location of The White House was prime and a hotel we will recommend to friends and clients.

Reviews.Title: “exellent hotel in sultan ahmed”
Reviews.Author: CHRISTOS_GR60
Reviews.Content: i stayed middle of november 2010 in white house hotel in centrum from istanbul wonderfull position just a2minutes away by feet from aya sofia and blue mosqe. very impressive new hotel, very beautiful designed,not very big ,really home atmosphere.very comfortable rooms and extremely clean. and now the staff. very welcoming people from the first to the last minute. Elif and omar had always a smile .and helped me, bei giving very useful tips. after three nights i left this wonderful hotel wishing to come again in spring time thank you--christos

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous staff!”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveler0624
Reviews.Content: Outstanding service,fantastic breakfast and extremely helpful staff.Don't hesitate to stay here!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!!!”
Reviews.Author: gam23
Reviews.Content: I stayed here after reading all the other reviews and thought all the other reviewers must know what they are talking about. Take it from me they do. It's difficult to add anything new to what has already been said....This is a real gem, fantasic boutique hotel, exceptionally friendly staff, perfect location (everything within a short walk), quiet as well which is a real bonus...lovely restaurants...kebabs were fab -I'm still salavating!!! The Grand Baazar is amazing - my girlfriend loved the endless choice of bags to be bought...and buy she certainly did!!! OUCH!!! I will be coming back ...Istabul is a great city and I found it very cheap as well (compared to placed such as Rome, Paris etc). If you are thinking of visiting this wonderful city, look no further than The White House, you will not be let down!!!

Reviews.Title: “Superlative Experience!”
Reviews.Author: broadabroad55
Reviews.Content: My stay at the White House Hotel defied description in terms of room cleanliness and staff competence. I'm no stranger to upscale venues, but in my mind anyway, the White House succeeds where other, grander, and far more expensive properties, miss the mark. That's because the people who own and those who operate this hotel embody the concept of 'service'. There's an authentic willingness to help, to support, to educate, and to reassure each guest. Istanbul is an experience unto itself, but when I went shopping for Turkish carpets; wanted to 'get' the Whirling Dervishes; needed help honing my negotiating skills in anticipation of the grand bazaar, I had a team of experts at my disposal. When I came back from one excursion or another, I had someone who invited me to sit, have complementary tea, talk about my day. My god, it felt like family. These people deserve my business and the business of my own family and all the other people I care about. They work hard at what they do and it shows. Thank you Elif, Omar, Yagmur, Cihan, Harun and Cafer....you immortalized my trip.

Reviews.Title: “Fantstic”
Reviews.Author: diannembutton
Reviews.Content: We were going to stay one night and ended up staying for a week. The staff were exceptional and the hotel is so close to the historical and cultural centre. We were glad that we took the larger room as it gave us the space we needed. we absolutely recomend this hotel in every aspect you will certainly not be disappointed like us you will want to return as we hold a special place in our hearts for this hotel and its staff. To be made to feel this special from New Zealand meant a lot to John and Di

Reviews.Title: “Great service in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: SaneArtist
Reviews.Content: I was impressed with how friendly and helpful the staff were -- they assisted with everything from restaurant recommendations to making sure my guests knew where to meet me to letting me check in to my flight from the front desk computer. The location was great, very close to the main attractions in Sultanamet and the streetcar line as well. The one downside was the loud drinks delivery to a restaurant across the street at an ungodly hour one morning. But aside from that, a very pleasant stay -- and the free internet was a nice plus!

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable”
Reviews.Author: Indy-puffy
Reviews.Content: If you decide to go to Istanbul you can't miss this wonderful hotel!!!! It's cool and in a great position!!!! the rooms are fantastic!!!! It's a very romantic place and the staff is really nice!!!!! It was like home to us!!!!! No doubts: you must stay here!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “I felt like I was staying with helpful friends”
Reviews.Author: dskid
Reviews.Content: When I first booked our room at the White House it was ranked number one in Instanbul on Trip Advisor. While I have no way of knowing if it is, in fact, the best, it is certainly an excellent choice and deserving of patronage. We went to Turkey for a 16 day tour of the western half of the country and set aside two days before and four days after the tour. The hotel offers to pick up guests from the airport at no charge if one is staying a minimum number of days. While we weren't staying the minimum on our first visit, the hotel nevertheless agreed to pick us up for no charge. Upon check-in the staff was very friendly and helpful; had us sit and served orange juice and Turkish Delight while checking in. The room was obviously new but very small; mattress exceptionally firm; nice foam pillows; TV very small (19â€� LCD) and we didnâ€™t know how to work it; a/c/ worked very well; full amenities in bath; no face cloths; shower only and water in shower started lukewarm and got cooler. Hotel very close to Blue Mosque (150 yards), Aya Sophia, Basilica Cistern, Hippodrome and maybe a 10 minute walk to the Grand Bazaar. If you see my review of the Senatus you'll see that we only spent one night at the WH prior to the tour instead of two. Even though we were staying at another hotel we went back to the WH and asked them to fax our passports to the Florence Nightengale Museum, which they gladly did. Another of many examples of friendly and helpful service. Our last four nights in Turkey we were in room 402 this time; very large in comparison to what we had last time; queen bed; small shower but water temp fine; no face clothes or Kleenex; bed comfortable; four pillows; hair dryer; tea pot; mini bar; small TV that we learned how to operate â€“ several hundred channels. The breakfast room is in the basement and is nothing special. I'm not sure if the decorator was going for an Ottoman feel to the hotel. I thought it was a little over the top and mostly yellow but unless you're doing a photo shoot it shouldn't matter. The hotel also has a couple of netbooks that one can take to one's room and check e-mail or surf the net using the free WiFi. When we checked out at 4 a.m., the hotel gave us a small box of Turkish Delight. The hotel is very new and clean. I left a tip for the maid every day and one afternoon we came back to the room and she'd sprinkled our bed with rose petals. I can't say enough about the people, at every position, who, along with its proximity to major tourist sites, make this hotel worthy of being a visitor's first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Hospitality at its best”
Reviews.Author: doreen15
Reviews.Content: Having just spent 5 nights at the White House Hotel I can honestly say it is the friendliest hotel i have ever stayed at. The receptionist Elif and the bell boy Omar could not have been more obliging . From the housemaids to all the staff friendliness was a keynote. The rooms are impeccably clean if on the tiny side. The car service was terrific . making your arrival so much easier. I would certainly recommend The White House Hotel to anyone visiting Istanbul. Doreen Orsatti Sydney Australia

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant stay”
Reviews.Author: Topenda
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 5 nights based solely on Trip Advisor comments. It's all true, this is not a 5 star hotel, it is a boutique hotel owned by someone who is passionate about service and the welfare of his guests. We turned up at 7am and they had a driver at the airport to pick us up. Awesome! Saved the headache of dealing with the rip off taxi drivers that plague Istanbul. I booked the night before because I wanted to ensure we had a room when we got to the hotel rather than wait till 2pm to check in. Got to the hotel and the lady at check in advised that we would not have to pay for the night before as they had a spare room. What?? Has anyone heard of this kind of service? We stayed at the Ritz Carlton for the last part of our stay and even there they charged us $100 euros for an extra 4 hours late check out. The hotel is centrally located and you can walk anywhere including the mosques and Grand Bazaar. Cafar at the front desk is a great guy and will look after you. They will go to great lengths to ensure your stay is happy. When I complained to them about the Hammam they recommended to me around the corner from the hotel, Cafar told me he would go there and give them a piece of his mind and was very upset that I had not been treated well. Cafar also recommended a fantastic restaurant for dinner (Amedros) - it was the best meal we had in Istanbul for the whole 9 days we were there. The other thing I should mention is the laundry rates. They took our laundry to a laudromat around the corner and just charged us what was charged to them - about AU$10 a bag. They even did the laundry of our friends who weren't staying at the hotel! This above and beyond service is what epitomises this hotel and is consistent with previous reviews. Please note that the rooms are small by Australian standards but normal size by European standards. It can be a little squishy and the shower recess is not designed for large people. I have given the room 5 stars by European standards - so please bear this in mind.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: TreyB50
Reviews.Content: The White House Hotel is in a great location..close to the Blue Mosque, Cistern, Hagia Sophia, Grand Bazaar and more. The staff is very helpful, knowledgeable and extremely nice. I would highly recommend this hotel! Have them book a reservation for the "Turkish Dance" night. It was the highlight of our stay in Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tomoosama
Reviews.Content: Good service and Good location.We stayed 3 bed room and had a breakfast in restaurant. In room elegant and pretty.and breakfast is good taste and New hotel. I recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Service, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Open_Road_333
Reviews.Content: I am pleased to say that we were quite happy with the accommodations at this newer hotel. The room itself was decorated fine, clean and a decent size. The view to the delapitated building in the back wasn't the best, although really didn't interfere with our overall stay. The location was perfect, only minutes from the touristy hot spots, although right in the heart of some enjoyable restaurants. The service by the hotel staff was very impressive. Harum arranged shuttle service from the airport for us, greeted us with a drink of orange juice and some Turkish Delight and got us started on some of the city's highlights. Cafer worked the reception desk during the days and was always extremely helpful, recommended and arranged good restaurants and helped us plan our daily itineraries. He even lent us his personal metro pass for use to get around. (we ended up walking everywhere but his gesture was greatly appreciated). Great service. The only downside was that we believe someone was signalled to check out our room's mini bar, while we were in the midst of checking out. This was immediately after we were asked whether we had used anything from the fridge, where we repied 'no'. This was just a little uncomfortable note to be left on. I'm sure there is a much better way to have handled this. That said, I wouldn't let this get in the way of us staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: MoryLondon
Reviews.Content: Extremely helpful and friendly staff. Spotless rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel of its style”
Reviews.Author: HWalker409
Reviews.Content: The manager Cafer and his staff were welcoming and very friendly. We had planned our own schedule but Cafer's local knowledge and restaurant suggestions were very helpful. The rooms were spotless and tastefully decorated. A small criticism would be that the curtains are too thin on the 1st floor front rooms, the neon lights tended to illuminate the room at night. Breakfast was good and catered for every taste. Would definitely go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, friendly and high quality service”
Reviews.Author: KnutENorway
Reviews.Content: We were staying four nights from October 13 2010 at this lovely hotel. We were four couples from Norway coming to Istanbul celebrating my wife's birthday and exploring the city. The hotel itself is indeed a beautiful one â€“ a boutique style hotel in white and gold with 22 rooms. The location is perfect, within easy walking distance to the top sites in Sultanahmed area (old city), such as Hagia Sofia, the Blue Mosque and the Topkapi Palace. However, what made our stay special was the extraordinary friendly and service oriented staff. Elif and rest of the team gave us a very warm welcome and assisted us with all kind of questions and practicalities far beyond our expectations, such as a roof top reception before going out on the birthday dinner. We highly recommend the White House Hotel as personal, friendly base when visiting Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Feels like home”
Reviews.Author: Reebood
Reviews.Content: Quality service and treatment. Very friendly. Very close to main attraction in sultanahmet.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent boutique hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: speriadvisor
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nigths and everything was as they said so.Mr. Harum Cadirci,the manager, took care of our needs as soon as we went into their property.His staff gave solution to all our demands and doubts.The location is one of the best you can find in Sultanahmet.All the places are reachable by foot,and if you need to go to somewhere else further,the tram buses and metro are very easy to catch. Breakfast was very good and is far beyond what you need for a long touring day.The rooms are very nicely decorated,quiet and neat.Good bathroom and good bed. They have transfer service in and out of the airport which is very convenient,but if you prefer you a combination of tram and metro will get you there for less than $4,00. All the major attractions where a short foot stroll.Both Mosques,the markets,the restaurants,ferries,hamami,Topkapi Palace,the cisterns, are two minutes away from the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Choice”
Reviews.Author: NOLAgirll
Reviews.Content: We were in Istanbul for the first time and weren't sure we'd picked the right hotel for 12 whole days. By the time we left we were planning for the next trip and wouldn't think of staying anywhere else. People rightly talk about the staff as being as helpful as can be, but the rooms are also lovely. They are small by U.S. standards, but exceptionally clean, the beds are comfortable, and the water hot. The decor is also very pretty. The breakfast was good with lots of choices. And, yes, Efir, Cafer, Omar et al were perfectly wonderful. They mapped out everything, made reservations and phone calls and were accommodating in every way. When we asked where to buy a bottle of wine, Cafer sent us a bottle instead. Another time he sent wine and cheese to the room. And we were given gifts when we left. All of that, coupled with a most convenient location made the White House the perfect choice of us.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Istanbul in Every respect”
Reviews.Author: global007
Reviews.Content: I selected this hotel because it rated # 1 by TA and for the rave reviews about Front Desk staff's exemplary service to guests! First, the welcome with a refreshing fresh orange juice after a long international flight and trip from the airport matched what only select 5 star hotels among the best in the world (like Oriental Bangkok) offer. The Front Desk staff offered exceptional tips and advice for what to see and where and how to go for the 3 days we were there. The icing on the cake was when the pick-up shuttle for our Dinner-Cruise did not show up as it was held up in traffic, the hotel Manager and owner took us in his car to the cruise ship dock so that we could board the cruise in time! He even arranged for us to met by the Cruise boat staff at his car and got us best seats! This kind of hospitality and service is of the highest class. The breakfast quality was one of the best. Even if the type of eggs I wanted was not on the buffet, it was made for me. I would not stay at any other hotel in Istanbul. All the attractions were within a 10 minute walk from this centrally located boutique hotel. The room, including the washroom, was very clean and comfortable. Well worth the money charged.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel with wonderful customer service, great location, and very good breakfast included.”
Reviews.Author: jal1107
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel on Trip Advisor advertised as a boutique hotel in a great location. As we wanted to spend a couple of days in Istanbul prior to a Greek Isle cruise in September 2010, we were looking for good value in a great location. The hotel and Manager, Harun Ã‡ADIRCI, is everything the reviewers said. It was a good thing we had the driver meet us (arranged by the hotel) at the airport because it would be kind of hard to find on our own. We were greeted with a glass a juice and a welcome gift. The hotel is within walking distance to the great tourist sites. The breakfast included is wonderful, tasteful, and plentiful. The room we had was very nice and roomy. Harun assisted us in finding a great private walking tour with Emre Ozkara. I would most definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent all round you won't be disappointed”
Reviews.Author: alexandkate77
Reviews.Content: Excellent all round. Ideal location. Staff could not have been more helpful on all matters such as taxis, opening times of museums, and restaurants. Staff speak excellent English. One of the best hotels I have stayed in for this sort of holiday break. Highly reccommended.

Reviews.Title: “Has to be the friendliest hotel in the World!”
Reviews.Author: Dawn267
Reviews.Content: The service from the staff in this hotel was superb. From our arrival, we were made very welcome by Cafer. We received some lovely welcoming gifts (will not spoil your surprise)! During our stay we were given wine and fruit and then on departing another lovely surprise. Our bags were also taken down 2 streets by I think Omar to meet our private taxi. What service!! Elif and the rest of the staff deserve a pay rise. Hotel is also excellently located to visit the sights of this fantastic city. Rooms were lovely. Amedros restaurant is a must visit - we went twice. Also our nightly coffee stop was at Cafe Kybele with it's 4,000 lights - just around corner from hotel. Istanbul is a must visit city & the White House is the perfect place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent.”
Reviews.Author: Stavre
Reviews.Content: Perfect hotel location in the old city close to everything, free transfer from airport to hotel, utmost hotel owner and hotel staff hospitality (especially Mr. Chafer and Mr. Omer), very clean room.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: LizettePretoria
Reviews.Content: A small quiet hotel near to all the major attractions. Staff exceptionally helpful, especially Efir, Omar and the friendly chef. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly and convenient location”
Reviews.Author: tonyg8355
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel after looking at reviews of Istanbul hotels on Tripadvisor and we were not disappointed. Our room (302) was spacious, beautifully decorated and we found all the staff friendly and very helpful to us as first time traveller's to Istanbul. However the best part was the ability for us to walk to all the key destinations in old Istanbul which was a real bonus for us as we did not want to take organised tours.

Reviews.Title: “Super convenient, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Traveler971
Reviews.Content: The White House hotel was lovely. The staff were very helpful and kind, the rooms were clean, and breakfast every day was great (actual coffee in a pot, not a Nestle machine!). My room was gigantic, but some of my friends had tinier rooms. Regardless, the location could not be beat. Would definitely recommend for a stay in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Bangka
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights end of September. The location of the hotel is just great, right in Sultanahmet, walking distance to all the sites we wanted to see: Blue Mosque, Aya Sofya, Topkapi Palace, etc. We also walked to the Grand Bazar, Galata Bridge. If walking is a bit too much, take the tram, the stop is down the hill. Our hotel room was not big, but comfortable enough. Anyway, who wants to spend time in the room in such a wonderful city. Lots of nice restaurants around. The hotel is situated in a quiet street, away from the humdrum. Don't forget to make a picture of the Blue Mosque from the roof terrace at sunset.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service”
Reviews.Author: timmsy80
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Arrived late and the night manager was fantastic. Breakfast was nice and it was close to all the main attractions.

Reviews.Title: “The ideal place to stay on a visit to see the historic sites of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: soetvlei
Reviews.Content: The welcome when we arrived late at night from the airport. Friendly helpful and knowledgeable breakfast chef and staff especially Elif and Omar. The excellent location - we could walk everywhere we wanted to go. Comfortable attractive,clean and quiet accommodation. We will definitely recommend the White House Hotel to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “feeling like home”
Reviews.Author: Marius_olaru
Reviews.Content: Although they have the same offer at breakfast every morning, it is a wonderfull place. Nice rooms, best location possible in Old City, great terrace with great view, and the people there were very kind- answering any question, resolving any problem.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific!”
Reviews.Author: katherineLoo
Reviews.Content: We chose the White House Hotel because of other reviews in TripAdvisor and were not disappointed. This is a lovely small hotel in a great location in Sultanahmed. Our room was very nice, the breakfast is just right and the people who work there are very helpful. We loved being in the middle of retaruarants and activity but having peace and quiet when we weren't out exploring. We would definitely choose this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Harpenden_Travellers
Reviews.Content: The White House Hotel is in a great location for walking to the major sites in the old part of Istanbul.
