Cafer and his colleagues on reception could not have been more helpful and very keen to ensure we enjoyed our stay. The hotel, which has 22 rooms, has been recently fitted out so all is fresh and clean. The bedroom was clean, well furnished and a reasonable size, the bed being very comfortable. There was no bath but the shower was fine. Our room was at the rear of the hotel and the view was very unattractive looking across a narrow light well to an old building although I suspect this is normal in Istanbul. Breakfast was OK, with hard boiled and scrambled egg, fresh fruit, cereal, bread, cake, cheese etc.

Reviews.Title: “Just an outstanding hotel with extraordinary service in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: Claver10
Reviews.Content: Wecould not have made a better choice in our first visit to Istanbul than the White House Hotel. While small, our room was immaculate and comfortable. The entire staff went out of their way to make us welcome and assist us in so many ways in our four days there. Every restaurant suggestion turned out to be both delicious and reasonabley priced.

Reviews.Title: “All about great personal service!”
Reviews.Author: radboard
Reviews.Content: The White House has a great location near the old city attractions. It's a brand new building too. What really brings the great reviews though is the people, they went out of there way at every step of the process to help, Thanks everybody, you did great!

Reviews.Title: “Charming and friendly boutique hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: jkgca
Reviews.Content: This lovely hotel is just a few minutes walk from the top sites in the city. The attractive rooms are comfortable with attention to detail. From the minute you walk into the small charming lobby, one feels the warm welcoming atmosphere. The breakfast buffet is convenient and they even try to have some variety from day to day. The rooftop terrace is complete and will be pleasant in nice weather. But what stands out most as previously mentioned is the staff. Elif was unbelievably helpful trying to assist me in resolving my problem when the airlines inadvertently canceled my reservation. She is definitely special and they are lucky to have her there. The entire rest of the staff is also friendly and quite attentive and go out of their way to be pleasant, helpful, and kind. They function more like a family than a group of employees. Hats off to the manager for creating this environment. btw, he too tried to help me with my reservation issues. Thank you... All and all, I think this is a great choice for an enjoyable stay in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful little boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: jojoinboston
Reviews.Content: The White House Hotel was a wonderful discovery on my recent trip to Istanbul. Everyone there was most welcoming and helpful. We arrived from our cruise ship hours before the hotel's actual check-in time but that was not a problem. We were brought refreshments and our bags were taken graciously. The staff could not have been more welcoming, especially Elif at the front desk. She actually stayed beyond the end of her shift to help my friend who was having a major problem with her airline reservations. The rooms were immaculate and ours was quite spacious and nicely decorated. The breakfast which was included in the room price was excellent...especially the pomagranite juice on our last day there. If I return to Istanbul, I would look forward to another stay at this very well-located hotel. It was a five minute walk to Hija Sofia and ten to Topkapi Palace and the Blue Mosque. Lovely find!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Toronto Friends Staying at the White House Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: jlkToronto
Reviews.Content: We were a group of 4 couples that stayed at the White House Hotel for 6 days. Room were spotless clean. A little small, but you are never in your room. Bathrooms were modern and always supplied with lots of useful items. Breakfast was good each morning with a good variety. The best part of the hotel were the people on staff. Helpful, personable, and always ready to help you and please you. Thanks again to Jaffer, and all the young friendly staff at the White House...Perfect location. We would definately stay at the white house again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: ABUk
Reviews.Content: The staff are undoubtedly the star attraction at the White House. Not just courteous and helpful, but very friendly and seemingly genuinely concerned that their guests have an enjoyable time. The welcome drink and small gift on both arrival and departure were nice touches. Breakfast was good with a wide selection of fruits, cheese and meats. The room was recently decorated and very pleasant. The shortcomings all resulted from the size of the room which was on the small side. Only one bedside table, so small that with the lamp and telephone in place there was no other available space. The other side of the bed had a desk and this was the only flat surface in the room. There was a small wardrobe (with safe) and that was it. No drawers, no cupboards, no other furniture. The overall impression of the room was favourable, but the limitations of size and furniture made it less than practical. The location is very good. A quiet road very close to a wide selection of restaurants and attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Charming boutique hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: SusieDBoston
Reviews.Content: This lovely hotel gets high marks for the top front desk staff. Elif and Cefar provide great customer service, and it's apparent that they love their work. My room was small, tastefully appointed with great attention to detail, and quiet. Great area to walk around filled with restaurants and nightlife.

Reviews.Title: “a decent hotel with an outstanding staff.”
Reviews.Author: schmidlapp
Reviews.Content: I'll sum it up as I told them when we left, the hotel is nice no complaints probably similar to many others in the area. What makes them different is the high quality of their staff. They made it excellent

Reviews.Title: “An excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: Lombard71
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 days and thoroughly enjoyed the facility, service and location. Whilst quite newly built, oddities such as the tiny shower stall that didn't drain quickly enough to have a reasonable shower; and the bed that squeaked horribly (Room 107) The reception staff were just wonderfully helpful and friendly. About the best I've experienced. Breakfast quite basic but OK to get started. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location”
Reviews.Author: FLTraveler1980
Reviews.Content: We very much enjoyed our time in Istanbul. The WH hotel is located in a very central location to almost everything. We spent 4 nights there and only took a cab twice. Once was our return trip to the airport. Cafer was extremely helpful from start until finish. WH hotel is very close to a large group of restaurants. We would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Location Luxury Lovely”
Reviews.Author: FCCWaterford
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with friends recently. We have travelled extensively throughout the capital cities of Europe, and beyond, over the past 10 years. This hotel ticks all the boxes for visitors to such a large and crowded city. My title really sums it up: the location is perfect for those who wish to stay within walkingdistance of the main tourist attractions, the luxury of the hotel is top class and the whole experience, particularly the very (and genuine) attentive staff, makes for a lovely city break. I see from other reviews that poor Emir doesn't get a mention, he was most helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff and great location”
Reviews.Author: Anneke012
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the White House Hotel for 3 nights and we really enjoyed our stay. The staff is extremely friendly, helpful and always smiling and we believe this is where the hotel positively distincts from other hotels. The rooms are new, very clean and the beds are comfortable, although the room (and shower) we had was on the small side. However, as we only stayed for 3 nights that was no real issue for us. The location of the hotel is great, only a few minutes walk from all the main tourist attractions in Sultanahmet and some good restaurants. The street where the hotel is located looks indeed a bit pauperized (the hotel is one of the few modernized buildings in the street) and there is a homeless person sleeping in front of the hotel. However, we never felt unsafe. The benefit is that the hotel is located in a quiet street, there is no noise from traffic and a supermarket is very nearby. Finally, we very much appreciated the free and fast WIFI.

Reviews.Title: “Staff are very helpful, but hotel does not come up to 4 star quality”
Reviews.Author: Karen_Oaksford
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a week's stay at the White House Hotel. We had booked this hotel on the glowing reviews from this website. However, we were disappointed. As lovely and helpful as the staff were during our stay, my husband and I felt let down by several other aspects of the hotel. The room and bathroom were small, and the shower unit was absolutely tiny, so much so it was almost unusable. The hotel is centrally located, but it is in a street of run down buildings. Our room was on the first floor, and seemingly very close to the laundry as we were subject to the noise of tumble dryers and washing machines every morning; our room also overlooked a building with a tramp in the porch...charming. The room was generally kept clean, although twice we had to request basics that house-keeping had failed to top up, such as toilet rolls and soap. Breakfast was Turkish-style but fairly basic, and we found the hot options at breakfast, such as boiled and scrambled eggs, over-cooked and inedible (my boiled egg was blue inside!). The hotel also does not offer a laundry service, nor a return shuttle service to the airport. On leaving, we were asked by the very friendly reception staff to write a review on Trip Advisor, as they "rely on this for future business". It's a shame to be so negative when the staff are so helpful, but this hotel really doesn't satisfy the usual expectations of a 4 star establishment.

Reviews.Title: “a very professionally run hotel”
Reviews.Author: pamkAustralia
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the White House Hotel recently and couldnt fault it. On arrival we were met with a drink and some turkish delight and then shown our lovely roomy room. The staff were always extremely friendly helpful and courteous. The position of the hotel was perfect, as it was only a hop, step and jump to the many sites. the breafast was typically Turkish with the addition of scrambled eggs - very tasty and wholesome. It will be lovely when they get their new terrace in operation and you can enjoy your breakfast on the roof. Thankyou to all at theWhiteHouse for a very memorable stay.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT!”
Reviews.Author: MariannM4
Reviews.Content: We could not have asked for a better hotel, staff and beds to support our stay in Istanbul. I went there to celebrate my 40th birthday, and I selected a smaller hotel due to price but also in hope to have some of the personal atmosphere, and I was NOT let down. We were greated at the reception as we had been long lost family. The receptionists Elif and Cafe were just amazing. I was given fruit and wine and cake on the terrace for my birthday, and felt really special. The cake was served despite a local shutdown of power in the whole area! They climbed 4 flights of stairs in the dark and out onto the terrace singing happy birthday - Thank you you wonderful, beautiful people. Even before our trip Mr. Harun Cadirci was most helpful with suggestions and recommendations, and patiently helped me with all kinds of questions re. our trip. The beds were new and really comforting, even for my friend with back problems. The rooms were clean and all staff very helpful and sweet. We stayed in 201 and 301 and had great space in our room, even though we were 3 people sharing (I see some have been dissapointed in size in the reviews above). We were pleasantly surprised re. size. The location is perfect if you want to walk to all the old sites. We went to dinner one night at the Taksim area, but too busy for us (we are not 22, but 40+), and after dinner returned "home" to our local area to relax and enjoy. Great restaurants, just around the corner, so no need to go far for a good meal. We will recommend this hotel to anyone, and we will definitely stay here again on our next trip back to Istanbul. Thank you Elif, Cafer and Harun for making our trip so pleasant and unforgettable. :)

Reviews.Title: “I would recommend staying in this lovely hotel to anyone”
Reviews.Author: Septemer10
Reviews.Content: Being quite fussy I was very impressed with this hotel and did not expect such high quality service and comforts. This hotel very clean and the staff are outstanding. All the extra little touches and extra service was very noticable and very very enjoyable. I can not fault this hotel at all and if I ever go back to Istanbul I will most definately book into the White House Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value at great location”
Reviews.Author: Nowhereone
Reviews.Content: Boutique hotel within walking distance of everything worth doing in Istanbul. Haghia Sophia, Blue Mosque, Basilica Cistern, Topkapi Palace, Grand Bazaar, Spice Bazaar. Elef at the front desk was extremely helpful. If you have a problem, the hotel staff makes sure they make it right. Intimate atmosphere of a small hotel. Quiet and comfortable rooms. Do bring a washcloth for the shower, though, or better yet, buy one at the Grand Bazaar. Wireless internet in room is free and hassle-free. They even picked us up at our cruise port instead of the airport for free. Everyone aims to please at this hotel. We felt very comfortable staying here in Istanbul, our first time, and would do so again.

Reviews.Title: “A HOTEL WELL WORTH A RECOMMENDATION”
Reviews.Author: GerdSkien
Reviews.Content: Gerd Friends Skien, Norge 22. september 2010 New and nice hotel Excellent breakfast.. . Staff was superb pleasant and helpful. Clean and tidy rooms. We were 4 couples age + 60, and all eight were 100% content. The hotel was centrally placed with short distances to historic places, markeds and restaurants (walking distance).We recommend this hotel to others who want a pleasant and peaceful hotel in a busy town. Other guests we met had the same experience as us .

Reviews.Title: “just what we needed”
Reviews.Author: ancientcouple
Reviews.Content: The staff and rooms were excellent, English speaking staff most helpful wuth arrangements . Welcome was very welcoming! Good breakfast choice, but they need a new , better toaster! Impressive gold and white decor, comfortable bed and easy to use safe in wardrobe. Shower water temperature a bit difficult to control.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Experience”
Reviews.Author: jdgebutch
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have traveled extensively , and after the lack of smiles of Russia and Ukraine, the White House Staff was a welcome change. From the manager, who when I introduced him to my wife as the "boss", quickly corrected me and said " at the white house we were the boss", to the chambermaid, all were very gracious, helpful, and wanting to please.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to imagine a better place to stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: BDBoyle
Reviews.Content: The White House Hotel has everything you could want for a visit to Istanbul. The location is great, walking distance to Hagia Sophia and the Blue Mosque. It is also walking distance to two tram line stops (Gulhane and Sulthanamet), which means you can walk downhill to and from the tram every time. The hotel rooms are elegant and a nice size, the bathrooms are modern, and the beds are comfortable. The staff is very helpful with restaurant recommendations/reservations. Also, the hotel's roof deck is a great place to have a beer in the evening while staring out at the Bosphorous. And all at very reasonable prices. My wife & I just did two weeks in Europe, and White House was one of the best places we stayed on our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Staff, Hotel.........Not so Much”
Reviews.Author: SteveMedicoff
Reviews.Content: Sorry Harun and Elif, despite your unbelievable and courteous service, I have to disagree with the masses on the feedback. I have always counted on TripAdvisor to help plan out our annual European vacations, and I have to say, this time you let me down. For every of the five days we stayed there, my wife and I looked at each other with wonderment on how this could be rated number one. In fairness, let me talk about the positives.... The Service - Elif and Harun, along with the entire team, were absolutely the most amazing staff one could imagine, true care and concern, fabulous english, there for you before you think you need them. The Location, If you want to be near all of the most amazing restaurants and sites in the old city, you could not find a better location. And now for our concerns, The Room - We stayed in room 305, was very small, with almost no room for luggage or to neatly keep your stuff organised. If you wanted to relax, be prepared to lie in bed only. In Istanbul for the first time, I am prepared to forgive on size, but I can't forgive the noise during the day. Around 7 or 8 each morning, and going steady till around after supper, a very loud industrial washer would run continuously, making so much noise it was horrible. We tried several times to have an afternoon nap before going out for the evening, and found it impossible. We heard the noise all throughout the hotel, or would have asked for another room. The Location - The street that the hotel is on, while near the center of most attractions, is very, very rundown. Homeless person living on the steps across from the Hotel, clearing his nose and lungs every few minutes, was just gross. Sorry TripAdvisor contributors, going to have to disagree with you on this one. One thumb down on the hotel, despite the great service.

Reviews.Title: “5 star quality without the 5 star price”
Reviews.Author: T09824
Reviews.Content: I've traveled to Istanbul many times and stayed at many places looking for the perfect hotel. This last visit I finally found it at the White House Hotel. It's a beautiful, clean and extremely comfortable boutique hotel. This hotel equals if not exceeds some of the 5 star hotels as far as the basic accommodations are concerned. The location is away from the main tourist area but only minutes away from the main sites in Sultanahmet. The hotel is fairly small which leads to its homey and cozy feeling. The staff is exceptional and will do everything possible to accommodate your every need. The two staff members I dealt with, Elif and Omer, really go out of their way to make you feel welcome and part of the White House Hotel family. The hotel and rooms are spotless and have everything you need such as shampoos, soap and other health and beauty aids. The included breakfast offers hot and cold choices which are more than enough to get your day off to great start. The only disappointing thing is that the view from the rooms is not great but there is a rooftop terrace that does offer a limited view of the Sultanahmet area. I will never have to spend time searching for another hotel to stay in; this one is the best.

Reviews.Title: “Such excellent service, fantastic location, great value!”
Reviews.Author: J0_mc
Reviews.Content: 1. Was the hotel close to things (e.g. transport, attractions, restaurants)? 5min walk to Hagia Sofia and Blue Mosque, restaurants and trams. Numerous other sights and tourist things very close, couldn't get a better location!! 2. Was the hotel in a safe area? Very safe. 3. Was there much noise at night? No noise. 4. What was the quality and cleanliness of the hotel furniture and fittings like (e.g. bed, lock-up safe, shower)? Very comfortable furnishings, clean, modern, and elegant design. 5. Do the hotel staff provide a good service (e.g. competence, attitude, availability)? Extremely helpful and friendly, with a great sense of humour!! They really care about offering a superior service to guests. Always available. 6. What were the hotel amenities like (e.g. breakfast, restaurant, pool, bar, car parking)? Nice breakfast buffet, but no bar, restaurant, parking or pool. Only suggestion is to include more bread options for westerners who like thier toast! 7. Did the room come with extras (e.g. minibar, TV, internet, air-con, tea making facility)? Internet available on laptop for free at reception. Tea making facilities in room, minibar, and air con. Windows can open as well. 8. Other / general comments: We loved staying at this hotel and if we ever return to Istanbul, will definitely return!!!

Reviews.Title: “I'll be back!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Girlfriends40
Reviews.Content: My friends and I spent an unforgetable weekend in Istanbul with the great help of the extremely service oriented staff (Elif and Cafer) at the White House Hotel. We had great rooms - endured a good breakfast each morning and had walking distance to all places that we wanted to chek out. Restaurants and the usal sightseeing places and not to forget shopping. The hotel helped us book a faboulous guide that made sure we were well taken care off on the sightseeing trip us through the streets of old town. If you want to see Istanbul I highly recommend staying at the White House Hotel. I'm sure I will be back soon to see more and shop more :)

Reviews.Title: “This is an exceptionally good hotel”
Reviews.Author: ctheworldHullbridge
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a fabulous location for both the sights and good restaurants. The room was of a high standard and they had clearly focused on what customers want , a comfortable bed and an excellent shower. Since opening they have added a roof terrace which gives great views over the city but their most valuable asset are their staff who are truly exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and staff - don't hesitate to book!”
Reviews.Author: Mapman123
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the White House Hotel for seven nights and could not find anything to fault. Without exception the staff, who are always polite and courteous, go out of their way to ensure your stay is the best it can be. Served in a light and airy room breakfast consists of cereals, meats, cheeses, breads and cakes etc. Yagmur and Omar were always in attendance, making the whole experience a delight. The roof top terrace offers views across Istanbul, especially atmospheric at night when the major sights are floodlit. On reception Elif and Emrah were on hand to offer advice and book tours or taxis - nothing was too much trouble. When my wife needed some medical help Omar was only too happy to escort her to the pharmacy and hospital to translate. For the remainder of our stay he always asked how she was and if she required any further assistance. At the end of our holiday we were sorry to go and felt we were leaving new friends behind. When we visit this amazing city again, the White House Hotel (and its welcoming staff) will be one of the places we will look forward to visiting most.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent small hotel in the historic area of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: johnsmith47
Reviews.Content: I rented two rooms for my wife and adult children. Both were family rooms that had two beds, a single and a double. The hotel is located a few blocks from a street with a tramline and the Haga Sophia and Blue Mosque, Topkapi, the Grand Bazaar, Hippodrome and other historic sites. It is the perfect location for someone who wants to be in walking distance of what was the historic center of Istanbul and Constantinople. If you like to walk, you are about 20 mins walk from the Golden Horn and the port for Bosporus cruises or ferries to the Asia side. The hotel offers free pick up from the airport, but will charge you 45 euros for a small van to return you to the airport. With 4 adults and several large bags, an Istanbul taxi could not have taken us all to the airport. The hotel is relatively recently renovated. The rooms and interior spaces were immaculate. The bedrooms were large by European standards, and typical for an American hotel. The staff was extremely friendly and very helpful with recommendations for restaurants and local travel directions. We had especially good service from Cafer, Elif (also a tour guide at Topkapi on her day off) and Omar. With the tram nearby, it was easy to use the tram and a funicular to travel to Taksim square, Istanbul's equivalent to Times Square in NYC. The area around the hotel is called Sultanamet. According to one of my sons, a travel guide says it is a working class, conservative area. Although there are many tourists and tour buses in the area, the hotel is on a quiet side street with a few businesses that don't generate a lot of traffic. We did not hear any street noise in our rooms. The bathroom is typical for a European hotel. The shower is a plastic capsule with handheld and waterfall show heads. Breakfast has eggs and something like Vienna sausages, along with a choice of cheese, yogurt, cereal, fresh fruit, tomatoes, cucumbers,bread and cake, very good coffee and tea. There really isn't any nightlife in this area, although we did find a place of a 3 man band playing in an open air lounge with water pipes with flavored tobacco. Some restaurants do not serve alcohol, although most do. The service was just about the best we have ever experienced. One of my sons called to ask where he could buy some beer and the hotel sent someone to buy it for him and bring it to his room, even though they had some in the minibar. They will soon open a rooftop area to serve breakfast. In their literature, they say they are not a 4 or 5 star hotel, but a boutique hotel. I would agree completely with that description. There is free wi fi in the rooms and they will let you use their computer to print our boarding passes and other information. We were very pleased with our stay and would stay there again, when we return to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “A quality hotel in an ideal location”
Reviews.Author: adsley
Reviews.Content: If you want to be in the middle of all the sights and yet in a peaceful location then this is the hotel for you. The staff were all welcoming, the rooms excellent, as was the service. On our last night we sat on the roof terrace looking at the Blue Mosque, Sophia Agya and the changing lights of the bridge.....perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Ecellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: Escobarr
Reviews.Content: Superb location, very near to the main historical sites . Warm hospitality. Extremely clean.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you for a wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: ShyTK
Reviews.Content: Ok I know this review is a bit late but a promise is a promise and after the wonderful welcome we received when staying at the hotel it's only fair that we tell everyone about it - just please don't get booked up next time I want to stay!!! My husband and I booked a stay at The White House Hotel for my 40th Birthday in April 2010. It was intended as a quick stop off on the way to Northern Cyprus but it was much, much more than that. Harun (thank you !!!) was fantastic even before we arrived dealing with all the things that my husband had asked for to make the stay "special". The emails came back incredibly quickly, saying the room reserved was "special" (and it was!), the taxi had been booked, etc, etc, There's nothing that I can add that hasn't already been said in the other reviews - so fantastic hotel, great location, close to all attractions, safe surroundings, (don't let the first view of the street at night put you off) it really is safe, metro at the bottom of the street and don't miss a visit to the nearby underground cysterns. We walked around the area until very late at the weekend nights and had absolutely no problems at all. It's the cleanest, best kept hotel I've ever stayed in, it was newly opened and it really shoed - everything really was top quality. The staff were as everyone says friendly, well infomed, helpful able to make some lovely recommendations - what they didn't know about Istanbul really isn't worth knowing. Being a bit of an independent explorer I was a bit worried before we went that the recommendations by the staff might feel a bit "pushy" (that's the reserved British in us) but this absolutely was not the case. They recommended places to eat/see but were also more than happy to direct us to other places that I'd earmarked - telling us the best local food to try rather than trying to change our minds. The nice touches from the hotel/staff just went on and on (even a thank you email when we arrived home). The taxi was waiting for us at the airport, the driver told us all about the city/sights, the hotel had a birthday cake waiting for me in reception, the good luck eye on arriving and the Turkish Delight on leaving - it just went on and on and on. The whole staff and management of the hotel really should be congratulated on the customer service. We tried throughout the 4 days to work out who the actual "manager" or owner was but it was just impossible as all the staff really took a personal pride in the hotel (quite rightly so). I felt like I was in one of those training videos - the ones that show the bad customer service as "before" and the outstanding customer service as the "after". Take my word for it this really was the after one - even with the high standard that they've set I'm sure any stay here will exceed all your expectations. I'm so pleased to see that they are planning a roof top terrace as this was the only thing that I would have like to have when staying there (another sign that they can anticipate their customers needs?). To be honest though I bet if I'd asked them while I was there they'd have sorted this out for me as well!!

Reviews.Title: “This is a great place to stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Freybe12
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a wonderful stay at the Whitehouse Hotel. Omar and Elif were fantastic,helpful and caring, and made our stay just perfect. If you are going to Istanbul this is the place to stay at a very reasonable price. John & Elandra Chivers

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous find!”
Reviews.Author: joellena
Reviews.Content: There is a reason why Trip Advisor states that White House Hotel in Istanbul is #1. We stayed there following a two week Crystal Cruise and loved the hotel....great location, service, clean, attractive etc. The block that it is located in is a little seedy but the city must be in the process of redoing everything because the rest of the neighborhood is ok. Great restaurants within one block and all of the important sights are quite close walking distancel. \The staff was amazing and the attention to detail excellent . We usually stay in five star hotels but I wanted to try something different and I am really glad that we did

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is excellent in every respect”
Reviews.Author: trish041
Reviews.Content: The staff were very friendly and helpful with wonderful service. We would recommend it to everybody. The hotel is very conveniently placed for sight-seeing and nice and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Fascinating”
Reviews.Author: danielttrtt
Reviews.Content: We are very impressed from White House Hotel. It is a wonderful place in the very heart of Istanbul, ideal for sightseeing (the distance from Aghia Sophia is just 5 minutes walk). The staff is wonderful, extremely helpful and very polite! The rooms are elegant, very clean and comfortable. We highly reccomend this hotel to everybody!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: hbroamer
Reviews.Content: We reserved a room for 3 and it was a reasonable size. The hotel has a great location if you want to be visiting sites in the Sultanahmet area. The staff is very friendly and accomodating. We stayed during Ramadan and we were fasting. So we asked for a night meal (before sunrise) instead of the breakfast. It was no problem. We had our "very early" breakfast delivered to our room at the right time. Thank you Cafar for all your help.

Reviews.Title: “Spotless, Convenient and Helpful”
Reviews.Author: Sheg
Reviews.Content: Had the opportunity to stay at the White House Hotel for four nights in the beginning of August and three nights at the end. Very much looked forward to the professionalism and cleanliness of the hotel when I returned at the end of the month! Elif, Cafer, Harun, "Tom-Tom" and the entire staff are FABULOUS. Beyond helpful....I am not sure that there isn't anything they wouldn't do for you. You receive a warm welcome, the rooms are spotless and the hotel is very centrally located. Istanbul is a major city and yes there is some street noise as you would expect. The "basement" breakfast area is bright white with casement windows and is fresh and very good. The chef was delightful and made homemade pastries and bread daily. PLUS the coffee was fresh and NOT nescafe! The rooftop terrace opened a day or two after I left and will be a wonderful place to eat and relax. I stayed in three different style rooms and for a single person they were all terrific. The A/C system worked like a charm and was quiet!!! Book early at this hotel; the later you book the higher the prices. Terrific experience.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible staff”
Reviews.Author: TetaS
Reviews.Content: The staff was exceptionally helpful, going so far as to buy me an alarm clock late at night when I realized I needed one. Breakfast was great; rooms were clean\, e-mails were answered promptly when I was setting up this reservation. If you are arriving from the Ataturk airport, the metro and tram works perfectly and may be a quick as driving. The tram takes you very close to the hotel and your transportation will only cost 3 TKL. Hot tip! You can get really detailed directions for using the metro from the airport off of the internet. Have fun. Istanbul is beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location,Warm & Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: mwhit
Reviews.Content: Everything positive about this Hotel is all True,A Great Location ,5 minute walk to all the Major attractions ,Istanbul has to offfer,The Hotel Staff are all very helpful and pleasant,A wonderful breakfast was available each morning and was a great way to start each day,We were given a free transfer from the airport to The Hotel which was a blessing after our long flight from Brisbane Australia,and were welcomed with a cold drink and Turksih Delght. I would have no hesitation in recomending this Hotel to anyone who may be venturing to Istanbul. We had room 105 which was perfect a good size and great aircon with very comfortable Bed. Maurice & Tony. Brisbane-Australia

Reviews.Title: “Decent clean hotel but overrated.”
Reviews.Author: n0problem
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean & well situated for sights. Limited breakfast choice and the small room spoilt the stay. Staff was friendly but not so well informed. Kumkuit Fish restaurants are terrible (donâ€™t eat there). One free transfer to Ataturk airport given by the hotel was nice but they overcharged us on a transfer from Sabiha Gokcen airport. Should be â‚¬40 but we paid â‚¬60 to hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The White House... like staying with friends in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: ChristineM58
Reviews.Content: Though we have had several trips to Europe, this was our first time in Istanbul. From the minute we entered the hotel, and were asked to have a seat and given refreshments we had more of a feeling of visiting a friend than registering at a hotel. The accommodations for three of us (family with an adult child) were in a large and very comfortable room. The hotel is close to everything, but on a quiet street to give rest when you need it. The very best part of our stay at the hotel was the very helpful staff particularly the concierge who went out of her way to answer questions and provide really useful information about sights in Istanbul. Even to the point of providing us with directions to an English speaking pharmacist when we needed it. She is an enormous asset to the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: 56003John
Reviews.Content: The staff at this beautiful hotel is very helpful. It is within walking distance of all the sights. This is a new hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in the heart of the tourist attractions.”
Reviews.Author: bholecko
Reviews.Content: Friendly and laid-back atmosphere, great breakfast with classic architecture. Wish we had more time.

Reviews.Title: “The White House Hotel is a special place to be”
Reviews.Author: Pebs13
Reviews.Content: I was in White House Hotel in Istambul and it was a great experience! The location is fantastic - in the Hearth of Istambul - and everything there, were special. Good service, good rooms, good breakfast and very Good Friends!!! I recomend!!! PatrÃ­cia and Rami/ Brazil

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay: thoughtful, kind and in the heart of old Istanbul.”
Reviews.Author: MargVic
Reviews.Content: From the good luck charm at the beginning to the gift of Turkish Delight at the end, this is a place that treats you well. I had arranged my own transport to the hotel; so they offered me free transport to the airport at the end of my stay. There was no need to do this. I had ended my stay and was asking about various forms of transport to the airport, which I fully expected to pay for myself. They offered it. Every member of staff I met was warm, friendly and helpful - even to the extent of accompanying me to a restaurant when I was unsure of the location.

Reviews.Title: “The White House staff always went the extra mile with a smile!”
Reviews.Author: Mick_McArdle
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed for two nights in August 2010. From our first contact to make the reservation to the waves from the staff as we left, the White House Hotel and its staff exceeded our expectations in every way. They arranged a pickup from the airport and a dropoff back to the airport. Upon arrival, we were given orange juice in reception. In fact, whenever we sat waiting for friends we were offered a cooling drink. The staff arranged a wonderful boat trip on the Bosphorous for us with pickup and dropoff at the hotel. This, by the way, is a great way to get some perspective on Istanbul. I needed a plug adapter; one appeared. Advice on restaurants? The knowledgeable young staff had it all. And always delivered with a smile. The hotel is great, the staff is wonderful and friendly, the location is superb (in Sultanahmet district, close to Hagia Sophia, the Blue Mosque, and Topkapi Palace). Stay here but leave a room for us on my next visit!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great location, great value, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: OC_Adventurer
Reviews.Content: I wish every city had a hotel this perfect. The service was amazing! Just a block or 2 from the Hagia Sophia. Ornate Victorian decor but not too distasteful. Construction went on past 7PM. The breakfast was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value in Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: LincolnCenter
Reviews.Content: Excellent, brand new interior, roof garden just finishing renovation now. A/C, lighting, plumbing, furniture all new and clean. Best location in best part of town. 40 yards from the Sultanahmet tram stop, 40 yards from the Basiclica Cistern, lots of higher end and mid range dining within 60 yards. 5 min ealk to Haya Sophia, 7 min to Blue Mosque, 10 min to Spice Market, 15 min to Grand Bazaar. Staff was very comfortable and fluent in English, professional, and graceful. Extensive brakfast choices of many fruits both fresh and dried, hot choices, breads, probably 10 pasrty choices incl 2 halvahs, etc. Would certainy stay there agan, no need to try to "do better". Only change for us is avoid front rooms as the street lights are too much for the cutains. No noise though until work hours as there is some commercial printing done in an adjacent building.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is a truly wonderful experience in the heart of the old city.”
Reviews.Author: Desmond013
Reviews.Content: I travel extensively around the world and it is seldom you find a place that has a staff that is so friendly, effiecient and professional, from the cleaners, to the dining room staff, to the front desk. The room was fabulous, enough place to work, wonderful bed, great decor and good bathroom. The hotel has been recently renovated and is in mint condition. It was my wife and I's first trip to Istanbul and the front of house staff are well informed as to where to go, what to do and how to get there. The hotel is incredibly well situated being in the centre of the old city and three minutes walk to the Hagia Sophia. From there the Blue Mosque, Basilica Cistern, Archaeological Museum, Topkapi Palace and many other cultural and sightseeing destinations. The area is also peppered with fabulous restaurants. What a wonderful hotel, what a wonderful city - we will be back. Professor Des Laubscher

Reviews.Title: “3 greats - rooms, staff, location”
Reviews.Author: mandy8gal
Reviews.Content: My husband usually prefers brand hotels like Hilton, but was willing to try this boutique hotel on the recommendation of a friend. When the taxi dropped us off, I was a little leery because it was on a small side street with bit of construction. But from the moment we stepped inside the White House proved itself to be the best possible choice for a visit to Istanbul. The staff is just outstanding in their professionalism and friendliness. The quick check-in included a refreshing cocktail and a taste of turkish delight. They gave us lots of detailed advice on touring Istanbul and arranged for a last minute guide (Numan Tasdogan, highly recommend him). They were just so friendly and accommodating, you would think we were the only guests in the hotel. The rooms were a bit small for American standards - think more like London or Paris hotels. Very pretty furnishings in the Turkish style, comfortable beds, A/C worked great. One of our rooms was the "Family Room" and this one is quite roomy - worth the extra if you like to spread out. Breakfast room has plenty of space and a generous assortment of foods. And location just can't be beat. We were able to walk to all the historic attractions - Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Basilica Cistern, Topkapi Palace. Lots of little bazaars around and the tram stop is just a few blocks away. Lots of good restaurants in the neighborhood. What more could you want - this place is a find!

Reviews.Title: “Great location...”
Reviews.Author: Lucysfriend
Reviews.Content: The White House Hotel is on a quiet street just a block or two from the tram and is surrounded by many attractions and sites. We found the staff absolutely wonderful and helpful. Our room was a bit small but beautifully decorated and extremely comfortable. The hotel is only 8 months old so everything is shiny and new. Breakfast was excellent - always some type of hot egg dish, cakes, fresh fruits and vegetables. It was colorful and extensive. At the front desk, Cafer made wonderful suggestions for a rooftop restaurant and was extremely helpful in telling us about public transportation to get from one place to another. He even joined us one evening when he was off duty and we spent a relaxing time learning about Turkey and sharing stories. Emrah covers the evening shift and was wonderfully accommodating and helped me with the hotel loaner laptop. A young woman covers the front desk in the morning. I didn't write her name down and I can't recall it right now, but she was a former tour guide and was so helpful with making suggestions and giving transportation instructions. I just can't say enough about the staff. We loved our visit and would not hesitate to recommend it to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Very central, modernised hotel”
Reviews.Author: FreidaBrisbane
Reviews.Content: The White House Hotel in Istanbul is excellent, being recently redecorated and very close to all the major tourist attractions including the regular Mosque calls. The receptionists are friendly and helpful with every request answered with "I have a friend...". Our basic room was small but adequate including a balcony. One of the top rated restaurants on TripAdvisor is conveniently located just down the same street. The breakfast buffet is included in the room price and has a good variety of food. There are no visible street signs in central Istanbul so be sure to have a very detailed map if you're looking for the hotel on foot.

Reviews.Title: “Turkish hospitality at its best!”
Reviews.Author: Shan1982
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the White House hotel for 3 nights after a 2 week tour of Turkey. The service at this hotel from the minute I arrived to when I departed was exceptional. Staff were very friendly and helpful with directions and places of interest. As a young female solo traveller I felt very safe here. The room was very clean and comfortable, above my expectations regardless of the great reviews I had previously read here. My transfer to the airport upon my departure arrived right on the time I requested and I got to the airport without any hassles. The major sites are easy to get to and the Grand Bazaar was only a few minutes walk from the hotel. Highly recommend this hotel to anyone. It made my experience of Istanbul all the more special.

Reviews.Title: “White House has great location, rooms and service”
Reviews.Author: Ncsk
Reviews.Content: My husband and I began our honeymoon in Istanbul, staying at the White House Hotel for a total of 5 nights. We were very impressed by the cleanliness of the modern rooms and the service from the young staff. Elif was the main person we dealt with and she was so friendly and helpful with dinner reservations, recommendations of how to get around and what to see and also making reservations for other hotels in other parts of Turkey. Thanks Elif!!!! Another of the hotel's main draws is its location, in the heart of Sultanahmet about a 5-10 minute walk to Aya Sofia, the Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, the Grand Bazaar, several hammams and not too far a walk from Eminonou where all the ferries are. In any case, if you're not into exploring a city on foot, the very modern and easy-to-use tram was just down the street from the hotel. The breakfasts were a nice added bonus too, great way to start the day. Only thing that my husband and I were discussing that would have been nice would be a rooftop terrace. Coincidentally on our last day, we heard from staff that work is beginning on a new rooftop terrace! Perfect...this place is highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location with wonderful staff!”
Reviews.Author: kmillholen
Reviews.Content: Everything was perfect with our stay at the White House Hotel. I highly recommend this hotel to all staying in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location - fantastic staff”
Reviews.Author: indi2709
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for an clean hotel with a helpful staff next to all the major sights and restaurants... that's the place to be....

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic staff, incredible location, would definitely do again”
Reviews.Author: airholistic
Reviews.Content: Truly a tremendous hotel, never met staff as helpful and sweet. The location is also incredible, right next to all the major sights and a ton of great restaurants. I also stayed at the W hotel during my stay, and honestly preferred the White House!

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: waterboy2009
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in ceter of tourist spots. Walking distance to many sights. You can walk yo Bule mosk from this hotel by few miniuts. The staffs are niceand friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: kafba63
Reviews.Content: I think the title says it all. This was the second time I have stayed at White House Hotel in Suatanahmet. The place is very clean, the staff extremely friendly and helpful. The hotel is on a quiet street but just a minute's walk from dozens of cafes and restaurants. The sites are just a few blocks away. I will stay again on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “best holiday ever!!”
Reviews.Author: andy_duff
Reviews.Content: Me, my wife & son stayed at this wonderful hotel in june, it was just for a week but i wish we stayed longer, perfect location, very friendly staff, always smile on their face and very warm welcoming! As soon as you put your foot in the hotel you can see that you are geting good deal, hotel was well decorated, and welcoming you with a glass of aple tea and turkish delight :) hotel was very easy to find and din t take long from airport. the location is right in the heart of istanbul, you are very close to every thing, and you can walk to every where:) that was realy great deal, we loved this hotel and next year we going back there,! And i want to say thanks to Emrah who works at the reception in the night shift, he was very good with kids, and even kids loved him :) he told us the best places to go without spending much money. that was best holiday ever

Reviews.Title: “To taste the hospitality of the Turkish people”
Reviews.Author: sof_nad
Reviews.Content: This brand new hotel, everything in it is excellent, location, services, cleanness but what make you really feel at home is the staff hospitality and kindness, I have been travelling to many countries and stayed in very big hotels but I have never met such a staff all of them (Jafer, Elif and all the others), they are always there to help and serve you, I will never forget how they helped me to surprise my wife, preparing her a small birthday party, so I really recommend this hotel for a romantic vacation with your spouse or partner you will never forget it.

Reviews.Title: “service with a difference”
Reviews.Author: locoman-7
Reviews.Content: everyone as talked about the location, the comfortable hotel and the nicely decorated rooms, and I agree! What I would like to underline is how far the staff goes to make your stay a wonderful experience. They are genuine, caring people who go on about their duties with respect, interest and pride. Istanbul is an exciting city and the White House an outstanding haven. If you are looking for that extra comfort, personal touch, incredible sense of professionalism, this is the place. A real gem and excellent value for money. Thank you to the people who contributated in making our time in Istanbul a really special one.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Massry
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the WHH from July 24 to July 31. The staff (Emrah, Jafer, Elif, Husin, and Ahmed) were fantastic and very friendly and made us feel home. I strongly recommend this hotel. The hotel is clean and convenient to all attraction. When we go back Istanbul we know where to stay.

Reviews.Title: “very good”
Reviews.Author: rehmzia
Reviews.Content: great location, 5 mins from all major sites in istanbul including blue mosque, topkapi palace, and hagia sophia, staff are very friendly and have good communication in english, some great staff members are emrah, elif, and all the other waiters., i want to say thanks to emrah he was very nice. hotel is new and clean, free tea and cofee, and free one way shuttle from airport. many restaurants and shops within 5 min walking distance from the hotel, and also the hotel is close to the tram line which runs all over istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good & Nice Quite Location. It's My House In Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: fsubae
Reviews.Content: very nice quite & clean hotel. smilly staff from the helpers, reciption & very helpfull. special thanks to Ms. ALLEF for her supporting during our staied in the hotel. excelant location in sultan ahmed & close to the historical places & tram (less than 100 meters to all). # the resturant is small but when i was there constraction was going on the tras to make big resturant & buffet. In general the hotel is not 5 star but the comfertable & rest in that hotel not less than that.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, quiet and clean hotel close to all tourist attractions”
Reviews.Author: AnnieCat16
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the White House Hotel early June 2010 and then returned later in the month. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful and made our stay very enjoyable. The rooms were excellent. Quiet, nicely furnished with incredibly comfortable beds and well appointed bathrooms (good airconditioning and showers too). The hotel is a short stroll from the main street in Sultanahmet so it's close to the restaurants, tram and historic sites. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, excellent location, good service.”
Reviews.Author: Bonifax
Reviews.Content: A pretty small but beautiful place managed with enthusiasm by the people I met there. Customer care is not only a "business word" for them, it is something real. Location is excellent: in ten minutes walk you can reach most of the Istanbul beautys and furthermore you're close to public transport services and taxis. The hotel is brand new, very clean and it is worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and comfort in an awesome location”
Reviews.Author: Leoric912
Reviews.Content: The hotel is perfectly located nearby the Hagia Sofia, bazaars and other main attractions. The staff were without exception helpful, polite and cheerful and made you feel welcome and relaxed. The rooms are spacious and well furnished with large chairs to relax and read in. The only minor complaint is the lack of news programme available on their satellite bouquet. The free internet worked well in the room and the shower was nice and spacious.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: opti45a
Reviews.Content: 5-10 minutes walk from.............Topkapi, Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, McDonalds, Domino's Pizza, Subway, Burger King and an Indian Restaurant only 3 minutes away! Sevice impeccable, rooms elegant and hotel ideal base to explore Sultanahmet. The only minor queries were that the hotel is at the top of a hill, none of the taxi drivers we had seemed to know it's location, even when presented with the hotel card and breakfast was basic

Reviews.Title: “We loved staying at the White House Hotel”
Reviews.Author: portorafti
Reviews.Content: The staff was always very attentive and cheerful, and provided excellent and prompt service. We felt welcomed from the moment we arrived, and loved the welcome and parting gifts -- a very nice touch! The breakfast was excellent. Our triple room was spacious for 3 and even accommodated an extra cot quite well. Everything was clean and comfortable. The air conditioning worked beautifully and the bathroom was very nice, with plenty of hot water for 4 showers. The hotel's location was conveniently located near many important sites. We would definitely stay at the White House Hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with excellent location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Susannaka
Reviews.Content: Neat hotel in walking distance to top sights: Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Basilica Cictern, Bazaars and Cagaloglu Hamam. Clean rooms, elevator and breakfest. Really good service with free transportation from the airport and useful tips about Istanbul. Special thanks to Elif for really superb service! I would definatelly come here again.

Reviews.Title: “A welcome retreat in the heart of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Breakpoint
Reviews.Content: I spent a weekend recently at the White House Hotel in Istanbul. The location of the hotel is in the heart of the old city, a short walk to most of the sites a newcomer would want to visit. But convenience alone does not make a stay at the White House Hotel special, it is the staff. From my early morning arrival until I left, I felt like a member of their family, and not a paying guest. I have never felt more welcome in a hotel. Be sure to have Emrah read your Turkish Coffee grounds!

Reviews.Title: “This is the best, forget the rest!”
Reviews.Author: pjf000
Reviews.Content: This little boutique hotel was unbelievably good - from the moment of being picked up at the airport to leaving 3 days later. Istanbul is an interesting city, to say the least, and this hotel is an oasis in a desert. In all my years of travel this one would have to be in the top 5.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL”
Reviews.Author: Shelly2013
Reviews.Content: My new husband and I spend 2 wonderful nights at the White house before getting on our cruise. We LOVED not only Istanbul, but the White House hotel! Service, cleanliness, and location was PERFECT!!!! Thank you for a wonderful start to our honeymoon.....

Reviews.Title: “A hotel we would consider a shining Gem in the Old District”
Reviews.Author: cbowers1960
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel! New, Inpecably clean. A young professional staff that was very helpful, friendly and a real pleasure. In room safe and refrigerator/mini bar were a plus for us. Easy walking distance to major attractions, restaurants and the tram. We compared with other hotels in the area and very comparable and in fact a good rate because of being new. We enjoyed the beverage and greeting upon arrival. The staff offered beverages each time we were in the lobby. From Harun, the manager to Elif, Jafre and Emrah at the front desk to Yamur in the cafe and the other staff we would like to thank you for a great experience in Istanbul. We would recommend this hotel to anyone as it exceeded our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel deserves number 1 placing”
Reviews.Author: AndrewinMiami
Reviews.Content: I was so pleasantly surprised by the White House Hotel. Just a few steps from Sultahmet Square but far enough away not to be noisy. I was professionally welcomed by Emrah and Hoseyin with a welcome drink and Turkish delight. This morning when I left at 4.00am, not only did they handle my trip to the airport but while we were waiting, they were kind enough to make coffee and bring cake. I have never had such service. This nicely located boutique hotel offers clean, newly decorated rooms with free WIFI, minibar and safe box. The breakfast included in the price was superb with a wide selection of fresh fruit, cakes, cereal etc etc. All staff on the front desk greeted us as we left and came back to the hotel and were always there when we needed help. They really wanted to go out of their way to make our stay as nice as possible. NOTE Some of my colleagues stayed at the Swissotel at more than 3 times the price but I think they got less than a third of the service I received. I for one will be booking a room at the White House next time I am in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is as good as all the tripadvisor reviews suggest”
Reviews.Author: kend02222
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at this hotel in June and had a great time there. The service was excellent, the room was comfortable and clean, and prices were very inexpensive. The location is right by all of the key sites so you can't ask for anything more from that standpoint. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great 5 night stay”
Reviews.Author: chimbo
Reviews.Content: I do agree with all the great reviews written, albeit I would praise the hotel for even sending you the link and asking for 5 stars ! The good parts are well documented, the location cannot be beat for both being at the heart of the old town, but also 3 mins from the tram for access over to the new town, with its much better /authentic nightlife. The service is the very best, with all staff being really helpful, and letting me use the laptop free of charge. Breakfast was reasonable, albeit after 5 days you do get a bit bored - some more loacl food like houmous would be good ! The actual room was very nice, with just enough room for our packs, a good bed, and plenty of light. The bathroom was excellent with a powerful shower. Our only issue is that the windows did not really block all the noise out, and the curtains let all the light in. As others have said, it is a noisy city, and that is not the hotels fault, but better glazing / fitting windows and heavier curtains would help. I am not a great sleeper it has to be said but I had to use ear plugs with a disturbed / homeless person sleeping across the street who would then shout out in the morning. The value mark really reflects the city as a whole - it just seemed a bit pricing for a relatively cheap country.

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to all the reviews!”
Reviews.Author: Tel3005
Reviews.Content: A wonderful hotel with superb service from every single member of staff. Everyone made us feel very welcome and helped with everything we needed, from restaurant recommendations, taxis to a quick turnround laundry service! When we return to Istanbul we will definitely return to the White House.

Reviews.Title: “They couldn't have been nicer!!”
Reviews.Author: Crucero71
Reviews.Content: Great middle of the road hotel. The service was outstanding the staff couldn't have been more helpful. This is a quirky hotel that provides a great location, clean rooms, 900 TV channels (none of which were worth watching) and reasonable value for money. What made our stay there completely memorable was the friendly and attentive staff. We recommend it for that alone.

Reviews.Title: “very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: salokin50
Reviews.Content: outstanding staff, good location, room clean, breakfast foremost the coffee could be better. No view.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort and excellent customer service, smack in the centre of the Old City”
Reviews.Author: slinkyfran
Reviews.Content: White House Hotel is one of the best rated hotels in Istanbul - and with reason. From a warm welcome with cocktails (non-alcoholic), friendly staff and comfortable rooms, we were made to feel at home in this small but extermely efficient hotel. Great location, excellent customer service - can't rate it enough.

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming hospitality at White House hotel”
Reviews.Author: sammybeeSanDiego
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights at White house and appreciated the nicely appointed room, friendly and helpful staff, and easy walking distance to all tourist spots in Sultanahmet. As has been stated by others, the breakfast was disappointing, but not terrible. During our stay there was some construction going on next door, which was a bit annoying, but at bedtime was not an issue. Our only problem was that for our first two nights we were right beside a family room with extremely loud and misbehaving children. The front desk was helpful in dealing with this situation, but we were glad when they left. In general, good value and a pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Simply a quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: MollyandSteve
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights at the White House hotel. Simply put this place gets it all right. Front desk and breakfast staff are friendly, helpful and competent. Rooms are stylish and spotlessly clean. Breakfast has everything you need to start you off on a day of sightseeing. Location is in a historic part of town and central to a lot of the main sights. We had a late flight out of Istanbul. Not only did the hotel hold our bags while we spent the day sightseeing (as you'd expect), they also offered us a room to use to shower and change before we went to the airport. A nice touch which is one example why this hotel gets the top rating.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value and a Great Room”
Reviews.Author: thompson8484
Reviews.Content: This is essentially a luxury hotel at a great value price. It is situated in the heart of the Sultanahmet District and all of the top sights of Istanbul are easily accessible from this location. It was great going on our honeymoon here, spending the day looking at ancient wonders and the evening and night sitting outside at restaurants a block from our hotel watching World Cup games and eating great Turkish food.

Reviews.Title: “Already looking forward to returning to this fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Jo64adventures
Reviews.Content: A mate and I stayed in this wonderful Sultanahmet hotel for 5 nights and we'd go back again tomorrow given half a chance. Well deserves it's top spot. Arrival: We walked from the train station which is definitely do-able as long as you know where you're going. We nearly made it, then asked directions when nearby and got a bit lost. I rang the hotel and they sent someone out to meet us and carry our bags to the hotel. Very good service. Check-in friendly with excellent English and a cold drink/Turkish delight was very welcome :-) Room: we stayed in room 202 (see pics). Great decor. Sumptuous but not OTT. Definitely has the 'wow' factor when you open the door to your room. All gold and cream. Two 'throne' chairs fab. Bathroom nice, clean, good shower, basket of shampoos, hair- dryer attached to wall etc. Room has a minibar, kettle with selection of teas and a TV (little in English language, but you won't want to be in your room much with the surroundings!). Location: Excellent. A quiet street as close as you'd want to be to the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, the archaeological museum, Basillica Cistern, Topkapi Palace (see the treasure rooms and the harem) and mausoleums (all really worth a visit; see pics). The hotel recommended a restaurant 2 mins walk away (Adonin) which was great. Try the Turkish lamb/chicken dish cooked in a narrow-necked terracotta pot that they break open in front of you to serve the dish. The Bazaar is a short walk away and there are tram stops near the hotel. Lots of eateries nearby. Service: Outstanding. Young, friendly, professional staff, really happy to help. One of them found us a 10 euro per head option to get to the airport on the other side of the Bosphorus (about a 45 m in drive on quietish Sunday roads) rather than the 40 euro a head option we'd expected. We were greeted with smiles and pleasantries every time we saw any of the staff and given helpful advice and information. The staff spoke very good English. Breakfast: Very nice. Everything we wanted was there in terms of cereal, bread, fresh fruit (greengages, nectarines, melon, cherries etc), salad, olives, cold meat and cheese. Not a massive selection of hot food but we didn't really fancy that anyway as it was hot weather. Breakfast room is lovely (see pic). Ambiance: Our room was quiet except for a little bit of noise from building works next door (it really didn't bother me and I actually tend to get irritated by that kind of noise) and a bit of noise when it rained (in June we had quite alot of rain which apparently is unheard of). There was a down-pipe on the adjacent building where rainwater splashed down onto a roof. I shouldn't think it'd be a problem for most people as rain isn't frequent, and to be honest it wasn't bad. I slept through it easily. The calls to prayer were no bother in terms of volume. I never heard the 5.30am one even though I sleep reasonably lightly. The view from the window was another building, but the muslin curtains screened this tastefully. I thought the room was fabulous and I didn't miss a balcony which I might normally hanker for. Comfort: Beds very comfortable. Housekeeping kept everything spotless. Overall: I struggle to find anything bad to say about this charming, small hotel. There are few enough rooms for it to lack the impersonal feeling of bigger hotels and the vibe was friendly and upbeat. Value for money is good and I really hope that White House keeps its standards high as it was a real find. If you are thinking about booking: do it.

Reviews.Title: “excellent place”
Reviews.Author: h0munculus
Reviews.Content: Good location in Sultanahmet district: just 3 minutes from all main sights (Ayasofya, Blue mosque, TopkapÄ±, Yerebatan etc..). It is new and very clean hotel with hearty welcome! Breakfast was adequate (fruits, eggs, sausages, cheese, vegetables...). Very comfortable place for good money!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: familiedejong
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in the center of Istanbul, only 5 minutes walk from the Haya Sofia, Blue Mosk, Topkai Palace and Big Bazar. Several very pleasant restaurants just around the corner, where you can still eat for a reasonable price. Personnel is extremely kind and helpful. Although the rooms are not really big, they are new and very clean. When you go to Istanbul, don't miss this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: gmholland
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was great in a great location, close to all the tourist sites of Istanbul. The Staff were very freindly and always willing to help. The hotel itself was clean and the rooms comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “well deserved number one position”
Reviews.Author: eye35
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for our first trip to Istanbul based on the reviews on tripadvisor and we were not let down. The staff were brilliant, very welcoming, friendly and extremely helpful. The hotel was perfect with regards to its location with just a short walk to all the major sites and very good restaurants. The temperature was in the 30's and the room air conditioning was great - efficient and not too noisy. The rooms were small but you don't spend much time in them and they had everything you need for a short break, comfortable beds and pillows, a very good powerful shower with nice toiletries, and a kettle for that all important cup of tea or coffee! Istanbul is a traffic nightmare so we booked transfers with the hotel and we were not disappointed. We were picked up from Sabiha airport on the Asian side on arrival and taken back on departure which made the trip less hassle and stressless. (it's hard to even work out what the buses say on them - let alone find out a route). We walked everywhere, even to Taksim, but the tram is only a 5min walk from the hotel and the hop-on hop-off bus tour is a great way to see all this massive city in comfort. The staff at the hotel can organise sightseeing for you and recommend lots of good local restaurants. Enjoy this hotel - it deserves its position - we'll be going back one day!

Reviews.Title: “Beyond expectations”
Reviews.Author: viperpilot1
Reviews.Content: Stayed for several nights with my wife and 16 y/o son. Rooms beautiful,breakfast good, location perfect. Tons of restaurants,recommend the Adonin, 2mins walk. The staff are eager and helpfull,and the value is unbeatable. All the major sites are within walking distance[easily] and the prices of restaurants and fast food are very good.

Reviews.Title: “The best of all the hotels we stayed at in Turkey”
Reviews.Author: margueriteOttawa
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel because of the Number 1 rating on Trip Advisor. We were not disappointed - it was exceptional. The location, rooms, staff were all wonderful. The hotel is near all the major sights, close to wonderful eating spots and markets and bazaars. The rooms are exceptional which to us is a must. Large and comfortable - wonderful furnishings. It is only 6 months old - and still perfect. The staff are friendly; knowledgeable and very helpful - laundry service fast and not expensive - mini bar prices were reasoable - unlike most of the other hotels we stayed at in Turkey.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Nat99L
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the White House Hotel for four nights in May during our "city beak" holiday. The hotel is excellent. It is well located near all the major tourist sites. The staff are both friendly and helpful and our room was clean and comfortable. When we next visit Istanbul we will definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “We Loved Our Stay at The White House Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hildy1
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed three nights. Even though we arrived very early in the morning having disembarked a cruise ship, we were invited to leave our luggage since check-in was not available. We were given a welcome juice and turkish delight. While we sat in the lobby to figure out our plans, we were told our room would be ready in one half hour which it was (someone had checked out). We were invited to have breakfast. We found the staff very friendly, responsive, helpful at all times and were given a token gift of turkish delight upon our departure, which was a nice touch. . When I had a slight problem with the TV, the staff came up to the room, rather than try to explain it over the phone. There are about five steps to negotiate when entering or leaving the hotel. The elevator for the rest of the hotel was excellent, however. The hotel is very clean and modern. Yes, there is some construction, but really the noise is only during the daytime when one is out sightseeing. When we were exhausted from the heat, we found we were so tired and glad to be in our room for a cool rest, we did not find it offensive. We cannot say enough about the location, which we found to be excellent. Our cab driver did not know where it was exactly but they ask each other and it was no problem getting there. There is a small friendly neighborhood grocery on the corner with very reasonable prices. He invited us to sit and have apple tea at his place complimentary, which we did not. Walking just one half block in either direction, one finds numerous restaurants including our favorite Kharasoni which we also recommend. The best features of the hotel are its working air conditioning, which we have heard can be a problem in Istanbul, its cleanliness, its very nice breakfast with good service, friendliness of the staff and, definitely, the LOCATION. Only a block and a half from the Cisterns and about two blocks to the Blue Mosque and the Hagia Sophia. We never actually had to take the tram. We could walk to the hop on, hop off bus, also only a couple of blocks away, which we took to get a terrific overview of the city. Also we found a convenient shortcut way to walk from the Grand Bazaar by asking parked tour bus drivers who knew exactly how to direct us. We were very pleased with our stay and would definitely stay there again. We recommended it to a tourist couple walking by who asked us as their air conditioning in their hotel was not working and it was very hot and humid. We also enjoyed meeting Berkun the owner of the restaurant Anatolia around the corner where we also ate. We also very much appreciated the complimentary ride in a large van to the airport. Other hotels I had contacted offered only rides FROM the hotel. Since we arrived on the cruise ship we needed a ride TO the airport. The White House Hotel was the only place to cordially agree to take us to the airport. It was exactly as they described it to us in their email, a boutique hotel and we were very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “the white house is exactly where you need to be.”
Reviews.Author: susansh47
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the white house for 4 nights with husband sister and brother in law. The hotel was very clean and well decorated, the staff were amazingly friendly and helpful. The shower was very modern with lots of different functions. The Breakfast was adequate. The best thing about the hotel is its location you are right in the centre of all the main tourist destinations in Istanbul, with good reasonably priced restaurants on the doorstep. Also about 400 yards from a Tram stop which takes you to a ferry for a bosphorus trip or to the grand bazaar.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic and helpfull staff, immaculate, and in a central location”
Reviews.Author: Ritchiescotland
Reviews.Content: We read the reviews before we booked this hotel. It lived up to our expectations. The staff were very helpfull, Elif was always smiling and gave us excelllent advice. She even painstakingly translated the recipe for the delicious apple cake that was on offer for breakfast for me. Emnah and all the rest of the staff couldn't be faulted. The good humoured cleaner was also a joy. The only criticism I would have was that the room was small, and the cases would have been an issue had we not been able to get them on top of the wardrobe, two seats in the room would also have been greatly appreciated, but the room was so small it would have been impossible.

Reviews.Title: “Well located hotel”
Reviews.Author: lair12
Reviews.Content: Very well located hotel just five minutes to the Sultanamet tram stop. Probably a decent three star hotel so worth the $125 a night we paid. We got there via mass transit, but when we left the hotel was very nice and paid for our cab to Taksim Square where we caught the Havas bus to the more distant airport. Large clean room with very good air conditioning. No back side view, but good quiet room to stay at. Good wireless and OK breakfast, but nothing to rave about food-wise.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: noreen71
Reviews.Content: when we arrived at the hotel the staff quickly ran to the taxi to help us open the door and carry the bags for us. we were welcomed by the reception with welcome drink and were given a very good information about the hotel. we were given choices to choose any rooms that we like either on ground or 1st floor. the service was so excellent and fast, the rooms are tidy, clean and big enough for both of us. breakfast is ok but the most important things are the hotel locations are just walking distance to the attractions places. the internet service is free and fast connection. on the last day we were asking how to get a yellow taxi from the hotel but the manager has offered us a free ride to taksim square.

Reviews.Title: “Good, clean well located Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ESB87
Reviews.Content: For what we paid I'm not sure we could get better, excellent location for sights, restaurants and trams. Originally looked to stay in a more expensive boutique hotel, but unable to get the dates we wanted, I took this hotel on recommendation from Trip Advisor, and am more than pleased we did. The hotel is clean, the staff very friendly and helpful, the only area that could improve is the breakfast, but at these prices I feel it a bit harsh to complain.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: LGHM
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at the White House hotel and I can say service an attitude is of the highest standards. The hotel is a few steps away from Hagia Sophia, the Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace and also from the Sultanhamet tram station. The area is surrounded by many restaurants with excellent turkish food and many of them have a section on the street. I highly recommend this hotel and I am willing to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT LOCATION, WONDERFUL HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Lydia_pirounaki
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel and service! Very clean and comfortable rooms. Young but very professional staff, friendly and willing to provide you with any kind of information. The distance to the sightseeings (Aghia Sophia, Blue Mosque, Grand Bazaar) is just 5 minutes walk! Just perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Deserves its number one rating”
Reviews.Author: NYTravelcritic
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here overnight on our way back to the States after finishing a 2 week trip through Turkey. We had heard that we would not be disappointed as another couple on our same tour had stayed there earlier. The service was excellent and we were even upgraded to a bigger room upon our arrival despite the fact that we were only staying one night We were waited on hand and foot and would most certainly stay here again. Staff was very helpful and we felt well looked after

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: Sector9Boy
